title: R Markdown: ON YOUR MARKS, GET SET, GO!!
description:
Hello, R enthusiasts!!!
Would you like to analyse your data, share and reproduce your results, All in one go?
Let's do it with R Markdown !!!

Come join us in our upcoming meet-up "R Markdown: On Your Marks, Get Set, GO!!!"

> ? What is R Markdown
R Markdown allows you to generate documents of all types (reports, presentations, books, etc.) with embedded R code and outputs (plots, tables, figures etc.).

> ? Who is this for
This introduction is appropriate for anyone with a general interest in R and R Markdown.

>? Prerequisites
Prior knowledge in R programming language is recommended but not necessary.
Attendees are expected to have the most recent version of R and RStudio installed on their own computers, along with the following packages and their dependencies.

`install.packages(c("tidyverse","knitr","rmarkdown"))`

Here are links to free downloads for R (https://cran.r-project.org/) and RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download).

> ? When
Monday, 28 December from 5.00pm - 6.30 pm ( Time Zone - GMT+5.30, India)

> ? Where
We'll be live on Zoom.

Join Zoom Meeting
https://learn.zoom.us/j/66645976860?pwd=MkhQMVhvdWFRdlQ1UWVEUXZDanN2Zz09

Meeting ID: 666 4597 6860

> ? Agenda

GO!"

More Networking | Wrap up

title: Microbenchmarking: measuring and improving R code performance
description:
Welcome!

We are so thrilled to have Semiramis Castro as our speaker in our last event of the year. In this session we will discuss the core concepts about Microbenchmarking - that is, how to measure and improve performance of R code. We will base this session on chapter 23 and 24 of the Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/) by Hadley Wickham.

About R-Ladies NL book club
----------------------
This is the grand finale of a series of events based on Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book, hosted by R-Ladies chapters of the Netherlands.

You can find the slides and materials from previous sessions at: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

About Semiramis
----------------------
Semiramis is a software developer/data scientist who codes mainly in R and Python. She's a recent PhD graduate from the National Autonomous University of Mexico with a focus on genomics of pathogenic bacteria and antibiotic resistance. Among the bacteria she studied are the emerging pathogen Acinetobacter haemolyticus and the deadly Acinetobacter baumannii.

Event link
----------------------
We host our events in Jitsi (Note that Jitsi works best with chrome)

Link: https://meet.jit.si/rladies_bookclub_performance

Code of Conduct
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: ¬°Fin de a√±o y primer meetup de R-Ladies Jujuy!
description:
Este pr√≥ximo lunes 21 de diciembre de 2020 a las 17 hrs presentaremos este nuevo cap√≠tulo de R-Ladies en Argentina, y qu√© mejor manera de hacerlo que hablando de R? L@s invitamos a charlar y compartir informaci√≥n de paquetes de R, herramientas, ciencia y principios FAIR en un ambiente amigable y distendido con la charla: Produciendo mi pr√≥ximo art√≠culo cient√≠fico con R: Compendios de Investigaci√≥n, Reproducibilidad e Interactividad en las publicaciones acad√©micas.

Oradora invitada: Florencia D'Andrea (R-Ladies Buenos Aires y global team)
Muchas personas han migrado desde distintos tipos de software a usar R y RStudio para realizar los an√°lisis de datos que luego formar√°n parte de publicaciones. Surge una pregunta disparadora:
¬øQu√© hacemos con el c√≥digo y los datos producto de nuestras investigaciones?

- El arte de compartir - Un Compendio de Investigaci√≥n es una forma ordenada de dejar disponible manuscrito, datos y c√≥digo para que otr@ investigador@ (y un@ mism@ en el futuro) pueda reproducir tanto los resultados como el art√≠culo facilmente. ¬°Y adem√°s se puede crear desde R!
Donde antes usabas un editor de texto, ahora podes usar RMarkdown ¬øC√≥mo entra en juego dentro del compendio?¬øPor qu√© deber√≠a incluir una licencia?
R nos abre muchas posibilidades al momento de comunicar a otr@s investigadores o al p√∫blico en general nuestros resultados de una forma m√°s efectiva ¬øPodemos publicar gr√°ficos interactivos con {plotly} o dejar disponibles shiny apps? ¬øC√≥mo?

- ¬øEst√°s list@ para hacer ciencia abierta? - Algunas revistas comienzan a requerir el acceso al c√≥digo y bases de datos para un mayor impacto de sus art√≠culos ¬øPor qu√© es necesario asegurar lo m√°s posible la reproducibilidad computacional? Mencionaremos algunas herramientas de R que pueden ayudarte a mejorar de forma sencilla reproducibilidad, como el paquete {renv}.
Finalmente, reflexionemos junt@s: ¬øQu√© ventajas/desventajas tiene liberar nuestros datos y c√≥digo? ¬øPreferimos calidad o cantidad en lo que refiere a los art√≠culos cient√≠ficos? ¬øDeber√≠a ser as√≠?

Aclaraciones Importantes
‚Ä¢ La charla no supone ning√∫n tipo de conocimiento de R especifico previo. De todas formas, podr√°s disfrutar m√°s matices si escribiste algo de c√≥digo en R con fines acad√©micos.
‚Ä¢ Se realizar√°n algunas demostraciones en vivo para que todo lo expuesto sea claro y sencillo de entender.
‚Ä¢ Enviaremos el link al evento por mail a aquellos inscript@s antes del evento ¬°No te olvides de confirmar tu asistencia en meetup!

title: Automatic & Explainable Machine Learning in R with H2O
description:
Hi, everybody!
We hope that you and your family are doing well. We are super excited to have Erin, co-founder of R-Ladies global, founder of the Women in Machine Learning and Data Science and Chief Machine Learning Scientist at H2O.ai to bring you a workshop on Automatic and Explainable Machine Learning in R with H2O!

DESCRIPTION
----------------------

H2O is an open source, distributed machine learning platform is designed to scale to very large datasets. H2O AutoML provides an easy-to-use interface which automates data pre-processing, training and tuning a large selection of candidate models from a single function, `h2o.automl()`. The result of the AutoML run is a "leaderboard" of H2O models, which can be then be explained automatically using the H2O Explainability interface.

The models can be explained individually, and also compared as a group and both global (model-wise) and local (row-wise) explainations are available. The `h2o.explain()` function generates a list of explanations ‚Äì individual units of explanation such as a Partial Dependence plot or a Variable Importance plot. Most of the explanations are visual ‚Äì these plots can also be created by individual utility functions outside the `h2o.explain()` function. The visualization engine used in the R interface is the ggplot2 package and in Python, we use matplotlib.

R code with a full demo will be provided, which can be used to automatically train and explain models on your own dataset.

PROGRAMME
----------------------
19.00-19.05 Virtual Welcome
19.05- 20.30 Talk & Q&A

ABOUT ERIN
----------------------
https://www.linkedin.com/in/erin-ledell/
Erin LeDell is the Chief Machine Learning Scientist at H2O.ai, the company that produces the open source, distributed machine learning platform, H2O. At H2O.ai, she leads the H2O AutoML project and her current research focus is automated machine learning. Before joining H2O.ai, she was the Principal Data Scientist at Wise.io (acquired by GE) and Marvin Mobile Security (acquired by Veracode), the founder of DataScientific, Inc. and a software engineer. She is also founder of the Women in Machine Learning and Data Science (WiMLDS) organization (wimlds.org) and co-founder of R-Ladies Global (rladies.org). Erin received her Ph.D. in Biostatistics with a Designated Emphasis in Computational Science and Engineering from University of California, Berkeley and has a B.S. and M.A. in Mathematics.

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn.

description:
Our December 2020 will feature two speakers:

- Lisa Hopcroft (Public Health Scotland) - Obtaining Scottish public transport information
- Lydia Gabriela Speyer (University of Edinburgh) - Modelling Dynamic Change in Longitudinal Data

Passcode for the Zoom call will be emailed on the day of the event.

--

R-Ladies is a worldwide organization whose mission is to promote gender diversity in the R community.

A question we often get is "Are men welcome to attend this event?"

As a diversity initiative, the mission of R-Ladies is to achieve proportionate representation by encouraging, inspiring, and empowering people of genders currently underrepresented in the R community. R-Ladies‚Äô primary focus, therefore, is on supporting minority gender R enthusiasts to achieve their programming potential, by building a collaborative global network of R leaders, mentors, learners, and developers to facilitate individual and collective progress worldwide.

**As such, we strongly encourage cis-men who attend this event come as guests of R-Ladies who are minority genders (including but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender).**

All attendees are strongly encouraged to review the R-Ladies Code of Confuct (https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct) and must abide by it.

title: R-Ladies SB 1st Annual Ugly Plot Contest
description:
Hi R-Ladies SB and beyond,

Please join us for some end-of-the-year holiday cheer as we embark on our first annual Ugly Plot Contest! This will be an evening of collaborative coding with the intention of making the ugliest plot possible by demonstrating ways NOT to display your data. As a bonus, creators of the ugliest plots will be mailed R-Ladies SB hex stickers :D

To make these plots, we‚Äôll be using a data set about holiday sweaters, taken from a survey of folks all around the world - however, we‚Äôd love your data too! If you have a moment, please fill out this survey about your holiday sweater(s), and your data will be featured in our contest:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd37uWHUgp-Gd5833ECGXdszKLBV6kpdpigT-yIMTXkCwyKXg/viewform?usp=sf_link

Please also feel free to share this survey with friends/family/colleagues (the more data, the better!).

Survey notes:
- If you are lucky enough to have MORE THAN ONE sweater, please fill out this form once for each sweater you have!! #tidydata
- If you have a sweater, please fill out every question! 'No' responses are useful.
- If you DON'T have a holiday sweater, you can leave the rest blank

Instructions for installing R/RStudio or setting up Git/GitHub can be found near the bottom of our GitHub‚Äôs README (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_santabarbara/blob/gh-pages/README.md), and the Zoom link will become available upon RSVPing. We‚Äôll make these ugly sweater data available as we get a bit closer to the event.

Looking forward to seeing you!

The R-Ladies SB organizers

title: R-Ladies Baltimore -- Reticulate RStudio and your R code with Python (Virtual)
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

The next event is Wednesday December 16, 2020 from 3-4:30pm (virtual meetup on Zoom). We are so excited to welcome Tiffany Timbers (https://www.tiffanytimbers.com) from the Department of Statistics and a Co-Director for the Master of Data Science program (Vancouver Option) at the University of British Columbia! She will presenting on how to leverage Python within R and RStudio using the reticulate (https://rstudio.github.io/reticulate/) R package!

WHO is this for?
- If you are new to R & but curious about Python!
- If you analyze data in R, but on the job market and need to learn how to leverage wonderful Python libraries!
- If you use R and collaborate with other researchers who use Python and are looking for strategies on how to collaborate and write code together!

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA
3:00‚Äì3:15pm Who we are | Announcements | What's next
3:15‚Äì4pm Presentation: Reticulate RStudio and your R code with Python
4‚Äì4:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:
The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

FAQ:
Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:
- If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:
email: bmore@rladies.org
twitter: @RLadiesBmore
facebook: https://www.facebook.com/RLadiesBmore/

title: Our Year in Data
description:
Join us for lunch time lightning talks exploring our favorite data visualizations of 2020. Sign up to present here (https://forms.gle/iANLN28nNvZCwV1q8).

Many of us participate in TidyTuesday, a weekly social data project in R (https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday). Present your favorite project from this year's TidyTuesday's data sets, or another data set you found interesting in 2020.

If you want to learn more about TidyTuesday or get help with a project, we'll host "office hours" the week before on our R-Ladies Slack channel. Please message the meeting host if you need to be invited to the Slack channel.

Office hours: 12-1pm on December 8th and 9th.

title: 2020 GoodRbye!
description:

title: ‚Äòggstatsplot‚Äô : ‚Äòggplot2‚Äô Based Plots with Statistical Details
description:
We are pleased to invite you to our next meetup which will serve as an overview of the R Package ‚Äòggstatsplot‚Äô: ‚Äòggplot2‚Äô Based Plots with Statistical Details.

"ggstatsplot" is an extension of "ggplot2". It creates graphics with details from statistical tests included in the plots themselves. It is targeted primarily at behavioral sciences community to provide a one-line code to generate information-rich plots for statistical analysis of continuous (violin plots, scatterplots, histograms, dot plots, dot-and-whisker plots) or categorical (pie and bar charts) data. Currently, it supports only the most common types of statistical tests: parametric, nonparametric, robust, and bayesian versions of t-test/anova, correlation analyses, contingency table analysis, and regression analyses.

This wonderful R package is created by Indrajeet Patil. Come & join us to learn more about it https://github.com/IndrajeetPatil/ggstatsplot

‚ñ∂Ô∏è About Indrajeet Patil https://sites.google.com/site/indrajeetspatilmorality/
Indrajeet Patil is a Postdoctoral Researcher at the Center for Humans and Machines, Max Planck Institute for Human Development, Berlin. He has a Ph.D. in cognitive neuroscience and specializes in investigating the psychological and neural basis of social judgment and decision-making. He is also an active R package developer and part of `easystats` team.

Date/Time : Tuesday, December 15, 2020 6PM -> 7PM (Tunisia time GMT+1)
Place : Google Meet

title: Sharing and outlook workshop: My experience with R and the next step!
description:
Hello everyone,

How time flies! It is already December of 2020. It‚Äôs a perfect time to do a little bit of wrap-up and outlook for the next year.

Just imagine:
We are gathering in a (virtual!) warm and cozy room to share the R-tricks you learned in 2020, your recently-found favorite R-package, or your plan for how to explore R-world during the coming year. Wrap yourself in a blanket and enjoy your favorite beverage while discussing your stories and thoughts with others and inspire one another! Afterward, Diandian Yi will share insights from an R-book to further warm up your brain and fingers!

13:00-13:10 Welcome and introduction by the co-organizers of R-Ladies Bergen.

13:10-14:00 Sharing and outlook: this is an informal panel discussion. Please feel free to contribute your questions and thoughts. You can sign up for the time slot (max. 10 minutes) through the link below: https://doodle.com/poll/nun7knz57f4kgwy8?utm_source=poll&utm_medium=link

Feel free contact us if you have an interesting topic but the spots are all booked!

14:00-14:30 Book insight sharing: 10 pitfalls in the course of getting tidy data (contents extracted from Hadley Wickham's books, "R for data science" (https://r4ds.had.co.nz/) and "Advanced R" (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/)) ‚Äî prepared by Diandian Yi (Data analyst)

title: R4 Data Science Study Group
description: Monday, Dec 14th will be the first meeting of our virtual R4DS study group. During the first meeting we'll review exercises for the first three chapters (through the end of Data Visualization) of R4DS (access the free, online textbook here https://r4ds.had.co.nz/). Please remember to sign up to lead the study group through a set of exercises. We plan to meet twice a week (each Monday and Wednesday) for approximately 30 minutes to cover the key exercises of each chapter. All are welcome.

title: End of Year Celebration!
description:
Merry Christmas Everyone!

To celebrate the end of 2020 please join us on December 14th for our annual Christmas networking event!

This will be an in-person event held outside at the Fitzroy Gardens. We'll meet at 5pm at Cook's Cottage, please bring a picnic rug if you have one.

In line with COVID restrictions we are capping this event at 50 people, so be sure to respond quickly if you would like to attend.

We're looking forward to seeing you there!

From all the R-Ladies organisers, we hope everyone has a safe and happy holiday season!

title: Intro to R
description:
TOPIC
We are very excited for our first R-Ladies Saudi Arabia online event! This session will be led by Batool Almarzouq - a bioinformatician Ph.D. researcher at the University of Liverpool. In the session, Batool will introduce R-Ladies organisation, what is R used for, and talk us through the fundamentals of R. So whether you‚Äôre an R novice or a more experienced R user, hopefully, there‚Äôll be some useful tips for you!

ONLINE PROGRAMME
The event will be held online and will start at 9:00 am. The Zoom link will be sent after you complete the registration.

CODE OF CONDUCT
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct -- we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

R-Ladies events are always free and open to anyone who wants to participate as long as they follow the code of conduct. We are pro-actively inclusive of all minority identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R

Actualmente es Analista de Data en Telef√≥nica del Per√∫ y miembro del Grupo de Investigaci√≥n en Inteligencia Artificial de la PUCP. Finalmente, como meta personal Gina siente pasi√≥n por acercar a m√°s personas al mundo de la investigaci√≥n y la ciencia de datos.

Trabajo en una Estaci√≥n Experimental Agropecuaria, por lo que mis desarrollos y soluciones est√°n relacionados con la realidad productiva de la provincia de La Pampa, donde vivo con mi esposo y mis dos hermosos hijos.

Relaciono mi trabajo en INTA con mi trabajo en la Comunidad R buscando hacer que mi ciencia sea lo m√°s reproducible y abierta posible utilizando software libre. title: Introdu√ß√£o ao Git e GitHub no RStudio
description:
O Git √© um software de controle de vers√µes que tem como objetivo gerenciar arquivos texto, principalmente c√≥digos de programa√ß√£o. O funcionamento dessa ferramenta √© semelhante aos sistemas de nuvens (Google Drive, Dropbox, Mega, etc), em que podemos compartilhar as edi√ß√µes de um script com uma equipe, al√©m de retomar antigas vers√µes de nossos arquivos.

Resumidamente, o Git examina as mudan√ßas realizadas nos arquivos de um diret√≥rio e vai guardando essas informa√ß√µes para compartilhar com outros usu√°rios e/ou possibilitar a revers√£o de altera√ß√µes realizadas. Al√©m de ser uma ferramenta extremamente √∫til, o Git se conecta ao servi√ßo de hospedagem e armazenamento de vers√µes chamado GitHub. A partir do GitHub √© poss√≠vel contribuir com projetos de qualquer lugar do mundo, al√©m de compartilhar os nossos pr√≥prios c√≥digos com fins de divulga√ß√£o e/ou colabora√ß√£o.

A partir do RStudio temos algumas maneiras bem pr√°ticas de trabalhar com o Git e o GitHub, o que poder√° mudar a sua vida di√°ria nos seus trabalhos com o R!

description:
Title: I know your aesthetic: Using deep neural nets to learn similarity in product design

title: Automating tasks in R to streamline your workflow
description:
Hello R-Ladies!

Do you look at your script and see the same code repeated but with one word changed? Do you wish your script could run thousands of tasks while you take a break? Or does your script already run all those tasks but take forever? In this workshop, we tackle some automation functions (for, apply, mutate) that will help you to streamline code and time to accomplish repetitive tasks in R.

Dr. Kim Dill-McFarland has been teaching data science since her graduate years, including as a teaching fellow at the U. of British Columbia and as a Carpentries certified instructor. She absolutely loves R, using it every day at work as a bioinformatician at the U. of Washington and at home modelling her new kitten's weight gain. Kim strongly believes in open-source tools and the power coding can bring to scientists of all levels and disciplines.

Workshop details:
Day and time: Dec 10th, 2020 at 6pm
Webinar link: RSVP to view link

***
General workshop information:

-Please expect a hands-on session in a friendly and laid-back atmosphere where we all encouraged to learn together.
- All levels!
- Workshop materials: https://github.com/hawn-lab/workshops_UW_Seattle/tree/master/2020.12.10_automation
- Install R: https://mirror.its.sfu.ca/mirror/CRAN/
- Install RStudio (choose the Desktop version): https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download
- Install tidyverse package with install.packages("tidyverse")
- Install penguin data package with install.packages("palmerpenguins")
- Install multiprocessor packages with install.packages(c("foreach", "doParallel"))

**********************IMPORTANT************************

1. Have your computer and a steady internet connection ready

2. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

3. Who is this allowed to attend the workshop?
Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming language in data science, which is R.

To fulfill this mission we do ask participants to respect a focus on the encouragement and support for women and non-binary people during our events.

See you there!

Lisa, Jasmine, Lucia, Zubia, and Yuka

title: Harmonizing Docker and R
description:
This month we will take a short break from tidymodels and talk about containerization with Docker!

Dr. Stephanie LaHaye will introduce us to the world of Docker and will highlight the key reasons why Docker is an excellent and integral tool for anyone aiming to make their code more reproducible and shareable, and why it is essential when sharing to users in outside environments. We will learn how to launch Docker, check for images on our local systems, push and pull from Docker Hub, create a basic Dockerfile, and finally use it to run an Rscript.

Before the presentation, please install Docker by following the instructions for
- mac (https://docs.docker.com/mac/step_one/)
- linux (https://docs.docker.com/linux/step_one/)
- windows (https://docs.docker.com/get-started/)

Stephanie will be presenting from her Mac and she will be using Mac Docker Desktop (https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-mac/install/).

You can find the meetup materials at: https://github.com/sdl002/R_Docker_Intro

Stephanie is a Senior Bioinformatics Scientist at the Institute for Genomic Medicine at Nationwide Children‚Äôs Hospital in Columbus, Ohio. She attended Michigan State University for her undergraduate work where she received a bachelor of science in Genomics and Molecular Genetics and a bachelor of science in Human Biology. She then attended the Ohio State University for her PhD in Molecular Genetics, where she focused on cardiovascular genomics research. After graduate school Stephanie did a postdoc at the Institute for Genomic Medicine, focusing on the development of automated pipelines using serverless technology to handle next generation sequencing data for pediatric cancer patients.

title: Experimento conductual y optogen√©tica: An√°lisis estad√≠stico b√°sico en R
description:
En este taller revisaremos estad√≠stica en R de datos obtenidos de experimentos con la Dra. Sofia Gonz√°lez Salinas.

Sofia Gonz√°lez Salinas es investigadora postdoctoral en la Universidad de Rutgers en Nueva Jersey y estudia las bases neurobiol√≥gicas de la conducta materna y de los des√≥rdenes del √°nimo. Realiz√≥ sus estudios de licenciatura y doctorado en la UNAM. Utiliza R para analizar diversos tipos de datos tales como medidas conductuales en roedores, an√°lisis de la expresi√≥n g√©nica mediante qPCR, bater√≠as psicol√≥gicas y potenciales relacionados con eventos.

Sofia.- En este taller los llevar√© de la mano para conocer el dise√±o experimental y el an√°lisis de datos empleando R de un estudio de conducta materna donde empleo la t√©cnica de optogen√©tica.

Te esperamos para seguir aprendiendo juntxs!!!

title: Data Science as a Team Sport
description:
Hello RiveRside!

Join us for our next virtual meeting of learning and networking, Thursday, December 10th, at 5:00 PM (PST). We will hear from Gabriela de Queiroz, founder of R-Ladies and AI Inclusive. Gabriela will tell us about her career journey, as well as the many different roles a Data Scientist may have.

At the end of the meeting, there will be time to ask any questions you may have about data scientist careers or questions about R in general.

Don't forget to RSVP in our Meetup to get access to the meeting's ID and password.

Big thanks to UCR Library and UCR GradQuant for supporting us.

See you soon!

## Details

~ Data Science as a Team Sport ~

Data Science careers are in high demand, with many job opportunities and attractive salaries. As a relatively new career, it is ambiguously defined, and the job description of a data scientist can vary greatly from company to company. For those reasons, Data Science has attracted both new grads and career changers from all sorts of different fields. For Statisticians, Data Science is an exciting opportunity to apply your hard-earned skills to a variety of interesting and challenging problems. Having a solid Statistics background will give you a head start in that direction. However, Data Science is much more than pure Statistics knowledge. Being able to recognize and take advantage of a team with a diverse set of experiences will provide you with a unique opportunity to grow individually while benefiting your entire team. In this talk, I will walk you through my career journey, the different roles a Data Scientist can take, useful skills for a successful career, and lessons learned.

~ Bio ~
Gabriela de Queiroz is a Sr. Engineering & Data Science Manager at IBM where she manages and leads a team of developers working on Data & AI Open Source projects.
She works to democratize AI by building tools and launching new open source projects. She is passionate about making data science available to everybody and is actively involved with several organizations to foster an inclusive community.
She is the founder of AI Inclusive (ai-inclusive.org), a global organization that is helping increase the representation and participation of gender minorities in Artificial Intelligence. She is also the founder of R-Ladies (rladies.org), a worldwide organization for promoting diversity in the R community with more than 180 chapters in 50+ countries.
She has worked in several startups and where she built teams, developed statistical models, and employed a variety of techniques to derive insights and drive data-centric decisions.
She likes to mentor and shares her knowledge through mentorship programs, tutorials, and talks.

title: Personaliz√° tus gr√°ficas con ggplot2
description:
¬°Contentas de anunciar nuestro pr√≥ximo meetup (virtual) el 9 de Diciembre a las 18:30 horas!

En este encuentro aprender√°s a personalizar tus gr√°ficos con ggplot2 a cargo de Maggie Suero a trav√©s de Zoom.

Durante el taller se revisar√°n los conceptos b√°sicos de ggplot2 y se explorar√°n diferentes formas para personalizar tus gr√°ficos, buscando hacerlos m√°s atractivos.
No se requieren conocimientos previos de R ya que se ir√° paso a paso. Como plus, se revisar√°n algunas iniciativas de comunidades de habla hispana de R y R-Ladies cuyo cometido es compartir, generar conocimiento y aplicar las habilidades aprendidas.

RSVP: rladies.uy/meetup #rladies #rladieslatam

title: Virtual Workshop: Intro to Shiny
description:
About the instructor: Kaelen is a data scientist at Medidata Solutions where they work as an R programmer on the microservices team. They've also worked at Spring Health, DataCamp, HERE Technologies, and have done a fair amount of R and Shiny consulting on the side. Kaelen has been at various times in their life a: film theorist, preschool teacher, test prep tutor, videographer, and nanny before getting a MS in Biostatistics from LSU Health Sciences Center in 2016 and starting work as a statistician and data scientist. They have a black cat named Scully and enjoy podcasts, aliens, nail polish, and data.

Workshop description: In this workshop, we'll build and style a simple shiny app. You'll be introduced to both native and add-on Shiny inputs and outputs, with an introduction of reactivity to get you started building reactive functions. We'll cover various htmlWidgets, along with using the shinythemes package to style the app.

Materials, workshop prep, and Zoom link will be sent out/posted prior to the event!

title: End-of-Year Celebration for Women and Gender Minorities
description:
[Please note: At the request of members of our community for an R-Ladies space exclusively for minority genders, this event is limited to those who identify as such (including but not limited to women, trans men, non-binary, and gender nonconforming individuals). Male allies have been great supporters of our chapter and the R-Ladies mission to promote gender diversity in the R Community -- for which we are grateful! -- and we believe the best way male allies can support us this month is by honoring the need for and benefit of such a space.]

Happy Holidays! To close out 2020, we are thrilled to host a virtual version of our annual end-of-year celebration and social! We'll utilize breakout rooms to allow participants to connect (or re-connect) with other members of our community in smaller groups.

*IMPORTANT* To RSVP for this event, you must complete and submit this Google form: https://forms.gle/v3eEg4nXSzH9s5D4A While you may RSVP via Meetup to let others know you plant to attend, Zoom link information will only be shared via email with those who register through the form.

Agenda:
7-7:10: Welcome and R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:10-8:30: Breakout room chats (3-5 people, and we'll provide some topics to inspire conversation!)

title: Debugging in R (Advanced R Ch22, R Ladies Netherlands)
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting a series of events based on Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/). However, all meet-ups and in particular this one, are very useful even if you didn't follow the ones before.

Join us for our next meeting, in which Alejandra Hern√°ndez Segura will present the key points of the chapter on "Debugging" (chapter 22) which is one of the last chapters. After the presentations, we will have some discussion so that we can clear up any doubts :)

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Also feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

ABOUT Ale
----------------------
Originally from Mexico, Ale now lives in the Netherlands where she studied Molecular Medicine in Groningen. She now works as a Bioinformatician for the RIVM (National Institute for Public Health
and the Environment), where she is in charge of doing automatization and ensuring reproducibility of analyses. She has been working through the chapters of Advanced R and now is ready to tell you all about "Expressions" in R.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Understanding basics of R objects. Having at least some experience using Rstudio.

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: Data Visualization in R
description:
DESCRIPTION:
Every good chart started out as a bad one. In this workshop, we will discuss 1) basic visualization principles, and 2) resources, tools, tips, and tricks that help improve our charts and refine our data stories. Some familiarity with R and ggplot will be useful but not required - novice R users are encouraged to attend.

AGENDA:
6.00-6.10pm: Arrivals
6.10-6.20pm: Introductions
6.20-7.00pm: Presentation
7.00-7.40pm: Exercises (RStudio Cloud)

ABOUT OUR SPEAKER:
Trang Le is a postdoctoral fellow with Jason Moore at the Computational Genetics Lab, University of Pennsylvania. She enjoys developing machine learning methods for rigorous analyses of biomedical data, including neuroimage, transcriptomic and genetic. She‚Äôs the author and maintainer of five R packages and active contributor of the automated machine learning tool TPOT. She holds a doctorate and a master‚Äôs degree in mathematics and two bachelor‚Äôs degrees in mathematics and geology. Reproducible research, inclusion and equity.

title: Taking text data analysis to the next level
description:
Let's welcome our next guest! Cosima (cosimameyer.rbind.io) is a computational conflict researcher, PhD candidate at the University of Mannheim, Germany, and a data lover. Cosima has created a blog (https://www.mzes.uni-mannheim.de/socialsciencedatalab/) where she and her fellow researchers write about their science adventures, and has created a veRy useful package, overvieweR (https://cosimameyer.github.io/overviewR/). Read more about her on the webpage http://cosimameyer.rbind.io/.

About the talk:

"Taking the text data analysis to the next level - Using supervised and unsupervised approaches in NLP"

Text data provides an oasis of information for both researchers and non-researchers alike to explore. Natural Language Processing (NLP) methods help make sense of this difficult data type, which is written text. The talk will give you a smooth introduction to the quanteda package (https://quanteda.io/). I will also showcase how to quickly visualize your text data and cover both supervised and unsupervised approaches in NLP. As part of a code demo, we will use text data from the UN as a working example to give you first insights into the structure of text data and how to work with it.

title: "Branching Out into Isolation Forests" with guest speaker Stephanie Kirmer
description:
For the December edition of our R-Ladies Dallas webinar series, we are excited to welcome Stephanie Kirmer as our guest speaker. She will introduce the topic of Isolation Forests for tree-based anomaly detection.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Branching Out into Isolation Forests: Tree Based Anomaly Detection
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Abstract:
Isolation forests offer a new way to approach unsupervised anomaly detection problems, and in this talk attendees will get an end-to-end tutorial with code and visual explanations on how to apply the technique in R. Among other advantages, isolation forests offer interpretability and rapid runtime, so they are useful in business and production settings.

Bio:
Stephanie Kirmer is a Senior Data Scientist at Saturn Cloud, a platform enabling easy to use parallelization and scaling for Python with Dask. (But she still loves R as well.) Previously she worked as a DS Tech Lead at Journera, a travel data startup, and Senior Data Scientist at Uptake, where she developed predictive models for diagnosing and preventing mechanical failure. Before joining Uptake, she worked on data science for social policy research at the University of Chicago and taught sociology and health policy at DePaul University.

Slides/Code:
Stephanie's slides were prepared using the R xaringan package and are available in the following github repository in the 'r' subdirectory. Code used in her demo are also provided in the repo. You are invited to follow along during the presentation. https://github.com/skirmer/isolation_forests

Twitter: @data_stephanie

Website: http://www.stephaniekirmer.com/

*************************************************************************

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the group project and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Webinar + Slack sign-up: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdJhvSg-YrNYOrmju1yrXvYhFM7xMey1WpDq1NSGIp6x41VaA/viewform

*************************************************************************

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
description:
About the workshop: This will be the third meetup of R-Ladies BLR. The workshop will focus on Exploratory Data Analysis. How to encounter new data sets? What are the things that are useful to quickly get a sense of the data and how to easily achieve this in R.

About the instructor: Sushmita V Gopalan is a decision scientist at Grubhub, a food delivery company based out of Chicago. She designs and analyses experiments, conducts simulation studies to help make business decisions, and builds internal tools for data science. She arrived at data science by way of Economics at the Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IIT-M), policy research at the Institute for Financial Management and Research (IFMR), and Computational Social Science at the University of Chicago. Sushmita is also a co-organizer at R-Ladies Chicago.

Password for zoom- 000111.

For the more details register here - https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScb8cb5wTfMx_4GlELJzkaYtKIG-PvMzOL2twWwqFGOUVFBUQ/viewform?usp=sf_link or contact bangalore@rladies.org.

title: Improving your coding practices in R
description:
TOPIC
Have you ever looked at a script you wrote two years ago and been totally clueless? Or do you hesitate to share your code with others out of fear that it's too cryptic? Come and join our best coding practices online event and learn how to make your code more readable!

Our speaker for this event is Arushi Garg. She is currently doing a PhD at the Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition and Behaviour at Radboud University (Nijmegen, The Netherlands). Prior to her PhD, Arushi worked in the software industry as a developer for three years, where she was required to follow rigorous coding standards. In this talk, she draws from her experience and will show us how we can employ such practices in science and make reproducibility and sharing a breeze.

PREPARATION
In order to get the most out of the meeting, we encourage you to upload a piece of your own code here: https://www.dropbox.com/request/WymCtIPcxZjsJcbPWqE2

Arushi can then tailor her examples to your needs. We emphasise that your code does not need to be perfect - if anything, the less perfect it is, the more you will learn from sharing it with Arushi! To also reassure you: if you code appears as an example in Arushi's talk, it will be anonymised.

ONLINE PROGRAMME
The event will be held online and will start at 14:00 (UK time). Please join us via this Zoom link: https://zoom.us/j/92039823740?pwd=am5SVGFXYzRpWG1oUmhJUVM2YjlZdz09

CODE OF CONDUCT
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct -- we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

R-Ladies events are always free and open to anyone who wants to participate as long as they follow the code of conduct. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R.

title: Code-Along with R-Ladies Canberra
description:
R-Ladies Canberra has invited R-Ladies Auckland and several other R-Ladies chapters across Australia and New Zealand to join them in their final event of the year! The event will be an online code-along targeted for less experienced users of R, but all users are welcome to attend.

Erika Duan will be leading the code-along, introducing data visualisation using ggplot. We'll code for about half an hour, then break out into smaller groups for meet-and-greet, then return to coding for another half hour before closing with a second breakout.

This meeting will be hosted on Zoom. The meeting link will be sent out to those attending closer to the meetup date. R-Ladies Canberra is looking forward to seeing you there!

If you have any questions or problems, don't hesitate to contact Izzy Johnson (co-host) through meet-up!

As with all our meetups, please be aware of and read the Code of Conduct before attending.
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

title: Lightning Talks: This year I learned ... and it changed my life! R-edition
description:
R-Ladies Montpellier in collaboration with R-Ladies Freiburg have the pleasure to invite you to this new online meetup!

Let's be honest... 2020 has been a rollercoaster -- but surely some good has come out of it! In this R-Ladies year-end Meetup, we'll focus on the positive things we've learned this year in R. And for this, we want to hear from you!

Whether it's a cool ggplot feature, a newly discovered package, a tip for using R-Studio, or an application of familiar tools to your own project, we know you have something interesting to share! In a 10-minute slot, you can present on anything you've learned this year in R, or walk us through a visualization / piece of code that you're proud of -- all in front of an easy, helpful audience who are there to cheer you on.

We're hoping to get a range of ladies* from different areas of interest, levels of expertise, and resident countries to join and share their tips with us! If you've never presented before, we want to specifically encourage you to try it out. So don't hesitate to sign up -- we look forward to hearing from you.

And, as a teaser, topics so far include:
- ...how to make sweet lollipop plots
-... small tricks to make big changes in your R-Studio experience
-... how to make presentations in R

Sign up for a talk here:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1r3BNDPW0kkKSqd5LQNJjE8ezFblh2oOC1LcBXIxIBkc/edit

We will be sharing the Zoom link soon!

title: Blogging with RMarkdown
description:
Are you an R user who would like to share more online? How about starting a new blog, with R Markdown (Rmd)?

Ma√´lle Salmon (https://masalmon.eu/), R(esearch) Software Engineer and a proud R-Lady, will be helping us get started!

In this 2-hour course with live coding, we'll go on two short adventures:

- setting up a scientific Rmd blog with the Distill framework, and the distill package

- setting up a scientific Rmd blog with the Hugo website generator and the hugodown package (also quickly presenting blogdown)

We'll prepare for the adventures by defining what we expect of an Rmd blog. We'll end the course by reflecting on each adventure as well as mentioning important future paths such as how to promote your blog. You should leave the course ready to start an R Markdown blog with your tool of choice, and knowing where to find more resources and help.

Website: https://rmd-blogging-jozi.netlify.app/

About the speaker:

Ma√´lle works remotely from Nancy, France, where she lives with her family.
She is a research software engineer with rOpenSci, besides other projects. In particular, currently, she works on the "HTTP testing in R" book thanks to funding from the R Consortium. She created the R-hub blog that features more or less niche topics about R package development, also thanks to funding by the R Consortium.
She also volunteers as an associate editor for rOpenSci's Software Peer Review (peer-review system of R packages), the main manager of R-Ladies Global Twitter account, and a member of the R Weekly team.

title: Books In Bars - Invisible Women
description:
Spend Friday night discussing Invisible Women (https://www.bookdepository.com/Invisible-Women-Caroline-Criado-Perez/9781784741723).

Winner of the 2019 Financial Times and McKinsey Business Book of the Year Award
Winner of the 2019 Royal Society Science Book Prize

Data is fundamental to the modern world. From economic development, to healthcare, to education and public policy, we rely on numbers to allocate resources and make crucial decisions. But because so much data fails to take into account gender, because it treats men as the default and women as atypical, bias and discrimination are baked into our systems. And women pay tremendous costs for this bias, in time, money, and often with their lives.

Celebrated feminist advocate Caroline Criado Perez investigates the shocking root cause of gender inequality and research in Invisible Women‚Äã, diving into women‚Äôs lives at home, the workplace, the public square, the doctor‚Äôs office, and more. Built on hundreds of studies in the US, the UK, and around the world, and written with energy, wit, and sparkling intelligence, this is a groundbreaking, unforgettable expos√© that will change the way you look at the world.

PS Please contact the organizer if you need support finding the book.

title: Recommendation Engine from scratch!
description:
Ciao di nuovo!
Siamo qui per un evento interessante:
Volete aggiornare il vostro skill set e imparare a costruire un sistema di raccomandazione da zero? Questo evento fa per voi!
Siamo lieti di ospitare un workshop virtuale con Avanade, leader mondiale nella fornitura di servizi digitali innovativi, cloud, business solutions ed experience desig.
In questo workshop imparerete:
* Costruzione di un Recommendation System tramite la libreria recommenderlab, allo scopo di suggerire delle ‚Äúcategorie letterarie‚Äù a utenti che comprano libri.
Il workshop sar√† suddiviso in diversi step, dall‚Äôanalisi del dataset alla costruzione di KPI, fino all‚Äôimplementazione del modello di raccomandazione. Come ultimo step, per mostrare come usufruire del modello, mostreremo una ShinyApp che, prendendo in input alcune informazioni sui gusti dell‚Äôutente, restituisce le categorie suggerite

Level: Beginner
Il materiale per il workshop sar√† condiviso prima dell'evento.

Speakers:
- Intro: Simona Radici, Talent Acquisition specialist e Giovanni Vetrella, Advanced Analytics Talent Community Lead.
- Hands on Lab: Michela Isella e Adriana Santacroce, Advanced Analytics Consultant e Advanced Analytics Analyst.

* Michela Isella, Laureata in Fisica, Data Scientist in Avanade. Parte del team di Advanced Analytics, specializzata nello sviluppo di soluzioni di Machine Learning tramite servizi del Cloud Microsoft Azure.
* Adriana Santacroce, ha un dottorato di ricerca nel campo statistico-demografico. Attualmente lavora nel team di Advanced Analytics di Avanade.

Ricordate che per questo workshop e' necessario aver installato R & Rstudio sul vostro pc. L'evento sar√† in Italiano e sar√† trasmesso in streaming tramite Zoom (Non √® necessario installare zoom).
Il link per partecipare verr√† condiviso dopo la registrazione.

Agenda:
- Introduzione: 17.30 - 17.45
- Workshop: 17.45 18.30
- Q&A: 18.30 - 18.45

Looking forward to meeting up with you all!
Interested to give a talk or collaborate with us on an event? Reach us!

title: Dati personali e informazioni sensibili: tecniche di data anonymization in R
description:
üì£ Evento in collaborazione con la community del Deep Learning Italia

"Deep Learning Italia‚Äù Online Conference: https://bit.ly/3m50KSL

Si affronteranno temi legati esclusivamente alla progettazione e implementazione di Reti Neurali e il Deep Learning nell'Intelligenza Artificiale di oggi.

Il Meetup di DLI nasce dall'esigenza di sopperire alla carenza di meetup tecnici sul Deep Learning in Italia mentre ormai se ne contano molteplici in altre citt√† del mondo come Londra, Amsterdam e San Francisco. Il Meetup sar√† orientato sia alla ricerca accademica e che al mondo delle startup.

Luned√¨ 23 Novembre 2020, dalle ore 18.30 alle ore 20.00.

REGISTRAZIONE OBBLIGATORIA SU CODEMOTION: https://community.codemotion.com/deep-learning-italia/meetups/meetup-aperitech-online-edition-di-novembre-di-deep-learning-italia

Speaker:
Giovanna de Vincenzo Co-Founder @R-Ladies Bari | Data Scientist @InfoCamere

Titolo: Dati personali e informazioni sensibili: tecniche di data anonymization in R

Abstract

Con i social media e i big data ovunque, la privacy dei dati √® diventata una preoccupazione pubblica crescente. La raccolta di informazioni √® necessaria per aiutare un sito web a crescere, targetizzare i clienti o analizzare fenomeni sociali. Riconoscendo questo problema, tante entit√† come Google e Apple, stanno promuovendo migliori tecniche di tutela e protezione della privacy. √à qui che entra in gioco l'anonimizzazione dei dati.

üì£ Cos'√® l'anonimizzazione dei dati e perch√© √® importante?

L'anonimizzazione dei dati rende non identificabili le informazioni identificabili. Ci√≤ avviene tramite tecniche di elaborazione dati che rimuovono o codificano i dati personali. Quindi i dati diventano anonimi e non possono essere collegati a nessun individuo. L'anonimizzazione dei dati consente di rispettare i GDPR di tutto il mondo.

In questo meetup esploreremo i metodi e le tecniche di base per la codifica dei dati che statistici e data scientist utilizzano per rendere anonimi i dati con R.

Utilizzeremo il dataset prodotto dalle vostre risposte al seguente sondaggio ‚¨ÖÔ∏è compila il sondaggio e non mancare! üôã‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

COMPILA IL SONDAGGIO: https://forms.gle/TTwTECZqfW9Af5nz8

title: Mixed effect models in R
description:
Join us for a practical session on mixed-effects models in R

The talk will cover techniques used to implement and run mixed-effects models, specifically Linear Mixed Models (LMM) and Generalized Linear Mixed Models (GLMM) in R. It will also detail assumptions of the tests and common pitfalls in application. You‚Äôll learn about the models in the context of common research examples from the areas of Psychology and Psycholinguistics.

Grab a snack and a drink and dial in on Monday, 23rd November, at 5:15PM (GMT)

5:15-5:20 Welcome
5:20-5:30 Introductions
5:30-7:00 Talk and tutorial: Mixed-effects models in R by Natalia Resende

Our speaker Natalia Resende is a Marie Sk≈Çodowska-Curie research fellow at Adapt Centre, School of Computing, Dublin City University. Her expertise is in the domains of Psycholinguistics, Natural Language Processing and Machine Translation. More recently, her work focuses on investigating how machine translation systems (such as the popular Google Translate system) impact the processing of English as a second language in the human brain. Nat√°lia Resende graduated in English teaching from Federal University of Minas Gerais, Brazil. She has received her PhD in Psycholinguistics from the Federal University of Santa Catarina, Brazil in 2015 and her masters in Natural Language Processing from Wolverhampton University, United Kingdom, in 2009.

This is a practical session. You‚Äôll need to install RStudio or use R Studio Cloud https://rstudio.cloud/.

We'll be recording the event for future reference, we hope that‚Äôs ok with you.

See you on the Internet :)
Jo, Paola and Sapna

title: [MeetUp Online] People Analytics a Ci√™ncia de dados no RH
description:

title: We R Ladies - Como criar um pacote do zero no R
description:
Inscri√ß√µes em: https://www.sympla.com.br/we-r-ladies---como-criar-um-pacote-do-zero-no-r__1043808

Para quem usa o software R frequentemente, a utiliza√ß√£o de pacotes pode economizar tempo e ajudar a organizar projetos. Neste curso, iremos abordar todo o processo de cria√ß√£o de pacotes, assim como suas utilidades e aplica√ß√µes. Para facilitar o desenvolvimento usaremos ferramentas dispon√≠veis no RStudio Cloud.

N√≠vel de Habilidade: Intermedi√°rio

Conhe√ßa a facilitadora:

Adriana dos Santos Lima - Cientista de Dados na Accenture (https://www.linkedin.com/in/adriana-lima-89a11b143/)
Carioca em Beag√°. Adriana √© graduada em Estat√≠stica pela UFF (Universidade Federal Fluminense) e Mestre em Estat√≠stica pela UFMG (Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais).
Cientista de dados nos dias √∫teis e espectadora fiel dos v√≠deos de decora√ß√£o aos finais de semana. Trabalha atualmente na Accenture como Cientista de Dados onde atua em projetos que a permitem desenvolver desde o pr√©-processamento dos dados at√© a aplica√ß√£o dos modelos de machine learning.
Apaixonad√≠ssima pelo R, mas desenvolvendo uma leve paixonite pelo python nos √∫ltimos tempos. Acredita que programar √© para TODOS e que o conhecimento em programa√ß√£o deve ser disseminado por a√≠. A sua paix√£o mesmo √© estudar Estat√≠stica nas suas mais diversas √°reas (a louca, n√©?) e recentemente decidiu se aventurar no mundo do Deep Learning.

FAQs:

O que √© R?

R √© uma linguagem de programa√ß√£o de computador e ambiente de software para computa√ß√£o estat√≠stica e gr√°ficos. Confira aqui (https://www.r-project.org/). Ele √© usado para an√°lise e visualiza√ß√£o de dados em uma ampla variedade de campos.

O que √© R-Ladies?

A comunidade R-Ladies √© uma organiza√ß√£o global que promove a diversidade de g√™nero na comunidade da linguagem computacional estat√≠stica (R). Embora nossos eventos considerem pelo menos o interesse de n√≠vel b√°sico em R (algum conhecimento anterior √© √∫til, mas n√£o obrigat√≥rio), voc√™ √© mais que bem-vinde a participar de qualquer uma de nossas sess√µes para ver o que fazemos.

Onde posso acessar seus materiais?

Vamos carregar os materiais para a nossa pasta no GDrive (https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1UNO_46lSQ63aU71tIR70-7le0ez10HT5).

Eu conhe√ßo pouco ou nada sobre a linguagem R, ainda assim posso participar?

Absolutamente! Todos os n√≠veis s√£o bem-vindos, tudo o que voc√™ precisa √© ter pelo menos algum interesse.

Preciso de alguma estrutura pra acompanhar o curso?

Para acompanhar o curso online, o ideal √© ter acesso a um computador e internet r√°pida. Uma conta ativa no RStudio Cloud tamb√©m ser√° necess√°ria. Veja como cri√°-la aqui: https://medium.com/rladiesbh/r-studio-cloud-como-programar-em-r-usando-a-web-aa6313a5fb8c

Vai ter certificado?

Vai sim, todo mundo que comparecer ao evento ter√° direito a um certificado de 6h.

O curso √© gratuito?

Sim. Por√©m, teremos um n√∫mero limitado de vagas gratuitas.

Eu sou homem, posso me inscrever?

Este grupo √© principalmente voltado para o p√∫blico feminino e LGBTQIA+, mas est√° aberto a todos que concordam com o CoC (https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/). Dito isto, se voc√™ √© um homem e quer participar dos nossos encontros, voc√™ est√° convidado a participar!

Projeto a ser ajudado em breve!

Ficou alguma d√∫vida?

√â s√≥ enviar para belohorizonte@rladies.org ;)

title: CV Workshop
description:
Join R-Ladies Boston for a workshop on CVs and resumes Thursday November, 19th from 6 - 7:30 pm.

We will explore some packages and workflows that can help you create a beautiful CV or resume with R (and other non R methods too!) We will also be talking about tips for tailoring your CV and resumes for job applications. Whether you are on the job hunt or not now, keeping records of your amazing work is an important way to make job hunting less terrible in the future.

If you have experience in hiring or reviewing CVs and resumes and want to participate in a panel discussion (minimal prep required ~15 minutes), please email Mara dot Alexeev at gmail.com to discuss.

Have questions on the process or a package you think would be good to discuss? Email Mara that too or post it on the R-Ladies Slack channel!

title: [ONLINE] #IamRemarkable Workshop
description:
Hi everyone,

We hope you are well during this time! While we as R-Ladies Amsterdam typically focus on developing hands- on skills- it's also important to learn how to vocalise your developed skills and achievements! As such, we are excited to invite you to attend the #IamRemarkable workshop as part of the #IamRemarkable Week running from 12-19 November. Join us to celebrate the power of diversity and allyship- and get inspired by remarkable stories and improve your confidence and self-promotion skills.

#IamRemarkable is a Google initiative empowering women and
underrepresented groups to speak openly about their
accomplishments in the workplace and beyond, thereby
breaking modesty norms and glass ceilings. Learn more at
g.co/IamRemarkable

In this interactive session, you will participate in group
discussions and exercises to develop the confidence and skills to
promote yourself effectively.

During the 90 min #IamRemarkable workshop we will:
- Share data and research regarding self promotion and
unconscious bias
- Go through the main exercise to help you articulate your
achievements and practice self promotion
- Have a discussion and share take home exercises
Feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

PROGRAMME
---------------------
18.00 - 18.10 Virtual Welcome & R-Ladies introductions
18.10 - 18.20 Introductions
18.20 - 20.00 #IamRemarkable workshop

ABOUT Janine
----------------------
Janine is a data scientist and one of the R-Ladies Amsterdam co-founders. Within the data science world she loves the intricacies that come with data science in the medical world, involving messy data (generation) and medical decision making that go beyond the technical nitty gritty. With her background in psychology she is well equipped to thoroughly understand the the requirements that go into a well designed data science project. She entered the world of data science through R- where her love for the language and the community developed. Now she is busy bringing the community in Amsterdam together supporting others in achieving their full programming potential through R.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Just bring yourself! :)

LINK TO MEETUP
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
See on the right

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, Meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: pmlbr and treeheatr: visualizing decision trees on benchmark datasets
description:
The presentation of the decision tree with data represented as a heatmap is a new visualization that uncovers the tree's performance, the data's correlation structure, and the importance of each feature in predicting the outcome. Implemented in an easily installed package with a detailed vignette, treeheatr can be a useful teaching tool to enhance students‚Äô understanding of a simple decision tree model before diving into more complex tree-based machine learning methods.

Trang is a postdoctoral fellow with Jason Moore at the Computational Genetics Lab, University of Pennsylvania. She enjoys developing machine learning methods for analyses of biomedical data, including neuroimage (functional/structural MRI), transcriptomics and genotypes. Most of the datasets she works with are high dimensional (i.e., have many predictors/features), so she spends most of her time building feature selection algorithms for these data. She trades her bias toward the nearest-neighbor concept for lower variance of her methods and better generalizability. When she is not knee deep in data, she runs, dance and seasonally skis.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~MATERIALS~~~~~~~~~
slides: https://slides.com/trang1618/treeheatr-pmlbr
material doc: https://slides.com/trang1618/treeheatr-pmlbr

title: Tidying Up Messy Data: Hands-on Demos
description:
Hello R-Ladies

Are you an R beginner wanting to learn more about how to tidy up messy data? We covered in our this hands-on workshop!

Bruno Grande (he/him) has been training others in the ways of modern R programming since 2015. With a PhD in bioinformatics, he learned (the hard way) how to leverage the tidyverse toolbox to efficiently transform, analyze, and visualize data ranging from messy to tidy. As a Carpentries- and RStudio-certified trainer, he wishes to empower the next generation of researchers and professionals with the same data science skills that continue to bolster his career. He's currently promoting and implementing best practices in open science as a Bioinformatics Engineer at Sage Bionetworks in Seattle, WA.

Workshop details:
Day and time: Nov 18th, 2020 at 6pm
Webinar link: RSVP to view

******
About the workshop:

Do you have a messy dataset you'd like to have Bruno demo in this workshop? If so, we'd like to encourage you to submit your data here:
https://forms.gle/wdz4tDW3xaYfmZH28

Requirements and info for data submission:
- Preferably a data frame, but can be other data formats (e.g. Excel, JSON).
- Compliant with privacy requirements. ( ie No personal IDs, but redacted identifiers are okay)
- Contributors must feel comfortable having their dataset being tidied in front of the workshop audience (and possibly a broader audience on the Internet if the workshop gets recorded).
- Submissions can be anonymous
- Must be submitted by October 31st, 2020.

General workshop information:

-Please expect a hands-on session in a friendly and laid-back atmosphere where we all encouraged to learn together.
- All levels are welcome but be prepared that we created this with beginners in mind. You should be familiar with R and RStudio.
- Install R: https://mirror.its.sfu.ca/mirror/CRAN/
- Install RStudio (choose the Desktop version): https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download
- Install tidyverse package: install.package("tidyverse")

**********************IMPORTANT************************

1. Have your computer and a steady internet connection ready

2. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

3. Who is this allowed to attend the workshop?
Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming language in data science, which is R.

To fulfill this mission we do ask participants to respect a focus on the encouragement and support for women and non-binary people during our events.

See you there!

Lisa, Jasmine, Lucia, Zubia, and Yuka

title: Basics of the gt (grammer of tables) package
description:
Hi R-Ladies SB,

Please join us for an evening of display table making using the {gt} package! We will be going over the basic components and modifications available using {gt}. We will be using a combination of Thanksgiving dinner survey data from FiveThirtyEight (https://github.com/fivethirtyeight/data/tree/master/thanksgiving-2015) and hopefully survey info from our R-Ladies community!

If everyone could spare 10 seconds to fill out this 3 question pie survey, we can see our data in action! https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe2PjpTon3_g7vwe1BEQOdTioS7oLCq5dLSfuqdOb9bWP16_g/viewform?usp=sf_link

Instructions for installing software and packages can be found below, and the Zoom link will become available upon RSVPing.

Looking forward to seeing many of you!

Cheers,
Juliette

Materials:

If you do not have github, no worries! You can download gt_workshop.Rmd if you‚Äôd like to live code alongside us, or alternatively, download the key, gt_workshop_key.Rmd which contains all code that we‚Äôll cover. Please also be sure to download the data, thanksgiving_pie.csv, which is located in the ‚Äòdata‚Äô folder

We suggest creating an R project to store all four files in for ease of use. If you are unsure how to do so, you can find detailed instructions here:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HAvvoKrX8Ehm_NCipkij0OqUQgWIAdCR/view?usp=sharing

____________________________________________________________________________________

Tuesday 11/17 last minute updates and reminders!

- If you haven‚Äôt already please take a minute to fill out the google form survey (link in the meeting description). It‚Äôs about pie!!
- If you haven‚Äôt downloaded the most recent version of zoom, we highly recommend that you do so.
- I have made edits to the markdown and data in my GitHub repository, so if you have already downloaded the materials and want the updated version you will need to re-download or pull it.
- Lastly, the first 15 minutes of our meeting will be dedicated to helping people trouble shoot set up issues. If you don‚Äôt need any help, just hop on the call at 5:45!

Excited to see you all tomorrow!
Juliette

title: Q&A with the Authors of "Data Science in Education Using R"
description:
This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page at noon on the day of the event. We will request your email address upon registration to ensure you receive the newly required Zoom passcode on the day of the event.

Agenda (subject to change):
7:30-7:35 pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:35-8:05: Book talk
8:05 - end Audience Q&A

---- Book description ----
Data Science in Education Using R is the go-to reference for learning data science in the education field. The book answers questions like: What does a data scientist in education do? How do I get started learning R, the popular open-source statistical programming language? And what does a data analysis project in education look like?

If you‚Äôre just getting started with R in an education job, this is the book you‚Äôll want with you. This book gets you started with R by teaching the building blocks of programming that you‚Äôll use many times in your career. The book takes a "learn by doing" approach and offers eight analysis walkthroughs that show you a data analysis from start to finish, complete with code for you to practice with. The book finishes with how to get involved in the data science community and how to integrate data science in your education job.

---- Speaker Bios ----
Ryan A. Estrellado (@RyanEs) has served public schools for over seventeen years as a school psychologist and administrator. Ryan writes about working with data, education, and other projects at https://ryanestrellado.com.

Emily A. Freer (@ebovee09) is the Director of Educational Development and Assessment at the Marquette University School of Dentistry. Learn more about Emily at https://emilyfreer.com.

Jesse Mostipak (@kierisi) is the Community Advocate for Kaggle, and has worked both as a high school science teacher and lead data scientist within education non-profits. To follow Jesse‚Äôs learning adventures in Python and deep learning, head over to https://jessemaegan.com.

Isabella C. Vel√°squez (@ivelasq3) is a data analyst committed to nonprofit work with the goal of reducing racial and socioeconomic inequities. To follow Isabella‚Äôs personal projects, join her at https://ivelasq.rbind.io.

title: Regression Overview + A Study of Medical Treatments for COVID-19
description:
# Schedule
Tuesday, November 17th, 6:30-8:30pm
6:30 - Zoom Breakout Rooms Networking Activity
6:55 - Announcements
7:00 - Regression Overview
7:35 - A Study of Medical Treatments for COVID-19
8:30 - Meeting Adjourned

# Regression Overview
Speaker: Madeline Bauer, PhD

Bio: Madeline Bauer holds a Ph.D. in Mathematical Statistics. She has collaborated with medical and surgical oncologists in the design and analysis of large-scale Phase III cancer clinical trials, using survival and Cox proportional hazards regression analysis. She has also worked closely with radiation biologists in developing and implementing innovative dose response designs for Phase I and II studies to evaluate dose escalation of radiation therapy, with immunologists developing designs for Phase II studies to evaluate combination therapy with biologic agents, and has used robust regression and data visualization tools in S-Plus and R to visualize dose response surfaces for combination antifungal drug therapy in murine models and in vitro drug susceptibility testing. Now retired, Dr. Madeline Bauer helps high school students with their science projects, mentors undergraduate statistics and data science students preparing for ASA DataFest, and serves as a co-organizer for R-Ladies Irvine.

Abstract: The general purpose of developing a regression model is to understand the association between a response Y and X and/or to predict Y given X, where X is a set of independent variables. In this talk, we give an overview of regression and highlight some of the regression packages available in R. We start with examples of suggested best workflow practices that are useful regardless of the specific regression model. For model-specific workflows, we take advantage of the "methods" associated with the model, such as "summary", "print", and especially "plot." These methods illustrate the individual package author‚Äôs approaches to check the model assumptions, estimate the association between the response and the covariates and evaluate the fit and accuracy of the resulting model. We will demonstrate these methods with real datasets. The data and R code will be available to download.

# A Study of Medical Treatments for COVID-19
Speaker: Song Zhai

Bio: Song Zhai is a Ph.D. candidate in the Department of Statistics at UC, Riverside. After finishing his master degree in the Department of Mathematics at Texas A&M University, Song Zhai joined UCR in Fall 2016, under the supervision of Dr. Xinping Cui. Song‚Äôs previous projects include a retrospective study for biomarker selection with Parkside Medical Group; efficient polygenic risk score developing at Merck; and best predictive biomarker identification with Xinping. Song‚Äôs research focus is on pharmacogenomics, with an emphasis on applications rooted in biomarker study, multiple testing, and causal inference.

Abstract: To the end of this study, various medical treatments for COVID-19 are attempted. A total of 417 patients were considered and 414 of them were included in this study (3 deaths) with mild-to-critical COVID-19. Patients were followed up for recurrence for 28 days quarantine after being discharged. We applied the Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique (SMOTE) to overcome the rare recurring events in certain patient subgroups. Virtual Twins Matching (VTM) analysis, facilitated by random forest regression, was performed for medical treatment-recurrence classification, while minimizing effects of confounding factors. We used the Multiple Comparisons with the Best (MCB) as the test of the best drug combination in each patient subgroup. The insights into combinatorial therapy found in this study shed light on the use of a combination of (biological and chemical) anti-virus therapy and/or anti-cytokine storm as a potentially effective therapeutic treatment for COVID-19.

# Meeting Materials
All meeting materials will be sent to registered attendees after the event.

title: R-Ladies Baltimore -- Mapping Neighborhood Air-Quality with Shiny (Virtual)
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

The next event is Tuesday November 17, 2020 from 3-4:30pm (virtual meetup on Zoom). We will have an exciting joint presentation from Marynia Kolak (https://makosak.github.io) (Assistant Director of Health Informatics, Senior Lecturer in Geographic Information Science, Center for Spatial Data Science at the University of Chicago) and Isaac Kamber (Undergraduate student at University of Chicago) on Mapping Neighborhood Air-Quality Factors for a Smart City with R Shiny. They will discuss how they calculated and visualized air quality metrics for the Chicago Health Department.

WHO is this for?
- If you are new to R & want to learn about Shiny apps!
- If you work with spatial data in R (e.g. geographical spatial data), but not sure how to visualize it with R!
- If you are interested in using R to learn about analyzing air quality data!

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA

3:15‚Äì4pm Presentation: Mapping Neighborhood Air-Quality Factors for a Smart City with R Shiny
4‚Äì4:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:
The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

FAQ:
Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:
- If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

title: How R you? - R-Ladies Melbourne 4th anniversary
description:
Hi everyone!

To celebrate our 4th anniversary with the R-Ladies community we would like to re-propose an event format that we did in the past, which we named "How R you?"!

Have you ever had the thought: "I wonder how my friend is coding!" or "How would other people code this?" or "What's their favourite R tip?". Or maybe you have burning R questions but don't have R friends around you to help you debug it?
This is the time to share our coding thoughts, tips and questions that we could collectively answer!

We would like YOU TO SHARE WITH US YOUR FAVOURITE BITS OF R and/or a R RELATED QUESTION

WHAT TO DO

1. SHARE WITH US HERE https://forms.gle/qSt5Q8PRmCNp29Xe6 or via email to melbourne@rladies.org, an R/R Studio function or functionality; a way to build a model or visualise your data that you use in your workflow or that you simply really like; your favourite R moment or tips from our events! You can also add something about yourself and in which field you use R. The format can be one slide, one R/Rmd script or anything that works for you!

To give you some ideas, this is the result from the last time we ran this event https://rladies-melbourne-tips.netlify.app/.

2. PRESENT IT at our event in 5 MINUTES. This will be a great opportunity to share your R tips, ask for feedback from the audience and practice your public speaking in a friendly, non-judgemental environment!

3. WE WILL CREATE ANOTHER R-LADIES MELBOURNE TIPS REPOSITORY. Submit something even if you think you might not be free on the night. We'd still love to combine all the R-Ladies tips in one Rmarkdown and make it available to everyone! Depending on the number of submissions we will restructure the repository into themes.

4. WIN A FABULOUS PRIZE! We will draft LUCKY WINNERS among the presenters to win an amazing prize (R EARRINGS, bags and much more!)!!

NETWORKING EVENT

Following the lightning talks, we will hold a networking event and online birthday celebration so that participants have the opportunity to interact with each other!

The format of the networking will be announced.

Even though some restrictions are being released this event will still be held online.

Looking forward to seeing you all,

R-Ladies Melbourne

Layla Bouzoubaa is a Lead Research Analyst for the University of Miami (UM) Miller School of Medicine's Department of Public Health Sciences (DPHS). She focuses on substance abuse research which targets interventions to patients suffering from opioid addiction - which includes developing web apps for resource mapping, data harmonization, and population statistics/visualizations to building models that will inform proper treatment. Layla also has the pleasure in co-instructing "Data Science for Biostatistics", a 6-week summer course for masters and PhD level students within DPHS.

*Monica Longoria - Atlanta, GA*
Monica has spent her career supporting sales account executives with data, best practices, and training. As a Career Coach, she teaches others how to use those same sales tactics to further their own careers.
