title: Statistical Analysis Tools of Complex Time-Series Data
description:
We are delighted to come together with you to host another online meetup : Statistical Analysis Tools of Complex Time-Series Data.

Date/Time : Friday, November 13, 2020 6:30PM -> 7:30PM (Tunisia time GMT+1)
Place : Zoom https://zoom.us/download

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Invited speaker : Pr. Fa√Øcel Chamroukhi
‚ñ∂Ô∏è About Pr. Fa√Øcel Chamroukhi https://chamroukhi.com :
Fa√Øcel Chamroukhi is Professor of Statistics & Data Science in Caen, currently Adjunct Visiting Professor at La Trobe University and has been Assistant and Associate Professor of Computer Science and Machine Learning in Paris 13 and Toulon. He is broadly interested in the mathematical and algorithmic foundations of data science and AI, with a keen focus on modern statistics and machine learning. Common threads of his research include statistical modeling and inference, latent variable models, and learning in high-dimensional and large-scale scenario.

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Abstract of the talk that he will be presenting :
Statistics are foundational to data analytics and learning systems to
infer relevant and interpretable knowledge from random representations of real-world scenarios. In this talk, he will present some contributions in scenarios involving complex heterogeneous time-series data. The developed model-based segmentation and clustering of time-series with underlying hidden structures will be illustrated via some applications in R software.

title: InspiRing InstRuction: A panel on teaching #rstats for all audiences w/ RLC
description:
Someone in your department, company, or class comes to you and says: "I want to learn R; where do I start?" Or, "how do I take my R skills to the next level?"

Come hear from 3 R-Ladies on how to make R pedagogy work for different groups of people! :-)

R-Ladies Chicago and R-Ladies East Lansing will be a hosting a joint November virtual meetup featuring 3 panelists:

**Alison Hill** is a Data Scientist & Professional Educator at RStudio. Prior to joining RStudio, Dr. Hill was an Associate Professor and Center Assistant Director at Oregon Health & Science University in Portland, Oregon, where she was an NIH-funded Principal Investigator. Her work has been published in Pediatrics, Autism Research, and other peer-reviewed journals. She has developed and taught several advanced courses and workshops on data visualization and communicating with data. Dr. Hill is also an international keynote speaker, award-winning educator, and co-author of the book blogdown: Creating Websites with R Markdown.

**Marynia Kolak** is an Assistant Director of Health Informatics at the Center for Spatial Data Science at University of Chicago, where she also teaches full time as a Lecturer in Geographic Information Science. Dr. Kolak is interested in Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) and using open science tools as an exploratory data analytic approach to investigate issues of equity across space and time.

**Katie Fitzgerald** is a PhD Candidate in Statistics at Northwestern University. Her research is in statistical methods for social policy, including work in meta-analysis, data visualization, and statistical cognition. She is passionate about statistics education and pedagogy and is pursuing a career at a liberal arts university. When she's not doing statistics, you can find her at Northwestern‚Äôs gorgeous lakefront, biking, hammocking, reading, or indulging in good food.

Agenda
===================
Times are in EST

7:10-7:25 Introduction from the panelists
7:25-7:50 Moderated panel
7:50-8:00 Questions from the audience

title: Your first R package in 1 hour: Tools that make R package development easy
description:
Introduction

This workshop is for people looking to learn how to make their own R packages and learn how to use ‚Äúusethis‚Äù and ‚Äúdevtools‚Äù for package development. The workshop will cover handy one time functions (i.e., use_this::create_package) as well as functions used continuously throughout package development (i.e., devtools::document). At the end of the hour you should have a working, well-documented package with a single function, as well as a better understanding of the files and file structure required for R packages.

This workshop is suitable for beginner to intermediate R users. Attendees should be familiar with functions, but will not be writing their own function in this workshop. Familiarity with pipe or tidyverse is helpful.

Speaker

Shannon Pileggi is an enthusiastic statistical collaborator and professional educator with over ten years of experience partnering on data analysis with diverse stakeholders in corporate settings, tech, public health, and clinical research. Shannon‚Äôs previous work experiences include supporting research on parasitic diseases at the CDC, developing a pilot college-wide intro stats course at the Institute for Quantitative Theory and Methods at Emory University, and instructing R/SAS programming, intro stats, and survival analysis courses at California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo. Shannon is currently a Statistician at Adelphi Research in Doylestown, PA working in pharmaceutical market research. Shannon‚Äôs day-to-day in R include: fine-tuning ggplots to convey analysis results, contributing to an internal package to automate routine analyses/tasks, streamlining work-flows for repetitive analyses, and developing shiny apps.

title: Meetup Pruebas estad√≠sticas en R: X2, t y ANOVA.
description:
En esta sesi√≥n aprenderemos a realizar diferentes variantes de las pruebas estad√≠sticas X2, t de Student y ANOVA con el lenguaje de programaci√≥n R. Abordaremos c√≥mo elegir un test estad√≠stico, la interpretaci√≥n de los resultados de las pruebas X2, t y ANOVA, as√≠ como otras pruebas y correcciones que se emplean en escenarios particulares.

NOTA ADICIONAL: Las alternativas no param√©tricas a T de Student y ANOVA, as√≠ como los tests usados con grupos de muestras no independientes (ej. en los estudios longitudinales), se abordar√°n en sesiones posteriores.

TEMARIO

+ La Elecci√≥n de una prueba estad√≠stica
+ Los supuestos de la prueba X2
+ Diferentes escenarios del uso de X2
+ Los supuestos de las pruebas T de Student y ANOVA
+ Diferentes escenarios del uso de T de Student
+ Diferentes escenarios del uso de ANOVA

CONOCIMIENTOS PREVIOS REQUERIDOS:

Este meetup est√° dirigido a personas con conocimientos b√°sicos de R y de estad√≠stica. Contesta este cuestionario para saber si cuentas con los conocimientos necesarios para aprovechar esta reuni√≥n y qu√© recomendaciones u opciones tenemos para ti:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScU4FKpJHPxAQ_bPyL0ptKnax3TcOlnOXwCDiPqV2lVbWYNyg/viewform

REQUERIMIENTOS DE SOFTWARE

+ R >=3.2 y RStudio
+ Paquetes de R: ggplot2, ggpubr, corrplot, MASS, tidyverse, corrplot

Puedes usar este comando para su instalaci√≥n:
install.packages(c("ggplot2", "ggpubr", "corrplot", "MASS", "tidyverse", "corrplot"), dependencies = TRUE)

ACERCA DE LA PONENTE:

Aurora Labastida Mart√≠nez estudi√≥ la Licenciatura en Investigaci√≥n Biom√©dica B√°sica y la Maestr√≠a en Ciencias Bioqu√≠micas en la UNAM. Es especialista en an√°lisis de datos de secuenciaci√≥n masiva de ADN, un perfil que desarroll√≥ gracias a la colaboraci√≥n con expertas y expertos en ciencias biol√≥gicas y an√°lisis de datos de la UNAM y, m√°s tarde, de la iniciativa privada. Utiliza t√©cnicas y trucos de R, Perl, Bash y AWK, adem√°s de t√©cnicas variadas de estad√≠stica. Actualmente dirige el servicio de an√°lisis de datos OMICs Analysis, en el que aplica sus conocimientos en proyectos de metagen√≥mica y transcript√≥mica. Adem√°s se dedica a la panader√≠a, la agricultura y a algunos proyectos mascota de programaci√≥n.

C√ìDIGO DE CONDUCTA
Recuerda leer y atender nuestro c√≥digo de conducta disponible en https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

PATROCINADORES

title: Write your CV (resume) using R pagedown!
description:
In this workshop, we‚Äôll introduce some tips and tricks for building a CV with pagedown. This workshop is expected to be a hands-on workshop . Participants would have a chance to build their own ‚Äúbaby‚Äù resume.

Preparation: It would be helpful if you download these two R packages

title: Virtual Workshop: Intro to Network Analysis with R
description:
About the instructor: Join Dr. Maria C. Ramos, a Visiting Research Fellow at Duke Network Analysis Center (www.mariacramos.com), for her workshop on network analysis. Maria Ramos is a social scientist and networks scholar. She recently obtained a PhD in Sociology from Duke University and is now a Visiting Research Fellow at Duke Network Analysis Center. Maria‚Äôs research portfolio is diverse and interdisciplinary. Her current projects employ network science to understand HIV prevention, social-ecological systems, collaboration within organizations, and networks of beliefs and mental models. Maria regularly consults with organizations and research teams interested in leveraging network analysis to solve applied problems. She is also an avid R user and loves developing and teaching R workshops and tutorials.

Workshop description: We live in an interconnected world: from the Web, transportation systems, and disease spread to our friendships and families, many aspects of our lives consist of interdependencies and connections among entities. Network analysis provides a framework and a set of tools for studying systems and patterns of relationships. This workshop will provide a gentle introduction to network analysis' concepts, methods, and applications. We will begin with an overview of the networks approach and its applications in various disciplines. Through hands-on activities, we will visualize networks and assess their general structure using different indices. We will also identify subgroups and key players. By the end of the workshop, participants will be able to examine networks and characterize their properties using R.

PLEASE NOTE: We will be automatically recording this event. If you do *not* wish to be recorded, please be sure to keep your video/camera turned OFF.

title: Quasiquotation: Learning about the bang bang and curly curly slang
description:
Welcome!

In our next session Paloma Rojas-Saunero will share the key points on quasiquotation and useful tools from the rlang package. We will also learn about curly-curly, a new operator to make it easier to create functions around #tidyverse pipelines.

After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles related to it.

About R-Ladies book club
----------------------
This session is part of the initiative by R-Ladies chapters of the Netherlands who have been hosting a series of events based on Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).

You can find the slides and materials from previous sessions and our agenda at: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Also feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

About "Quasiquotation" (Chapter 19, Advanced R)
----------------------
The package rlang has tools that you can use to capture (quote) unevaluated function arguments. You‚Äôll also learn about quasiquotation, which provides a set of techniques to unquote input to make it possible to easily generate new trees from code fragments.

Event link
----------------------
We host our events in Jitsi (Note that Jitsi works best with chrome)

https://meet.jit.si/rladies_bangbang

Code of Conduct
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. title: R Ladies Boulder Meetup #12: Introduction to Flexdashboards
description:
Hi Boulder UseRs! Join us for this month's **Virtual** R Ladies Meetup and join our new local Slack workspace (https://forms.gle/j36YGxuNwN6zZ8nW7)!

This month, Hilary Traut will be guiding us through the basics of flexdashboard. Flexdashboards are a widely useful method (based in R Markdown) for presenting interactive analysis reports, usually focusing on graphs or other types of data visuals. Hilary will go over the basic components of a flexdashboard, how to create your first flexdashboard using R Markdown, and ideas for how to use them effectively. After an introduction to the tool, Hilary will guide us through creating a flexdashboard using COVID-19 data.

We will be meeting over Zoom (Meeting link visible when you RSVP). Join us to connect with other R users in the Boulder area and learn some new techniques to apply in your work!

We hope you'll also join our local Slack workspace to keep the R help and conversation flowing! To get access to the Slack workspace, please fill out this short Google form: https://forms.gle/j36YGxuNwN6zZ8nW7.

title: Coding get-together with a Tidy Tuesday dataset
description:
This is a second event in our Tidy Tuesday series: a dedicated time and supportive virtual space for us all to do some coding. We will use that week's Tidy Tuesday dataset to do data exploration, visualisation and analysis. Every participant will be free to take whatever direction they like and the coding will be done largely independently. But fear not, we will help each other when we get stuck and we will share our creations at the end of the event.

This event is meant for R-Ladies with any level of coding skills: whether you're a beginner or an experienced coder, you'll definitely get an opportunity to practice your skills and learn something new.

To participate, you need a computer with an installation of R and internet access. The workshop will be happening on Zoom - all attendees will be sent the access password in advance of the event. You can install Zoom on your computer for free if you like, but you can also use it via your internet browser.

Here is a very rough agenda:
5:30pm Welcome and introductions
5:45pm Get coding
6:30pm Quick check-in
7:15pm Sharing our findings and creations
7:30pm Closing of the event

To find out more about the Tidy Tuesday initiative, check out https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday or explore the #TidyTuesday hashtag on Twitter.

description:
*What are we going to learn:
In this presentation, we‚Äôll cover some tips in R and some of the best features from the free version of RStudio Desktop. Be ready to take notes on our collected and curated tips, tricks, and shortcuts to quickly turn you into an R/RStudio power user!

*Who is going to present:
Dr. Paula Andrea Martinez is a research infrastructure officer. Her background is Computer Sciences and Bioinformatics. In her career she helps researchers work more effectively to use High Performance Computing and digital skills. Paula's involvement in research projects associated with extreme data growth give her a clear understanding of research infrastructure services and data-intensive research needs. She is an active collaborator on institutional, national and international committees stimulating effective communication and engagement with key stakeholders.

The talk will start at 5:00 pm for 1 hour and after we can have a social event for the last 30 minutes. End time 6:30 pm.

title: Practicing Data Visualization in R
description:
Practice your data wrangling and visualization skills with other members of R-Ladies! During this virtual event, participants will work on this week's Tidy Tuesday dataset.

The R for Data Science Online Learning Community hosts a weekly "Tidy Tuesday" project in which they release a curated dataset every Tuesday for R users to practice data skills.

The dataset will be posted here on Monday (same day as this Meetup): https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master/data/2020

We hope these meetups will provide a space to interact with other R users and set a time in their calendars to work on the Tidy Tuesday challenge. You can think of these meetups as an accountability tool rather than a class. Each meeting, R-Ladies Gainesville will provide an additional challenge to inspire you in your data visualization. This week's challenge is to use this maize color palette: https://github.com/AndiKur4/MaizePal

Prior to the Meetup, please make sure you have R downloaded on your computer (https://mirrors.nics.utk.edu/cran/). The free version of RStudio is recommended as well (https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/). See you there!

title: Digital phenotyping, artificial intelligence and mental health
description:
This talk will focus on the emerging intersection of artificial intelligence, digital phenotyping, and mental health. Dr. Omar C. will discuss research opportunities and challenges in diagnosis and clinically validated mental health interventions with artificial intelligence methodologies.

About the speaker:

Omar Costilla-Reyes is a postdoctoral researcher at the Institute of Medical and Engineering Sciences at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. His interests are in healthcare, artificial intelligence, education, and Latin America. In research, Omar focuses on artificial intelligence and digital health. Omar obtained his Ph.D. from the University of Manchester in England working at the intersection of artificial intelligence healthcare and biometrics. Omar is the founder and president of the Artificial Intelligence Latin American Summit at MIT. The goal of the summit is to incentivize leaders of the Latin American region in government, industry, and academia to invest and develop Artificial Intelligence for social benefit.

title: Visualizing Geographical Data with R
description:
If you work with spatial data, in this meetup you will get some ideas to do nice maps using R!
We will present an overview of a few different ways to make nice maps, both static and interactive.
We will start by building a plot using ggplot2 to visualize data with spatial information.
Then, we will introduce some basic concepts to work with georeferenced data in R, like vector, raster and reference system. We will explore the packages that allow us to manipulate this data into R.
We will finally explore the package tmap for rapidly creating beautiful and interactive maps!!

If you want also to run the code we will share consider installing the following packages before the start of the meetup:
- ggplot2
- tidyverse
- raster
- sf
- tmap
- tmaptools
- rnaturalearth

The meetup will be hosted online via Zoom -- the info to enter the meetup will be sent out via Meetup shortly before the start time. If you do not receive an E-Mail check your spam folder.

title: Data reporting with RMarkdown: from novice to master
description:
This meetup will cover basic features of RMarkdown and a few tricks that may help to create professional analytical reports using data. RMarkdown is a markup language, which enables users to embed R code in the document, edit text and document styles, and render visual information. Documents created using RMarkdown can be exported in a variety of formats, including .docx and .pdf.

Knowledge of RMarkdown allows R users integrate text and data analysis results in one place easier, including data checks, tables, and visualization. Additional benefit of RMarkdown is its ability to present data and analysis in interactive manner but this feature is out of the focus of this meeting.

===
Password for Zoom meeting: 486933
===

title: Become an R package developer!
description:
We're happy to announce the next speaker: Ma√´lle Salmon (https://masalmon.eu/), R(esearch) Software Engineer and a proud R-Lady.

About the meeting:

"Develop an R package", they said...
What does this even mean?
In this session with a live demo, we shall demystify the creation of an R package.
R packages are mostly well-organized folders, and there are automatic tools to help. Let's dive into the wonders of usethis!
We shall also see why to create a package (or not).
We shall furthermore explain how to improve your R package and your own package development skills. And how to solve the specific new challenges you will encounter!
Last but not least we will discuss how to find your happy place in the world of R package development. Do you want to be more of a devoted maintainer of one single package? Or perhaps a valued contributor to dozens of packages?

About the speaker:

Ma√´lle works remotely from Nancy, France, where she lives with her family.
She is a research software engineer with rOpenSci, besides other projects. In particular, currently, she works on the "HTTP testing in R" book thanks to funding from the R Consortium. She created the R-hub blog that features more or less niche topics about R package development, also thanks to funding by the R Consortium.
She also volunteers as an associate editor for rOpenSci's Software Peer Review (peer-review system of R packages), the main manager of R-Ladies Global Twitter account, and a member of the R Weekly team.

title: R for Psychology Research
description:
Research in Psychology is a wide and multifaceted field, which can be greatly strengthened by the use of R. Those already familiar with R can benefit by and learn from understanding how cognitive and behavioural research is carried out. This workshop will explore the broad fields of experimental psychology in the R framework. It will introduce participants to quantitative data analysis tools, including eye-tracking data, and discuss how various packages and forms of analysis (such as text and geographical data) can all be instrumentalised for psychology research. Finally, participants will have the opportunity to try some hands-on coding with a dataset on mental health factors.

Divya Seernani is finishing her PhD in Clinical Psychology, working as a psychologist with children and adolescents with neurodevelopmental disorders, and is an organiser for R-Ladies Freiburg. She has multiple international publications to her name, is passionate about eye-tracking in clinical settings and enthusiastic about science communication and diversity building activities.

https://de.linkedin.com/in/divya-seernani

The talk starts at 11.45 AM Tbilisi time. Please register here to receive the workshop materials and the Zoom link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1GjOFaFK4-vGjZFCgOgpZ9qy3Y-kOURbr_hC53uJhy7M/

title: Date Night (analysing dates with lubridate)
description:
How do you go about learning to use a new package in R? Do you like to watch people code so always turn to Youtube first? Or do you look for tutorials that someone has posted on their blog? Maybe you are a R purist and head to the package documentation?

I have decided that I want to learn how to deal with dates in R and in scheduling this talk, I am publicly committing to my goal! I am starting now and hopefully by the talk date in October I will have worked it out. If not, I might end up presenting about the process of learning to use a new package in R than how to use `lubridate` per se.

At this stage, it is a bit unclear what this talk will be, but either way it will be fun!!

See you in October!
Jen

title: Three reasons  to use tidymodels with Julia Silge
description:
Modeling and machine learning in R involve a bewildering array of heterogeneous packages, and establishing good statistical practice is challenging in any language. The tidymodels (tidymodels.org) collection of packages offers a consistent, flexible framework for your modeling and machine learning work to address these problems. In this talk, we‚Äôll focus on three specific reasons to consider using tidymodels. We will start with model characteristics themselves, move to the wise management of your data budget, and finish with feature engineering.

Julia Silge is a data scientist and software engineer at RStudio PBC where she works on open source modeling tools. She is an author, an international keynote speaker, and a real-world practitioner focusing on data analysis and machine learning practice. Julia loves text analysis, making beautiful charts, and communicating about technical topics with diverse audiences.

---

R-Ladies is a worldwide organization whose mission is to promote gender diversity in the R community.

A question we often get is "Are men welcome to attend this event?"

As a diversity initiative, the mission of R-Ladies is to achieve proportionate representation by encouraging, inspiring, and empowering people of genders currently underrepresented in the R community. R-Ladies‚Äô primary focus, therefore, is on supporting minority gender R enthusiasts to achieve their programming potential, by building a collaborative global network of R leaders, mentors, learners, and developers to facilitate individual and collective progress worldwide.

**As such, we strongly encourage cis-men who attend this event come as guests of R-Ladies who are minority genders (including but not limited to cis/trans women, trans men, non-binary, genderqueer, agender).**

All attendees are strongly encouraged to review the R-Ladies Code of Confuct (https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct) and must abide by it.

title: Web Scraping with Andrew Collier: Session 4
description:
Andrew Collier (Exegetic Analytics, @datawookie) is back to give us a four-week Web Scraping in R course! The term ‚ÄòWeb Scraping‚Äô refers to the automated gathering of information from websites hosted on the internet. It is a form of copying, in which specific data is gathered and copied from the web, typically into a central local database or spreadsheet, for later retrieval or analysis. Andrew has recently used web scraping to create the Trundler API and R package: a repository of historical pricing data of goods sold by major local retailers (https://www.trundler.dev/). The possibilities presented by this technology are endless, and we are super excited for this opportunity to learn more!

Outline
Session 1 (7 October):
‚Ä¢ Introduction to Web Scraping
‚Ä¢ Scraping with Screenshots
‚Ä¢ Working with URLs
Session 2 (14 October): Locating content with CSS and XPath
Session 3 (21 October): Scraping static sites with {rvest}
Session 4 (28 October): Scraping dynamic sites with Selenium

These sessions will take place via Google Meet at 17:30 sharp and last a maximum of 90 mins. We hope to see you there!

Set up instructions: https://datawookie.github.io/rladies-web-scraping/

To join: Use the Google Meet link provided - please mute your microphone when joining!

title: Expressions in R (Advanced R Ch18, R Ladies Netherlands)
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting a series of events based on Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).

Join us for our next meeting, in which Alejandra Hern√°ndez Segura will present the key points of the chapter on "Expressions" (chapter 18) which is part of the section in Metaprogramming. After the presentations, we will have some discussion and questions/exercises together so that we can clear up any doubts :)

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Also feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

ABOUT Ale
----------------------
Originally from Mexico, Ale now lives in the Netherlands where she studied Molecular Medicine in Groningen. She now works as a Bioinformatician for the RIVM (National Institute for Public Health
and the Environment), where she is in charge of doing automatization and ensuring reproducibility of analyses. She has been working through the chapters of Advanced R and now is ready to tell you all about "Expressions" in R.

title: Code-RLadies October Lightning Talk & Workshop - Virtual!
description:
Join us via Zoom: (link will show to all who RSVP)
Our Lighting Talk: TBD

Our Workshop Focus: TBD

======

What are Lightning talks? Lightning talks are quick, 5-minute mini-presentations that are showing the art of the possible. They increase awareness and excitement about possibilities. If you want to present a future Lightning Talk, contact us!

What are Workshops? Our workshops help Code-RLadies gather together, network, and learn from each other. Our workshops cover the bulk of the meeting. We believe in being hands-on! Are you interested in leading or participating in a workshop? Contact us!

title: Sensitivity Analysis of Parameters in Disease Modelling
description:
Raeesa Docrat will be talking to us about conducting sensitivity analysis on deterministic compartmental models with specific applications to COVID-19.

She'll have a little exercise at the end, so if you're interested in following along with that part of the session, please install the deSolve package.

It will be an online meetup, and the link will be posted closer to the date.

Zoom requires a passcode, which I sent via email. Please check your spam folder as `Meetup.com` messages often end up there.

title: An√°lisis estad√≠stico de experimentos: dise√±os factoriales
description:
Un nuevo meetup en formato virtual. Esta vez nos enfocamos en el an√°lisis cl√°sico de experimentos.

Pato se cop√≥ y nos va a contar sobre test para comparar grupos:
test t-student, an√°lisis de la varianza de una via (One-way ANOVA), su contrapartida no-parametrica el test de Kruskal-Wallis y el An√°lisis de la varianza de dos v√≠as (Two-way anova).
Como ajustar estos modelos y gr√°ficar sus resultados en R.

Para asistir al meetup, les recomendamos:

title: Analyzing Gender Bias with R
description:
For our October event, R-Ladies Yipeng Lai and Stacy Lansey will share short talks on using R for analyzing gender bias on Wikipedia and learning R through data visualization (which motivated an interesting side project on gender).

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page at noon on the day of the event.

Agenda (times approximate):
7-7:05 pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:05-7:30: "Text Analysis in R: Gender Bias in Wikipedia Biographies" by Yipeng Lai
7:30-7:55: "R is for Resilience: Learning R through Data Visualization" by Stacy Lansey
7:55-8:15: Questions and wrap-up

--- Talk Abstracts ---

"Text Analysis in R: Gender Bias in Wikipedia Biographies"
Speaker: Yipeng Lai

Abstract: This talk will focus on how to manipulate and analyze textual data in R using the quanteda‚Äã package. Yipeng will go over some basic natural language processing techniques. She will talk you through how to apply these techniques to dissect gender bias in Wikipedia biographies. She finds that biographies about female subjects are more likely to contain terms relating to gender and marriage.

Bio: Yipeng is an Applied Scientist at StreetEasy, NYC's local real estate marketplace. She just received her MS in Data Science from New York University this summer. She is passionate about natural language processing, data science for social good, and urban data. When she is not working with data, you can find her blogging about food and practicing latte art.

"R is for Resilience: Learning R through Data Visualization"
Speaker: Stacy Lansey

Abstract: I will talk about my first R Project, the visualizations for the Warby Parker Impact Report, and how I used the skills I gained to advocate for a shift in the descriptive adjectives associated with female students at my son's school.

Bio: Stacy Lansey is the Data Science Analyst at Warby Parker. She came to this role from a background in real estate and finance and is speaking about her experiences learning R in this role.

---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

title: Introduction to Flexdashboard and Debugging with Shinyobjects
description:
Description:
This workshop will cover the basics of building a flexdashboard in R. Topics will include reactive data objects, user experience, and efficiency best practices. We will also cover methods for debugging shiny code and introduce users to the shinyobjects package for troubleshooting. Some familiarity with R and RMarkdown will be useful and expected, but not required.

Speaker:
Jake Riley is a clinical data analyst at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia (CHOP). He enjoys developing tools for analytic teams and specializes in data visualization and package development.

This will be a virtual event on zoom. We will admit attendees from the waiting room at 6 pm!

title: Web Scraping with Andrew Collier: Session 3
description:
Andrew Collier (Exegetic Analytics, @datawookie) is back to give us a four-week Web Scraping in R course! The term ‚ÄòWeb Scraping‚Äô refers to the automated gathering of information from websites hosted on the internet. It is a form of copying, in which specific data is gathered and copied from the web, typically into a central local database or spreadsheet, for later retrieval or analysis. Andrew has recently used web scraping to create the Trundler API and R package: a repository of historical pricing data of goods sold by major local retailers (https://www.trundler.dev/). The possibilities presented by this technology are endless, and we are super excited for this opportunity to learn more!

Outline
Session 1 (7 October):
‚Ä¢ Introduction to Web Scraping
‚Ä¢ Scraping with Screenshots
‚Ä¢ Working with URLs
Session 2 (14 October): Locating content with CSS and XPath
Session 3 (21 October): Scraping static sites with {rvest}
Session 4 (28 October): Scraping dynamic sites with Selenium

These sessions will take place via Google Meet at 17:30 sharp and last a maximum of 90 mins. We hope to see you there!

To join: Use the Google Meet link provided - please mute your microphone when joining!

title: plot animation with gganimate
description: Want to make one of those trendy racing bar charts? Or enhance any of your ggplot2 graphs with animation? In this talk, Lisa Lendway will show us how to do that using the gganimate package.

title: R-Ladies Baltimore -- Create & share reproducible code with workflowr  (Virtual)
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

Keeping your research and data analyses organized can be hard. Tools that help you promotes effective project management, reproducibility, collaboration, and sharing of results can be incredibly important!

The next event is Tuesday October 20, 2020 from 12-1:30pm (virtual meetup on Zoom). In this meetup, Vebashini Naidoo (https://www.linkedin.com/in/vebashini-naidoo-4260a96a/) and Inger Fabris-Rotelli (https://www.up.ac.za/statistics/article/2326974/dr-inger-fabris-rotelli) from R-Ladies Johannesburg (!!) will discuss how to create and share reproducible code with R Markdown and the workflowr R package (https://jdblischak.github.io/workflowr/index.html).

For more a bit more information about workflowr pulled from the website above: "The workflowr R package helps scientists organize their research in a way that promotes effective project management, reproducibility, collaboration, and sharing of results. Workflowr combines literate programming (knitr and rmarkdown) and version control (Git, via git2r) to generate a website containing time-stamped, versioned, and documented results. Any R user can quickly and easily adopt workflowr."

WHO is this for?
- If you are new to R & how to organize and share your R code!
- If you analyze data in R, but are looking for better project management strategies!
- If you collaborate with other researchers and want to learn about best practices for reproducibility, collaboration, and sharing of results in R!

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA
12:00‚Äì12:15pm Who we are | Announcements | What's next
12:15‚Äì1pm Presentation: Create and share reproducible code with R Markdown and workflowr
1‚Äì1:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:
The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP the week before the event.

FAQ:
Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:
- If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:

title: Taller: maneja datos con R
description:
¬°Bienvenidas al segundo taller online de R-Ladies Madrid!

Despu√©s de aprender los b√°sicos de R con Cynthia, vamos a aprender a manejar datos con el conjunto de paquetes Tidyverse.

Los requisitos de este taller son tener instalados:
R (https://www.r-project.org/)
RStudio (https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)
Tidyverse (https://tidyverse.tidyverse.org/)

√çndice del taller:
1. Importar y exportar datos
2. Tidy data (qu√© es, pivotar, separar y unir)
3. Datos relacionales (operadores join)
4. Strings + regex
5. Fechas y tiempo
6. %>%
7. Transformaciones (filter, select, mutate, summaries)

Nuestra magn√≠fica profe se llama Mar√≠a Paula.

Mar√≠a Paula es economista, utilizadora e instructura certificada de R. Tiene experiencia usando R y Shiny para analizar datos, automatizar flujos de trabajo y producir reportes sobre diferentes temas de econom√≠a y pol√≠ticas p√∫blicas. Recientemente comenz√≥ a trabajar en la OCDE, despu√©s de un par de a√±os trabajando en como consultora en el sector privado. Originaria de Colombia, nos acompa√±a virtualmente hoy desde Francia, d√≥nde reside desde hace ocho a√±os.

Pod√©is seguir su twitter en https://twitter.com/mapaulacaldas
Y su website: https://www.mpaulacaldas.com/

Estad atentos el d√≠a del meetup a esta p√°gina donde pondremos el enlace al evento.

title: Web scraping using rvest
description:
Join us for a practical session on web scraping using rvest. Web scraping is a brilliant addition to your data scientist toolbox - it enables you to get large amounts of data for projects with many applications: price comparisons, weather predictions, natural language processing to name a few.

We have a guest speaker from Chile - Riva Quiroga who is a PhD student in Linguistics and a co-organiser of RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valpara√≠so and LatinR Conf.

Grab a snack or a drink and dial in on Monday, 19th October, at 5:15PM (GMT+1)

5:15-5:20 Welcome
5:20-5:30 Introductions
5:30-7:00 Talk and tutorial: Web scraping using rvest by Riva Quiroga

This is a practical session. You‚Äôll need to install RStudio and the following packages: tidyverse, janitor, robotstxt, polite and tidytext. Post a question below if you need help installing it.

We'll be recording the event for future reference, we hope that‚Äôs ok with you.

See you on the Internet :)
Jo, Paola and Sapna

title: Introduction to Data Visualization in ggplot2
description:
About the workshop: This will be the second meetup of R-Ladies BLR and we are collaborating with WAQSA(Women in Air Quality South Asia). The workshop will focus on data visualization in ggplot and understanding the usage of different packages for your dataset.

About the instructor: Meenakshi graduated with an MPH (Environmental and Occupational Health) from University of Washington, Seattle in 2015. She is currently the Director of Research at ILK Labs (https://www.ilklabs.com/about-us/team#h.p_kembYhXOTX-d) working on cross-cultural collaboration to produce policy-relevant health and environmental data, and engage with multi-disciplinary stakeholders to address global grand challenges. She is a full time R-user.

For the details please RSVP and register here - https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeGZ7l-pSbRXflWXL4RcqV6PRGDGtv-7fkOjF20zBEZIxo7Og/viewform?usp=sf_link.

title: [MeetUp Online] Contribuindo via GitHub no RStudio - RLadies SP na Hacktoberfest
description:
A Hacktoberfest √© uma celebra√ß√£o do Open Source que ocorre em outubro. √â uma celebra√ß√£o aberta para todes, onde as pessoas fazem contribui√ß√µes em projetos abertos, e caso fa√ßa contribui√ß√µes v√°lidas (de acordo com as regras), pode ganhar uma camiseta.

Neste evento, vamos abordar:

- Introdu√ß√£o √† Hacktoberfest e ao Open Source
- Introduzu√ß√£o ao Git e GitHub
- Demonstra√ß√£o e momento de pr√°tica: vamos configurar o Git e GitHub no RStudio (por isso √© importante j√° instalar todos os pr√©-requisitos, listados abaixo, ANTES do evento!)

title: R-Ladies Meeting: TBC
description:
Please come with the most updated version of R and RStudio installed on your laptop. Please see our github page for more details on current and past events, including materials and code! https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_montreal

As usual, snacks and drinks will be provided!!

Happy coding :-)

title: Predictive Modeling for Healthcare
description:
Dr. Beverly Festin Martinez is a member of the FSP Biometrics team at Syneos Health.

Dr. Martinez has served the needs of major stakeholders in the healthcare industry at patient-centered/customer-focused organizations. With her PhD in Statistics & Biometry from Emory University and continuing education in analytics, she has contributed to both randomized controlled trials and real-world evidence generation within the therapeutic areas of many disease models.

Dr. Martinez will present an example of prediction modeling (a.k.a. supervised machine learning) using R. This use case will highlight the process flow of applying predictive models in the healthcare space.

title: Web Scraping with Andrew Collier: Session 2
description:
Andrew Collier (Exegetic Analytics, @datawookie) is back to give us a four-week Web Scraping in R course! The term ‚ÄòWeb Scraping‚Äô refers to the automated gathering of information from websites hosted on the internet. It is a form of copying, in which specific data is gathered and copied from the web, typically into a central local database or spreadsheet, for later retrieval or analysis. Andrew has recently used web scraping to create the Trundler API and R package: a repository of historical pricing data of goods sold by major local retailers (https://www.trundler.dev/). The possibilities presented by this technology are endless, and we are super excited for this opportunity to learn more!

Outline
Session 1 (7 October): Introduction - Recording - https://youtu.be/EaWDZUReN9s

Session 2 (14 October): Locating content with CSS and XPath
Session 3 (21 October): Scraping static sites with {rvest}
Session 4 (28 October): Scraping dynamic sites with Selenium

These sessions will take place via Zoom at 17:30 sharp and last a maximum of 90 mins. We hope to see you there!

To join: Use the Zoom link provided - please mute your microphone when joining!

title: A Journey through R
description:
We have quite a few members of this group who are excited to begin their journey in coding with R. There are others in the group who have been using R for a few years and want to advance their skills. Whatever your skill level we would like to invite you to virtually join us on October 13th to go on a Journey Through R! We will kick off this session with information on how to get started with R, along with some beginner level code lines to acclimate you to the language. We will then transition into more advanced R capabilities so you can see all that is possible in the world of R!

We are hosting this session virtually in order to keep everyone healthy and safe, and to accommodate those needing to participate remotely. Our goal is to create a network of R users so those new to R can find a more advanced mentor, as well as just develop a group any member can turn to for R advice/support.

Meeting Details:
https://miamioh.zoom.us/j/85966026510?pwd=NndMRUZaOFVUeTNzc2hUWnVWalBJZz09

We will reach out to all registered attendees with the meeting ID and passcode.

title: Careers in the time of COVID
description:
Six months into the COVID19 pandemic and we have all weathered major changes in how and where we work. Some of us have learned to do our jobs remotely and others have made major career transitions as some career doors close and others open.

In this event, we will talk with a panel of Sydney-based #rladies about the changes that they have made in their careers in 2020. We will pick their brains about the move from academia to industry and from big corporate to small corporate. We will get their perspectives on working remotely, negotiating the job market in a pandemic, and what it is like to start a new job without ever meeting anyone in person.

Our panel members are...

Zoe Meers
background/old job: degree in government/stats, research fellow at USyd US Studies Centre
new job: data analyst at Canva

Sarah Romanes
background/old job: PhD in Statistics from the University of Sydney
new job: Senior Data Scientist at Boston Consulting Group/ BCG GAMMA

Steph Stammel
background/old job: PhD in Econometrics from USyd, consultant at PwC
new job: Principal Econometrician, strategy team at Transurban

Melanie Zeppel
background/old job: PhD in biology from UTS, research fellow in genomic medicine/drought/climate change
new job: data scientist/stat analyst in finance

Do you have a question for our panel?

We will use slido.com to field audience questions, you can contribute questions in advance of the event using the event tag #rladies_sydney

title: The Resume Guru!
description:
Do you wish to revamp your resume?

Are you looking for some tips when it comes to searching and applying for a job?

If YES then you need to come to our next seminar!

For our October event we are excited to welcome Tahlia Marks, the Resume Guru! Tahlia is a recruiter with a passion for well written resumes and interview hacks.

In her seminar Tahlia will discuss how to look for a job, information about the market, and salary expectations. She will cover how to set out a resume, what should and should not be included, as well as general dos and don'ts. Tahlia will also go over how to prepare for an interview, the typical interview layout, and what the interviewer will expect from you.

For more information about Tahlia please visit her website
https://tahliaco.wixsite.com/resumegurubytahlia

This will be an online seminar. Please connect 5 minutes before for a prompt start at 6:15pm.

We look forward to seeing everyone at this fantastic seminar!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Virtual Happy Hour!
description:
Join R-Ladies for our inaugural virtual happy hour on Tuesday, October 13th at 6 pm. The event will be hosted on Gather.Town which is a 2D world that allows proximity based video chat. Space is limited to 25 people, so if demand exceeds capacity, we'll schedule another one soon!

Come chat about R or not R with other Boston R-Ladies with your favorite fall libations--hot cocoa, pumpkin spice anything, cider, etc.

We will have some short ice breakers at the beginning of social hour to introduce folks to each other, but after that you will be able to walk about and mingle as you want.

description: En este taller se explicar√° y replicar√° la forma en la que la Unidad de Investigaci√≥n Aplicada analiz√≥ y proces√≥ los datos de la encuesta MCCI-Reforma 2020 por medio del paquete {srvyr} y loops for(i in 1:n){}.

title: R Ladies Boulder Meetup #11: Unsupervised clustering methods in R
description:
Hi Boulder UseRs! Join us for this month's **Virtual** R Ladies Meetup and join our new local Slack workspace (https://forms.gle/j36YGxuNwN6zZ8nW7)!

This month, Dr. Marta Jankowska will be showing us the ropes of some common machine learning algorithms in R. She will focus on unsupervised clustering methods.

Clustering methods are a set of unsupervised learning techniques to identify subgroups within a larger population. These methods are broadly useful as a first step for exploring high dimensional datasets. Two of the most popular methods are K-means and Hierarchical clustering. She will review the theory behind the methods, and work through two example applications in R.

We will be meeting over Zoom (Meeting link visible when you RSVP). Join us to connect with other R users in the Boulder area and learn some new techniques to apply in your work!

We hope you'll also join our local Slack workspace to keep the R help and conversation flowing! To get access to the Slack workspace, please fill out this short Google form: https://forms.gle/j36YGxuNwN6zZ8nW7.

title: Scenari e ruoli alternativi nella Data Science
description:
Siamo tornati con un nuovo evento per Ottobre!
3 lightning talks con 3 fantastici speakers che racconteranno le loro esperienze con i dati, in settori "non tradizionalmente" legati alla data science.

*Alice Corona, freelance nel mondo del #datastorytelling e #datajournalism, ci aiuter√† a colmare il gap tra informazione e dati offrendo visibilit√† ad una serie di ruoli molto versatili.

*Giulia Brandetti , senior data scientist di Enel, ci parler√† della sua esperienza in #peopleoperationanalytics e dell'implementazione di algoritmi di ML.

*Sonia Elicio - Growth Hacker ci racconter√† di #growthhacking e #marketinganalytics e della sua esperienza nel supportare la crescita di startups attraverso l'uso di dati e statistiche.

Cosa rappresenta #RLadiesItaly?

Un progetto congiunto tra R-Ladies Bari e Rladies Milan, due local chapters di RLadies (https://rladies.org/), organizzazione non-profit, che si prefigge di aiutare donne e minoranze ad accedere al mondo dela data science.

title: [ONLINE] Metaprogramming- Big picture! R-Ladies NL bookclub Advanced R- Ch 17
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).
Join us for our next meeting, in which Janine Khuc will present the key points of Chapter 17: ‚ÄúBig Picture"- that introduces us to the key concepts of metaprogramming, a powerful idea that deeply influences much R code. At the most basic level the idea is explored 'that code is data that can be inspected and modified programmatically'. We'll discover why we can write things like library(purrr) instead of library("purrr") within R and many more things.

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

ABOUT Janine
----------------------
Janine is a data scientist and one of the R-Ladies Amsterdam co-founders. Within the data science world she loves the intricacies that come with data science in the medical world, involving messy data (generation) and medical decision making that go beyond the technical nitty gritty. With her background in psychology she is well equipped to thoroughly understand the the requirements that go into a well designed data science project. She entered the world of data science through R- where her love for the language and the community developed. Now she is busy bringing the community in Amsterdam together supporting others in achieving their full programming potential through R.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Make sure to read the chapter (17) in advance!

LINK TO MEETUP
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
See on the right

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, Meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: Coding get-together with a Tidy Tuesday dataset
description:
We are excited to try a new event format: a dedicated time and supportive virtual space for us all to do some coding. We will use a Tidy Tuesday dataset to do data exploration, visualisation and analysis. Every participant will be free to take whatever direction they like and the coding will be done largely independently. But fear not, we will help each other when we get stuck and we will share our creations at the end of the event.

This event is meant for R-Ladies with any level of coding skills: whether you're a beginner or an experienced coder, you'll definitely get an opportunity to practice your skills and learn something new.

To participate, you need a computer with an installation of R and internet access. The workshop will be happening on Zoom - all attendees will be sent the access password in advance of the event. You can install Zoom on your computer for free if you like, but you can also use it via your internet browser.

Here is a very rough agenda:
5:30pm Welcome and introductions
5:45pm Get coding
6:30pm Quick check-in
7:15pm Sharing our findings and creations
7:30pm Closing of the event

To find out more about the Tidy Tuesday initiative, check out https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday or explore the #TidyTuesday hashtag on Twitter.

title: October R-Ladies Dallas Community Meeting
description:
Hi, R-Ladies!

I'm pleased to annouce that we will feature two speakers in our virtual October R-Ladies Dallas Community Meeting.

You may recall that we voted to create a series of projects around the Loan Default Prosper dataset suggested in the Udacity course in Lesson 10 for the Final Project. Details are provided in this document. The Loan Default Prosper dataset is the second-to-last row in the table.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qEcwltBMlRYZT-l699-71TzInWfk4W9q5rTCSvDVMpc/pub

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Featured Talk: Cleaning and Exploring the Loan Prosper Dataset
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
R-Ladies Dallas member Pavitra has volunteered to demonstrate an approach for cleaning the loan dataset and performing an exploratory data analysis. These tools/methods will be extremely valuable not only on our group project but also in our daily work.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Lightning Talk: Creating Excel Workbooks Programmatically within R
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
R-Ladies Dallas organizer Sydeaka will discuss how the openxlsx package could be used to programmatically create Excel workbooks directly within an R session. She will provide a live demo of code that can accomplish the following, all using R code:

* create a new Excel workbook from scratch, or add content to an existing Excel Workbook
* create multiple spreadsheets within a notebook
* customize fonts & colors
* highlight/color cells based on logical conditions
* apply conditional formatting
* dynamically insert figures

R openxlsx package details:

* Reference manual: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/openxlsx/openxlsx.pdf
* Vignettes:
- https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/openxlsx/vignettes/Introduction.html
- https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/openxlsx/vignettes/Formatting.html

*************************************************************************

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the group project and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Webinar + Slack sign-up: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdJhvSg-YrNYOrmju1yrXvYhFM7xMey1WpDq1NSGIp6x41VaA/viewform

*************************************************************************

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

Shel is a Senior Data Analyst based in Nairobi, Kenyaa. She's an RStudio Certified Tidyverse trainer, and recently worked as a Research Manager at Geopoll, and as a Data Analyst at Busara Center for Behavioral Economics. title: Comunicando seus resultados com R: aprenda a criar apresenta√ß√µes reprodut√≠veis
description:
-------> Sobre o que √© esse curso R-Ladies GYN?

O xaringan √© um pacote que tem como objetivo possibilitar a cria√ß√£o de apresenta√ß√µes em HTML com R. Sob o contexto de programa√ß√£o em R, a combina√ß√£o entre os pacotes RMarkdown e xaringan nos oferece uma elegante forma de criar slides usando R e RStudio. Com isso, a proposta deste minicurso consiste no ensino da cria√ß√£o de apresenta√ß√µes usando os pacotes mencionados, realizando uma atividade pr√°tica sobre a cria√ß√£o de apresenta√ß√µes do zero. O p√∫blico alvo deste minicurso s√£o pessoas de todas as √°reas, que tenham interesse em aprender como criar slides inteiramente reprodut√≠veis usando R.

-------> Preciso instalar algo?

Requerimentos t√©cnicos: Para este workshop, √© necess√°rio ter instalado uma vers√£o do R igual ou superior a 3.6, RStudio, e os pacotes {tidyverse}, {rmarkdown},{xaringan} e {pagedown}.

-------> Mas eu n√£o sei RMarkdown, e agora?

N√£o se desespere! As mentoras pensaram em voc√™s e fizeram um tutorial pra ajudar. Segue o link: https://beatriz-milz.shinyapps.io/tutorial_markdown/#section-equa%C3%A7%C3%B5es

-------> E quem s√£o as mentoras?

Beatriz Milz (ela/dela) - Doutoranda em Ci√™ncia Ambiental na Universidade de S√£o Paulo, pesquisadora no Projeto Tem√°tico FAPESP MacroAmb. Secret√°ria Executiva da Revista Ambiente & Sociedade. Co-organizadora da R-Ladies S√£o Paulo, satRday S√£o Paulo e instrutora da The Carpentries. Embaixadora de Inova√ß√£o C√≠vica da Open Knowledge Brasil.

Haydee Svab - Cientista de Dados e Pesquisadora em Mobilidade Urbana. Co-fundadora e cientista de dados da ASK-AR. Co-fundou os grupos RLadies-S√£o Paulo, PoliGNU e PoliGen. Atualmente cursa Especializa√ß√£o em Ci√™ncia de Dados e Big Data, √© mestra em Engenharia e Planejamento de Transportes (USP) e formada em Engenharia Civil/Arquitetura (USP).

-------> Que evento √© esse? LatinR?

LatinR √© uma confer√™ncia Latino-Americana sobre o Uso de R em P&D que acontecer√° entre 7 a 9 de outubro de 2020. Quer saber mais? Acesse https://latin-r.com/pt

-------> E tem mais cursos?

Claro! Acesse https://github.com/LatinR/talleres-2020/blob/master/README.md e veja a programa√ß√£o.

-------> Como me inscrever?

title: Virtual Workshop: An Introduction to Data Visualization in R with ggplot2
description:
About the workshop: This workshop will introduce plotting in R using the ggplot package. You will learn the theory of "grammar of graphics" and how to create and customize your own plots.

About the instructor: Meenakshi graduated with an MPH (Environmental and Occupational Health) from University of Washington, Seattle in 2015. She has worked on a range of environmental health issues including lead poisoning, air pollution, and water quality in Malawi, US, Vietnam, and India. She is currently the Director of Research at ILK working on cross-cultural collaboration to produce policy-relevant health and environmental data, and engage with multi-disciplinary stakeholders to address global grand challenges. See more: https://www.ilklabs.com/about-us/team#h.p_kembYhXOTX-d

We will send the zoom link in an email to those who are registered when we get closer to the event.

title: Sentiment Analysis with R
description:
Join us for an evening of sentiment analysis! Using different R packages (including tidytext and sentimentr), we'll find positive and negative sentiments in texts, but also more detailed emotions such as surprise or fear.

We'll look at questions such as:
Can we distinguish Shakespeare's comedies from his tragedies by looking at their sentiment scores?
How can we trace sentiment through chapters of a book, or lines of a play?
What are frequent positive and negative words in reviews of this year's hit game Animal Crossing?
Which emotions are expressed in Beyonc√©'s and Taylor Swift's song lyrics?

We'll learn how to visualise commonly used positive and negative words in comparison clouds (an extension of word clouds) and compare approaches which only look at single words to approaches which take into account negations and other items that can influence the sentiment score.

This meetup will start with a quick review of basic text processing steps, so it's suitable for all levels and you don't need any previous experience with this topic.

You will receive a zoom link within an hour of the event starting, so check your junk mailbox shortly before the event starts if you don't have it yet!

title: Web Scraping with Andrew Collier: Session 1
description:
Andrew Collier (Exegetic Analytics, @datawookie) is back to give us a four-week Web Scraping in R course! The term ‚ÄòWeb Scraping‚Äô refers to the automated gathering of information from websites hosted on the internet. It is a form of copying, in which specific data is gathered and copied from the web, typically into a central local database or spreadsheet, for later retrieval or analysis. Andrew has recently used web scraping to create the Trundler API and R package: a repository of historical pricing data of goods sold by major local retailers (https://www.trundler.dev/). The possibilities presented by this technology are endless, and we are super excited for this opportunity to learn more!

Outline

Session 1 (7 October):
‚Ä¢ Introduction to Web Scraping
‚Ä¢ Scraping with Screenshots
‚Ä¢ Working with URLs

Session 2 (14 October): Locating content with CSS and XPath
Session 3 (21 October): Scraping static sites with {rvest}
Session 4 (28 October): Scraping dynamic sites with Selenium

These sessions will take place via Google Meet at 17:30 sharp and last a maximum of 90 mins. We hope to see you there!

To join: Use the Google Meet link provided - please mute your microphone when joining!

title: Virtual presentations - Workflows and best practices for collaborative coding
description:
Join us for a follow-up session on workflows after last month's session on git/gitHub!

* What are we going to learn?
This seminar will discuss tools, tips, and tricks for:
- Organizing your data
- Coding workflows and best practices
- Repositories / projects / environments
- Project management
- Collaborating across skill levels and programming languages

* Who is going to present?
Dr. Caitie Keumpel is a conservation scientist who is currently a joint post-doctoral fellowship with the University of Queensland and World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) in UQ's Coral Reef Ecosystems lab. Caitie recently finished a post-doctoral fellowship at the National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis at UC Santa Barbara quantifying, mapping and comparing the environmental impacts of major food systems across the land and sea. Her research interests include protected area design, food system sustainability, and managing impacts on coral reefs.

* When are we meeting?
The talk will start at 5:00 pm to allow for socializing, questions, and discussion on workflows following the presentation. Finish time 6:30 pm.

************The presentation will start at 5:00 pm.************

* Where are we meeting?
We will meet virtually using Zoom, the link will be visible to people who RSVP.

* What else is needed?
This will be a ~40 min presentation followed by time for questions and discussion of workflow tools/tips/tricks.

We look forward to seeing you there!

title: [ONLINE] RStudio Conf Watch Party
description:
In this virtual event, we'll watch two, 20 min videos from RStudio Conf 2020 (https://rstudio.com/resources/rstudioconf-2020/), watch them, and discuss our main take-aways. It'll be a low-key event so sit down at your computer with a snack and drink and join us for fun conversations about R.

Discussion questions: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DgXc0mt-GU5fmQtjI9OxCrL8CgIIzFtFTvtbJHLCU3c/edit?usp=sharing

Agenda:
7:00-7:15 - Introductions and Group Chat
7:15-7:40 - Watch Video 1 (https://rstudio.com/resources/rstudioconf-2020/effective-visualizations/)
7:40-7:50 - Discuss Video 1 in Breakout Rooms
7:50-8:10 - Watch Video 2 (https://rstudio.com/resources/rstudioconf-2020/if-you-build-it-they-will-come-but-then-what-facilitating-communities-of-practice-in-r/)
8:10-8:20 - Discuss Video 2 in Breakout Rooms
8:20-8:30 - Final Discussion and Group Chat

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! All are welcome, including R-Ladies RTP members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What should I bring?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities. Serve yourself a beverage and a snack to fuel your evening!

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: An introduction to mixed models in R
description:
We are delighted to be hosting Athanasia "Mo" Mowinckel - a co-organiser of the R-Ladies Oslo chapter and heavily involved in R-Ladies Global! Mo does brain research at the University of Oslo where she is an advanced user of R and technology at large. Recently she wrote a little package to help other academics overcome the challenges (and trauma) of uploading CRAN and BioConductor packages to TSD (Service for Sensitive Data). Thank you for that Mo!

In this talk, she will showcase some of the methods she uses and develops. The methods have been applied to longitudinal brain measurements, however mixed models have a variety of applications in economics, social sciences, genetics and even animal husbandry.

Welcome Mo! Welcome everyone!

title: Introducci√≥n a Machine Learning con Tidymodels

EL ENLACE DE ZOOM SE COMPARTIRA EL MISMO D√çA DEL EVENTO a trav√©s de meetup, a quienes hayan confirmado asistencia.

title: Introducci√≥n al ABC para ense√±ar on-line
description:
Organizado por LatinR, R-Ladies Santa Rosa, R-Ladies General Pico y MetaDocencia.

Taller a cargo de Yanina Bellini Saibene, Mariela Rajngewerc y Celeste Molina Favero.

Vamos a introducir buenas pr√°cticas b√°sicas para manejo del aula presencial online. Cada detalle del taller, empezando por el formulario de pre-inscripci√≥n hasta el pedido de devoluci√≥n finalizado el taller, pasando por la ejecuci√≥n del mismo, son una demostraci√≥n de estrategias que pueden ser adoptadas o adaptadas a cualquier tarea docente que sucede interactuando en simult√°neo con estudiantes. Durante el taller tendremos una demostraci√≥n de c√≥mo contactar y preparar estudiantes para sumarse a la clase sincr√≥nica, c√≥mo manejar un aula virtual de 20 personas usando Zoom, veremos ejemplos para crear un ambiente positivo y tendremos una introducci√≥n a conceptos pedag√≥gicos de dise√±o de clases con foco en la audiencia, esquematizaci√≥n de contenidos con mapas conceptuales, evaluaci√≥n formativa con poder diagn√≥stico, participaci√≥n en un documento colaborativo para tomar notas y resolver evaluaciones formativas y otras herramientas pedag√≥gicas basadas en evidencia y f√°ciles de implementar.

**ATENCION:** Tienes que inscribirte a trav√©s de este formulario (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSddnptIAMdRgJYH0Vm6cNrk63x5f969Rd4pbuoGKmDgN02xFw/viewform?usp=send_form) usando la palabra clave LatinR en los comentarios del formulario.

title: AAAS Science & Technology Policy Fellowship Info Session
description:
The AAAS Science & Technology Policy Fellowship is a long-standing program that brings scientists to the DMV for 1 - 3 years of service in a variety of roles throughout the legislative, executive, and judicial branches of the federal government. Our brief stints as a AAAS Policy Fellow introduced us to many of the ways in which scientists contribute to government and policy, gave us an in-depth look at the processes of a small part of a massive federal agency, and led to collaborations and friendships with some amazing scientists pursuing careers in government and policy. In this informal talk, we will share our experiences with the application process and in the fellowship, an overview of what we learned and gained from the program, and what limited advice we can offer to anyone interested in the fellowship.

Wynn Meyer is an assistant professor of Biological Sciences at Lehigh University, where she is starting a lab to research genomic changes associated with dietary variation in mammals, and teaches Personal Genomics and Biostatistics. Her somewhat meandering career path has included jobs with a Red Cross genetic testing lab, an anti-hunger non-profit, research with species ranging from yeast to flies to lemurs to manatees, and most recently a AAAS policy fellowship at the NIH Office of Data Science Strategy. In this role she developed the NIH DATA Scholars Program, co-chaired a panel on artificial intelligence (AI) and healthcare for the AAAS Human Impacts of AI symposium, and facilitated connections between NIH and the National Science Foundation (NSF) in data science. Wynn loves R and its wide range of applications but is still learning how to use the tidyverse.

Sam Tyner is a data scientist at Tritura, a technology services company that specializes in legal services. Sam earned her PhD in Statistics from Iowa State University in 2017. After a brief postdoc stint, Sam served as the first AAAS STPF fellow at the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, where she worked in the Office of Survey Methods Research. In her role as a fellow, she worked on machine learning and data visualization projects, including Natural Language Processing problems and developing shiny apps for internal BLS use. Her other interests include network analysis and effective communication of statistics.

Dr. Amanda Price is an AAAS Science and Technology Policy Fellow and began her detail in the Child Development and Behavior Branch in the NICHD in August 2019, where she manages the Cognitive Development, Behavioral Neuroscience, and Psychobiology Program. Before that, she earned a Ph.D. in Human Genetics from the Johns Hopkins School of Medicine and completed a post-doctoral fellowship at the Lieber Institute for Brain Development in Baltimore, MD. Her work focused on measuring epigenomic and transcriptomic changes that occur during human brain development in cells isolated from postmortem brain tissue to better understand the relevant cell types and potential timing of action of genetic risk for schizophrenia, an adult-onset psychiatric disease thought to arise from perturbed developmental processes in early life.

https://www.aaas.org/programs/science-technology-policy-fellowships

title: Importando datos desde hojas de c√°lculo
description:
A partir de LatinR nuestra pr√≥ximo reuni√≥n: Importando datos desde hojas de c√°lculo.

Descripci√≥n del taller:
A menudo se comparten hojas de c√°lculo con informaci√≥n poco estructurada, o codificada como formato del texto y/o de las celdas que no se trasladan directamente a un objeto de R (ej. celdas de colores para denotar categor√≠as). √âsto resulta en p√©rdida de informaci√≥n potencialmente relevante, o bien, p√©rdida de tiempo al tener que interpretar y limpiar manualmente los valores de las celdas. En este taller se ense√±ar√° a importar y manejar este tipo de datos a R. Adem√°s, se demostrar√° la lectura y escritura de archivos .xls y .xlsx (paquetes readxl y writexl), el manejo de archivos con m√∫ltiples pesta√±as (paquete purrr), celdas con formato (paquetes tidyxl y unheadr), y la nueva funcionalidad del paquete googlesheets4 que permite leer y escribir en hojas de c√°lculo en l√≠nea, facilitando la colaboraci√≥n de manera reproducible. Al final del taller, los asistentes ser√°n capaces de compatibilizar el uso de R con las hojas de c√°lculo en sus flujos de trabajo y colaboraciones.

Requerimientos:
Para este taller es necesario tener instalado R igual o superior a 3.6 y los paquetes dplyr, readxl, purrr, writexl, tidyxl, googlesheets4, y unheadr (versiones de CRAN).

Ponente:
Dr. Luis D. Verde Arregoitia: Bi√≥logo, especialista en mam√≠feros. Autor de los paquetes unheadr y annotater, que se utilizan para manejar datos desordenados y a√±adir informaci√≥n sobre librer√≠as externas a c√≥digo existente. Interesado en la resoluci√≥n de problemas usando R, en √°reas como an√°lisis espacial, deportes, biolog√≠a evolutiva y videojuegos.

title: Latin-R e R-Ladies Natal: Escrevendo manuscritos acad√™micos usando RMarkdown
description:
Como parte da programa√ß√£o de Latin-R 2020, R-Ladies Natal vai sediar uma oficina ministrada por duas R-Ladies Rio de Janeiro :)

PREENCHER FORMUL√ÅRIO: https://forms.gle/JXdFz9qXbiY1VCw59

Esta oficina vai mostrar os diferentes passos e ferramentas para escrever manuscritos acad√™micos ou relat√≥rios t√©cnicos de forma automatizada e reprodut√≠vel usando R e rmarkdown.
Iremos abordar os seguintes temas: estrutura de um documento de rmarkdown, estrutura de pastas, fluxos de trabalho de um projeto de escrita, boas pr√°ticas de programa√ß√£o em R, cita√ß√£o (arquivos .bib) e gestores de bibliografia, formata√ß√£o e integra√ß√£o com editores de texto tradicionais e LaTeX.
A oficina ser√° dividida em uma parte conceitual e uma parte pr√°tica. O objetivo √© que todas as pessoas participantes finalizem a oficina com um documento de texto gerado a partir de um arquivo Rmd contendo texto, uma figura, uma tabela e refer√™ncias bibliogr√°ficas.

Os participantes dever√£o instalar os pacotes rmarkdown, knitr, kableExtra, remedy e palmerpenguins, e os programas Pandoc (https://pandoc.org/installing.html) e Zotero (https://www.zotero.org/), ou qualquer outro gestor de bibliografia, como Mendeley ou EndNote.

title: R4Bioinfo workshop : Introduction to Bioconductor Annotation Resources
description:
We are excited to invite you to the 2nd workshop of our R4Bioinfo series : Introduction to Bioconductor Annotation Resources.

During this workshop you'll learn about the different annotation packages provided by the Bioconductor project that can be used to incorporate additional information to results from high-throughput experiments.

Prerequisities :
Basic knowledge of R and Bioconductor https://bioconductor.org/

Date/Time : Wednesday, September 30th, 2020 5:30PM -> 7:30PM (Tunisia time GMT+1)
Place : Zoom https://zoom.us/download

Invited speaker :
‚ñ∂Ô∏è Dr. Martin Morgan: Director, Roswell Park R / Bioconductor Project.

‚ñ∂Ô∏è About Dr. Martin Morgan https://github.com/mtmorgan :
Dr. Morgan earned his undergraduate and Master's degrees in Botany at the University of Toronto. Dr. Morgan's PhD studies at the University of Chicago involved the evolutionary consequences of frequency-dependent selection, and of multilocus deleterious mutation.
Dr. Morgan spent 10 years as an Assistant and then Associate Professor at Washington State University, before joining the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center in 2005. At the Hutch, Dr. Morgan worked on the Bioconductor project for the analysis and comprehension of high-throughput genomic data; he has led Bioconductor since 2008. Dr. Morgan moved to Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center in Buffalo, NY in 2015, where the Bioconductor project is now based.

In order to attend the event, please fill out this form üëâ https://tinyurl.com/y5brdnv2
Those who fill out the form will receive an email shortly with instructions on how to join. Additionally you will get reminders right before the workshop with the link so you have it handy.

We look forward to e-meeting you!

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us ‚¨áÔ∏è

title: Aplicaciones web interactivas con Shiny
description:
¬°Hola a todas y todos!

Te damos la bienvenida al taller de LatinR 2020 a trav√©s de R-Ladies Concepci√≥n, es muy importante para nosotras tu participaci√≥n. El taller corresponder√° a "Aplicaciones web interactivas con Shiny" y estar√° a cargo de Florencia D'Andrea, Juan Cruz Rodr√≠guez y Vilma Romero.

Sobre el taller

¬øQuieres generar una p√°gina web interactiva a partir de tu c√≥digo de R? Con el paquete Shiny, resulta sencillo tomar tu trabajo en R y exponerlo a trav√©s de un navegador web para que cualquiera pueda usarlo. En este taller inicial desarrollaremos una Shiny app de principio a fin. Te acompa√±aremos para que puedas generar la interfaz de usuario y el c√≥digo del servidor. Brindaremos a la par algunas pr√°cticas y tips al momento de su construcci√≥n as√≠ como recomendaciones de paquetes que pueden mejorar sustancialmente la app. Para finalizar te mostraremos formas gratuitas en las que podr√°s compartir la misma.

Requerimientos

Paquetes necesarios: tidyverse, shiny, shinythemes. Dependencias adicionales (se puede hacer el taller sin tenerlas): ggtext, emojifont, emo. Este √∫ltimo no est√° en CRAN, puedes descargarlo con la funci√≥n remotes::install_github("hadley/emo")

Si es la primera vez que asistes a uno de nuestros eventos, recuerda revisar nuestro c√≥digo de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con √©l: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

https://latin-r.com/cdc/

title: R Ladies Netherlands Boook Club - Advanced R - Chapters 15/16: S4/Trade-offs
description:
The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up!

Starting in April, we are hosting an online book club. Our first book is Hadley Wickham's Advanced R (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).

In this meeting, Martine Jansen from R Ladies Den Bosch will present the key points of Chapter 15 : "S4" and Chapter 16: 'Trade-offs". After that, we'll try an exercise together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

The link to the event meeting will be provided closer to the date.

Online meetings will take place every two weeks. Check the full schedule, previous slides and sign up to present a chapter (would be so nice) at this link https://rladiesnl.github.io/book_club/ !

See you soon!
