title: Taller: intro a R y RStudio
description:
¬°Bienvenidas al cuarto a√±o de R-Ladies Madrid!

Este a√±o va a ser un poco especial ya que estaremos todo el a√±o en remoto, aunque esperamos vernos las caras pronto!

Vamos a empezar el a√±o con un taller a R y RStudio. Empezaremos desde cero pero s√≠ te recomentamos tener descargado e instalado R (https://cran.r-project.org/mirrors.html) y RStudio (https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/) para que no nos lleve tiempo el hacerlo en el taller.

√çndice del taller:
1. ¬øQu√© es R?
2. Bajar e instalar R y RStudio
3. RStudio
4. Scripts
5. Paquetes
6. Proyectos en R, reiniciar R, "working directory" (buenas pr√°cticas).
7. Variables.
8. Bucles.
9. Errores comunes: coma o punto decinal, rutas absolutas, RData.

Nuestra magn√≠fica profe se llama Cynthia. Cynthia es una mujer curiosa que no teme a los cambios en la vida.

Tras diplomarse en Fisioterapia, estuvo casi 10 a√±os ejerciendo su profesi√≥n, y una ma√±ana decidi√≥ dar un giro a su vida y buscar la manera de dedicarse a las nuevas tecnolog√≠as, en concreto a la ciencia de datos.

Comenz√≥ a formarse en febrero de este a√±o en The Bridge Digital Talent Accelerator, y tras muchas horas de programar y aprender habilidades necesarias para ser un Data Scientist, en Julio finaliz√≥ su formaci√≥n.

Ahora sigue estudiando cada d√≠a nuevas tecnolog√≠as y afianzando conocimientos vistos durante su formaci√≥n para seguir aprendiendo y, con ello, creciendo cada d√≠a en el sector.

Pod√©is seguir su twitter en https://twitter.com/CynZn

title: Taller LatinR - Expresiones regulares para la limpieza y transformaci√≥n de datos
description:
Este lunes nos unimos a las actividades de LatinR (https://latin-r.com), la conferencia Latinoamericana sobre uso de R en investigaci√≥n y desarrollo. En esta ocasi√≥n, en conjunto RLadies Ciudad de M√©xico, RLadies Gal√°pagos, RLadies Talca y RLadies Santiago, recibiremos el taller "Expresiones regulares para la limpieza y transformaci√≥n de datos", que estar√° a cargo de Riva Quiroga (https://twitter.com/rivaquiroga) y Stephanie Orellana (https://twitter.com/sporella).

title: Workshop: Mapas interactivos con R para la Gesti√≥n en Salud P√∫blica
description:
¬°Tercer meetup del 2020!

¬øQuieres aprender a hacer mapasüåé interactivos con Rüë©‚Äçüíª? ¬øSabes que los mapas üóæüõ§ de enfermedades son una importante herramienta para la gesti√≥n de la salud p√∫blica üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è?

Es hora de reencontrarnos y para esto nos hemos unido con la carrera de Ingenier√≠a Inform√°tica UPCH- Universidad Peruana Cayetano Heredia (https://www.facebook.com/IngInformaticaUPCH) üíªüîù.

Estamos muy felices üòÄ de contar con una s√∫per ponente:

Paula Moraga, Profesora de Estad√≠stica en King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST). Ella es Ph.D. en Matem√°ticas por la Universidad de Valencia y M√°ster en Bioestadistica por la Universidad de Harvard. Adem√°s, sus √°reas de inter√©s son Estad√≠stica Espacial, Programaci√≥n en R, Salud P√∫blica y es autora del libro "Geospatial Health Data: Modeling and Visualization with R-INLA and Shiny (https://www.routledge.com/Geospatial-Health-Data-Modeling-and-Visualization-with-R-INLA-and-Shiny/Moraga/p/book/9780367357955)

‚Ä¢ Lo que haremos:
Se mostrar√° c√≥mo hacer mapas interactivos con datos de las estimaciones de riesgo de c√°ncer de pulm√≥n. Para ello se usar√° un dataset del paquete SpatialEpi que contiene los casos de c√°ncer de pulm√≥n y las proporciones de tabaquismo en los condados de Pensilvania del 2002.

‚Ä¢ Requisitos:
Aseg√∫rate de tener instalado Zoom.
Recomendamos tener instalado los siguientes paquetes para que puedas replicar el c√≥digo durante el taller: SpatialEpi, ggplot2, dplyr, leaflet, sp y spdep.

***IMPORTANTE***
Para participar, dale "Asistir√©" en este evento.
Por razones de seguridad no compartiremos el link para ingresar a Zoom de manera p√∫blica. Estaremos enviando un correo con el link de zoom.

title: Books In Bars - How to be an antiracist
description:
Spend Friday night discussing How to be an antiracist (https://www.bookdepository.com/How-To-Be-An-Antiracist-Ibram-X.-Kendi/9780525509288?redirected=true&utm_medium=Google&utm_campaign=Base1&utm_source=US&utm_content=How-To-Be-An-Antiracist&selectCurrency=USD&w=AFCCAU9SG5P9UGA8VC6U&pdg=pla-293946777986:cmp-9463970525:adg-95102906766:crv-420351428878:pos-:dev-c&gclid=EAIaIQobChMIzJWdnuTu6gIVrAiICR1r0gLMEAsYBCABEgJAqPD_BwE).

#1 NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER - From the National Book Award-winning author of Stamped from the Beginning comes a "groundbreaking" (Time) approach to understanding and uprooting racism and inequality in our society--and in ourselves. "The most courageous book to date on the problem of race in the Western mind."--The New York Times NAMED ONE OF THE BEST BOOKS OF THE YEAR BY The New York Times Book Review - Time - NPR - The Washington Post - Shelf Awareness - Library Journal - Publishers Weekly - Kirkus Reviews Antiracism is a transformative concept that reorients and reenergizes the conversation about racism--and, even more fundamentally, points us toward liberating new ways of thinking about ourselves and each other. At its core, racism is a powerful system that creates false hierarchies of human value; its warped logic extends beyond race, from the way we regard people of different ethnicities or skin colors to the way we treat people of different sexes, gender identities, and body types. Racism intersects with class and culture and geography and even changes the way we see and value ourselves. In How to Be an Antiracist, Kendi takes readers through a widening circle of antiracist ideas--from the most basic concepts to visionary possibilities--that will help readers see all forms of racism clearly, understand their poisonous consequences, and work to oppose them in our systems and in ourselves. Kendi weaves an electrifying combination of ethics, history, law, and science with his own personal story of awakening to antiracism. This is an essential work for anyone who wants to go beyond the awareness of racism to the next step: contributing to the formation of a just and equitable society. Praise for How to Be an Antiracist "Ibram X. Kendi's new book, How to Be an Antiracist, couldn't come at a better time. . . . Kendi has gifted us with a book that is not only an essential instruction manual but also a memoir of the author's own path from anti-black racism to anti-white racism and, finally, to antiracism. . . . How to Be an Antiracist gives us a clear and compelling way to approach, as Kendi puts it in his introduction, 'the basic struggle we're all in, the struggle to be fully human and to see that others are fully human.' "--NPR "Kendi dissects why in a society where so few people consider themselves to be racist the divisions and inequalities of racism remain so prevalent. How to Be an Antiracist punctures the myths of a post-racial America, examining what racism really is--and what we should do about it."--Time

PS Please contact the organizer if you need support finding the book.

title: W+DS: Data Science Methodology
description:
Michigan State University & University of Michigan invite you to their joint monthly webinar & meetup series for Fall 2020!

Agenda
===========
3:30: Keynote: Teaching computers to discover scientific knowledge by reading papers
4:15: Lightning Talks: Data Science Methodology
* Alyssa Travitz (UM)
* Yiqi Wang (MSU)
* Danielle Barnes (MSU)
* Sarah Tymochko (MSU)"
4:45: Networking + Q&A
5:00: Wrap-up

Registration
============
Please complete the form below to receive Zoom meeting details: https://forms.gle/j6psmyVFRBBdAVDV8

About the Keynote
======================
Enormous amounts of ever-changing knowledge are available online in diverse emergent textual styles (e.g., news vs. science text). This talk presents some of the H2Lab @UW's recent efforts to address the problem of textual comprehension and reasoning about scientific text, including knowledge extraction and claim verification given scientific articles.
More information: https://women-plus-datascience.github.io/

Keywords
==========
Natural Language Processing, NLP for bio-medicine, Deep Learning, Knowledge extraction

About the Keynote Speaker
===================
Hanna Hajishirzi is an Assistant Professor in the Paul G. Allen School of Computer Science & Engineering at the University of Washington and a Research Fellow at the Allen Institute for AI. Her research spans different areas in NLP and AI, focusing on developing machine learning algorithms that represent, comprehend, and reason about diverse forms of data at large scale. Applications for these algorithms include question answering, reading comprehension, representation learning, knowledge extraction, and conversational dialogue. Honors include the Sloan Fellowship, Allen Distinguished Investigator Award, multiple best paper and honorable mention awards, and several industry research faculty awards. Hanna received her PhD from University of Illinois and spent a year as a postdoc at Disney Research and CMU.

Planning Committee
===========
*Dr. Janani Ravi, Pathobiology and Diagnostic Investigation, MSU, R-Ladies East Lansing
*Dr. Jing Liu, Michigan Institute for Data Science (MIDAS), U-M
*Dr. Elizabeth Munch, Department of Computational Mathematics, Science & Engineering, MSU
*Dr. Parisa Kordjamshidi, Department of Computer Science & Engineering, MSU
*Dr. Dola Pathak, Department of Statistics, MSU

Questions, sponsorship interests, email is at:
women.plus.datascience@gmail.com

title: Tidy Tuesday September Event
description:
Come join R-Ladies Ottawa for a fun, interactive mini-coding session! For this event, we will be using this weeks's data posted to https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday

The goal of this exercise is to find meaningful relationships in the data.

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies Ottawa members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What do I need?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R.

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Virtual Workshop: How to Take your data from Messy to Tidy
description:
Erin Grand will introduce key data cleaning steps that she uses everyday. She will review the janitor package for working with duplicate rows and the tidyr package for working with tidy data structure.

Materials will be posted soon!

Erin works as a Data Scientist at Uncommon Schools where she trains coworkers in R as well as maintaining two R packages. Prior to Uncommon, she worked as a Data Scientist at Crisis Text Line and as a software programmer at NASA while completing her Data Science Masters at Columbia University. Before data science, Erin researched star formation and taught introductory courses in astronomy and physics at the University of Maryland.

Passcode to the Zoom event is STL2020

title: Show and Tell your R Code
description:
Have you been working on code you are particularly proud of? Or do you have some code that is driving you crazy?

Bring it along to this online event and share your triumph and/or frustration. Last time we learned about some hidden gems of dplyr, the magic of facet_wrap in ggplot and some super cool mapping using leaflet. Who knows what this session will bring!

This event will be via Zoom.

Check out some of the cool things we have shared at Show and Tell events earlier this year.

https://rladiessydney.org/post/2020-05-02-show-and-tell-may-2020/
https://rladiessydney.org/post/2020-06-02-show-and-tell-june-2020/

title: Code-RLadies September Lightning Talk & Workshop - Virtual!
description:
Join us via Zoom: (link will show to all who RSVP)
Our Lighting Talk: TBD

Our Workshop Focus: TBD

======

What are Lightning talks? Lightning talks are quick, 5-minute mini-presentations that are showing the art of the possible. They increase awareness and excitement about possibilities. If you want to present a future Lightning Talk, contact us!

What are Workshops? Our workshops help Code-RLadies gather together, network, and learn from each other. Our workshops cover the bulk of the meeting. We believe in being hands-on! Are you interested in leading or participating in a workshop? Contact us!

title: Virtual Meetup: Algorithms of Oppression by Safiya Umoja Noble
description:
The Brown School at Washington University in St. Louis & R-Ladies St. Louis present a talk by Dr. Safiya Umoja Noble as part of the 2020-2021 Public Health Speaker Series at The Brown School.

Dr. Safiya Umoja Noble is an Associate Professor at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) in the Department of Information Studies where she serves as the Co-Founder and Co-Director of the UCLA Center for Critical Internet Inquiry (C2i2).

She also holds appointments in African American Studies and Gender Studies. She is a Research Associate at the Oxford Internet Institute at the University of Oxford and has been appointed as a Commissioner on the Oxford Commission on AI & Good Governance (OxCAIGG). She is a board member of the Cyber Civil Rights Initiative, serving those vulnerable to online harassment.

Her academic research focuses on the design of digital media platforms on the internet and their impact on society. Her work is both sociological and interdisciplinary, marking the ways that digital media impacts and intersects with issues of race, gender, culture, and technology. She is regularly quoted for her expertise on issues of algorithmic discrimination and technology bias by national and international press.

title: Sport, Data & R
description:
Hi Everyone!

This month we are excited to welcome Alice Sweeting!

For our September event Alice will take us through how R is used to analyse and visualise sport science data. Specifically, how the physical and skilled outputs of team-sport athletes can be analysed, using the tidyverse and data mining techniques, to gain insights into matches and training.

Alice is a research scientist within the Institute for Health and Sport at Victoria University. She is also embedded as a sports scientist at the Western Bulldogs, a professional Australian Rules football club who play in the AFL, as part of a strategic partnership between Victoria University and the Western Bulldogs.

Alice co-supervises a number of PhD students who are working on sports analytics projects. These projects include profiling team-sport athlete physical and skilled output using time-series analysis, detecting kicks via wearable sensors, and understanding tactical behaviours using spatiotemporal data.

Alice is particularly passionate about programming in R and visualising sports analytics data. She has taught workshops on programming in R for sport scientists, and loves helping people learn how to clean, analyse and visualise their sports data. Aside from sports analytics research and programming in R, Alice loves spending time outdoors with her mini dachshund puppy (Dudley), baking sweet treats, following Suncorp Super Netball, and watching equestrian events (mainly eventing & showjumping) on TV.

We hope you will all be able to join us for this exciting seminar! Please connect the zoom event at 5:30pm.

We look forward to seeing everyone!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Application of graphical models to metabolomics
description:
Ce tutorial faisait part de la conference useR2020, et √† cause du covid-19 le tutorial a √©t√© offert √† R-Ladies Strasbourg. Il sera fait en Anglais car les intervenants pr√©senteront sur zoom depuis les √âtats-Unis.

For this tutorial we will give the priority to R-Ladies Strasbourg and the R-community in Strasbourg and surrounding. Thank you for your understanding.

This tutorial will identify a suite of tools for using network models in applied data analyses. Examples will utilize metabolomics data
from ongoing large-scale health research studies, although techniques are transferrable across multiple domains. This workshop will
link network visualizations with statistical analyses of complex metabolomics data and will emphasize detection of network
subcomponents that link to health outcomes. Utility of these tools for ‚Äòstory telling‚Äô in complex data settings will be illustrated.
Learning objectives for the workshop are to:
1) Explain the use of network models in metabolomics and other omics studies
2) Apply R programming to analyze metabolomics and other omics network data
3) Visualize network models using R

The tutorial will include didactic instruction, demonstration of code and hands on work time for provided exercises. All exercises will be constructed in an R markdown format. Example code will be extracted from the .Rmd file for easy copy-and-paste execution during the course.

Didactic introduction to network models and metabolomics (30 min)
Demonstration of code for creating basic network data objects in R (20 min)
Hands on work time for first set of exercises (40 min)
Break (30 min)
Didactic introduction to graphical lasso and differential network analysis (30 min)
Demonstration of code for performing graphical lasso and differential network analysis in R (20 min)
Hands on work time for second set of exercises (40 min)

The course will be co-taught by Raji Balasubramanian, PhD, Associate Professor of Biostatistics at University of Massachusetts at Amherst in Amherst, MA and Denise Scholtens, PhD, Professor of Biostatistics at Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine in Chicago, IL.
Drs. Balasubramanian and Scholtens are long time R users (15+ years) and statistical collaborators on the development of network methods for metabolomics data analysis. They previously co-taught a similar workshop at Metabolomics 2019 in The Hague, Netherlands. They are both regular faculty instructors in the graduate biostatistics degree programs at their respective institutions. Links to their faculty pages are below.
https://www.umass.edu/sphhs/person/faculty/raji-balasubramanian
https://www.feinberg.northwestern.edu/faculty-profiles/az/profile.html?xid=16163

title: First Meetup (Pertemuan 001) - Mengenal R dan RStudio
description:
Dear R-Ladies,

Lets meetup for the first time!

Agenda singkat:

Pembukaan
(5 menit pertama)
1. Pembukaan oleh Moderator
2. Kata sambutan oleh Ketua Departemen SS Himasta Unsyiah - Syafinatur Rahmi

Penyampaian Materi oleh Salsabila Mahdi
(15 menit)
3. Pengenalan R-Ladies dan sesi kenalan sekilas bersama
4. Pengenalan Pemrograman dan R
(15 menit)
5. Setup RStudio - environment, profile, library path, options, etc
6. Packages - cara install dan help pages
(sisa waktu)
7. Praktik langsung - menjalankan sintaks "menarik"

Sebelum pelatihan, harap sudah menginstall R dan RStudio di:
https://repo.bppt.go.id/cran/

Jika ingin membuat package, ataupun install package dari "source" sehingga bisa otak atik package lain, download Rtools (Windows):
https://repo.bppt.go.id/cran/bin/windows/Rtools/
Mohon sesuaikan dengan OS dan kebutuhan.

We hope to see you there,
R-Ladies Banda Aceh Organizers

https://cutt.ly/daftarrladies

PPS: Khusus R-Ladies!

title: Analyzing and visualising spatial and spatiotemporal data cubes
description:
The RLadies Monterrey chapter community is very happy to announce that we will be hosting one of the useR! 2020 online tutorials (https://user2020.r-project.org/program/tutorials/). We will have the honor of having Edzer Pebesma and Martijn Tennekes in our meetup, who will be running the tutorial: "Analyzing and visualising spatial and spatiotemporal data cubes" on September 19th, 16:00 UTC (i.e. 11 am CDT).

Background

Data cubes are a modern way to denote array data, and we focus on array data where some of the dimensions refer to space and time. Examples are spatial raster data, multivariate time series for multiple locations, and time series of raster images such as satellite data or weather predictions. In this workshop we will show a variety of cases where such data arise, and demonstrate how they can be analysed and visualised with R. While doing so, we mainly focus on using the R packages sf, stars, tmap and mapview, but also address a number of other useful packages for this context.

Link to the project homepage: http://github.com/r-spatial/useR2020muc

Target Audience

R users, who are somewhat familiar with (or have a demand for learning about) spatial data handling in R, and who are interested in analysing and dealing with raster data and spatiotemporal data cubes.

Prerequisities

Some familiarity with R and R-spatial, as well as some prior knowledge about time series and spatial data analysis is recommended, but is not a hard requirement.

FAQs:

O que √© R?

R √© uma linguagem de programa√ß√£o de computador e ambiente de software para computa√ß√£o estat√≠stica e gr√°ficos. Confira aqui (https://www.r-project.org/). Ele √© usado para an√°lise e visualiza√ß√£o de dados em uma ampla variedade de campos.

O que √© R-Ladies?

A comunidade R-Ladies √© uma organiza√ß√£o global que promove a diversidade de g√™nero na comunidade da linguagem computacional estat√≠stica (R). Embora nossos eventos considerem pelo menos o interesse de n√≠vel b√°sico em R (algum conhecimento anterior √© √∫til, mas n√£o obrigat√≥rio), voc√™ √© mais que bem-vinde a participar de qualquer uma de nossas sess√µes para ver o que fazemos.

Onde posso acessar seus materiais?

Vamos carregar os materiais para a nossa pasta no GDrive (https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1UNO_46lSQ63aU71tIR70-7le0ez10HT5).

Precisa ter algum conhecimento pr√©vio?

H√° a necessidade de ter pelo menos um conhecimento b√°sico no R.

Preciso de alguma estrutura pra acompanhar o curso?

Para acompanhar o curso online, o ideal √© ter acesso a um computador e internet r√°pida. Uma conta ativa no RStudio Cloud tamb√©m ser√° necess√°ria. Veja como cri√°-la aqui: https://medium.com/rladiesbh/r-studio-cloud-como-programar-em-r-usando-a-web-aa6313a5fb8c

Vai ter certificado?

Vai sim, todo mundo que comparecer ao evento ter√° direito a um certificado de 6h.

O curso √© gratuito?

Sim. Por√©m, teremos um n√∫mero limitado de vagas gratuitas.

Eu sou homem, posso me inscrever?

Este grupo √© principalmente voltado para o p√∫blico feminino e LGBTQIA+, mas est√° aberto a todos que concordam com o CoC (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#portuguese). Dito isto, se voc√™ √© um homem e quer participar dos nossos encontros, voc√™ est√° convidado a participar!

Ficou alguma d√∫vida?

title: How to Find a Mentor
description:
# How to Find a Mentor

# Schedule
Tuesday, September 15th, 6:30-8:30pm
6:30 - Zoom Breakout Rooms Networking Activity
6:55 - Announcements
7:00 - How to Find a Mentor Talk #1 (Gabriel Ruiz)
7:25 - Questions for Gabriel Ruiz
7:35 - How to Find a Mentor Talk #2 (Fatima Tuz-Zahra)
8:00 - Questions for Fatima Tuz-Zahra
8:10 - General Questions and Discussion
8:30 - Meeting Adjourned

# Meeting Location
Out of an abundance of caution regarding COVID-19 and in order to prioritize the health and safety of everyone who attends our events, this meeting will be held online using Zoom.

The meeting link will be visible to all registered attendees.
Please use the RSVP button to register!

# Presentations
How to Find a Mentor
Speakers: Gabriel Ruiz and Fatima Tuz-Zahra
Gabriel Ruiz's Bio:
"I am a 4th year PhD student in statistics at UCLA where my research is on data mining and causal inference with motivations coming partially from biology and gaps in statistical theory. I completed my B.S. in statistics at UC Riverside in 2017, and while there I was a part of our student chapter of the ASA and participated in undergraduate research. I grew up in the San Gabriel Valley and Riverside, CA and am a first-generation college graduate."
Gabriel Ruiz's Abstract:
"I will talk about the important role mentors have played in my short career so far. Using personal anecdotes from my undergraduate years, I hope to show that a mentor can be an older classmate or colleague in an organization (like R-Ladies Irvine!), a boss you find through a research or internship program, or a wise professional by the name of Madeline Bauer you reached out to an event like the ASA DataFest competition. My key message: it always helps to have someone in your corner cheering you on, especially at key junctures like deciding what classes to take, what internships to apply to, or what to do after graduation."
Fatima Tuz-Zahra's Bio:
"My name is Fatima Tuz-Zahra, I graduated from SDSU with an MS in Statistics. I am currently working as a statistician at UC San Diego. My interests are statistics, causal inference and machine learning."
Fatima Tuz-Zahra's Abstract:
"This talk will focus on how, in your role as a student and/or a job seeker, you can find a mentor to charter your route to success as smoothly as possible."

# Live-streaming & Meeting Materials
- All registered attendees will receive a Zoom link to join the meeting. Please see the information above.
- All materials will be sent out and posted on our GitHub (https://github.com/rladies-irvine) after the event.
- The recording of the meeting will be sent out and posted on our YouTube Channel (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIbS1KNK7jbcbQVNt7lF62A) after the event.

title: Mastering R6! Advanced R, Chapter 14, R-Ladies NL Book Club
description:
Welcome!!

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).
Join us for our next meeting, in which Johanna Mu√±oz
will present the key points of Chapter 14: "R6".
After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

And sign up to discuss one of the chapters at https://bit.ly/2QBYGEG!

ABOUT Johanna
----------------------
Johanna is a researcher with a diverse background. She loves statistics, and although she considers she is far away from being a programming wizard, she survives using R as her weapon of choice.

ABOUT the chapter
----------------------
R6 is an implemention of encapsulated object-oriented programming for R, and is a simpler, faster, lighter-weight alternative to R‚Äôs built-in reference classes. This style of programming is also sometimes referred to as classical object-oriented programming.

Some features of R6 from https://r6.r-lib.org/:

- R6 objects have reference semantics.
- R6 cleanly supports inheritance across packages.
- R6 classes have public and private members.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Make sure to read the chapter in advance!
Note that Jitsi works best with chrome

LINK TO MEETUP
----------------------
https://meet.jit.si/rladiesnl_bookclub_chp14

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: R-Ladies Dallas group project + social justice initiatives
description:
Hi, R-Ladies!

In our last few events, we resolved to challenge ourselves to grow in our R programming skills. Congratulations to those of you who made it through the lectures and practice problems in the "Data Analysis with R" course on Udacity.

Link to the course: https://www.udacity.com/course/data-analysis-with-r--ud651

To help us all get a firmer understanding of the concepts learned in the course, we have decided to work on a class project. In our last event, we voted to create a series of projects around the Loan Default Prosper dataset suggested in the Udacity course in Lesson 10 for the Final Project. Details are provided in this document. The Loan Default Prosper dataset is the second-to-last row in the table.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qEcwltBMlRYZT-l699-71TzInWfk4W9q5rTCSvDVMpc/pub

This type of dataset appears often in data science interview challenges, so it would be helpful to get familiar with the dataset, learn loan/credit terminology, and gain some initution about the unique challenges an analyst will encounter with this type of project. In this meetup, we will get an introduction to this dataset and get a first look at the first mini-project that we will work on together as a group.

We will also have a chance to briefly discuss the social justice initiatives that Sydeaka Watson discussed in her Why R? webinar talk, "Data Science for Social Justice Activism". To attend/register for the Why R? webinar, see the details provided at the following link.

https://www.meetup.com/rladies-dallas/events/273060804/

*************************

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the group project and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Webinar + Slack sign-up: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdJhvSg-YrNYOrmju1yrXvYhFM7xMey1WpDq1NSGIp6x41VaA/viewform

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

About R-Ladies Dallas

R-Ladies Dallas welcomes members of all R proficiency levels, whether you're a new or aspiring R user, or an experienced R programmer interested in mentoring, networking & expert upskilling. Our non-profit, civil society community is designed to develop our members' R skills & knowledge through social, collaborative learning & sharing. Supporting minority identity access to STEM skills & careers, the Free Software Movement, and contributing to the global R community!

A local chapter of R-Ladies Global, R-Ladies Dallas exists to promote gender diversity in the R community worldwide. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R. As a founding principle, there is no cost or charge to participate in any of our R-Ladies communities around the world.

Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies, and by being respectful of the fact that this event is primarily for women/non-binary/female-identifying individuals.

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

title: Decision Trees & Random Forests
description:
DESCRIPTION:

Decision trees are easy to understand and form the basis for random forests, a powerful machine learning technique. In this meetup, we are excited to have a line-up of presenters to share how to engage with tree-based methods in R.

AGENDA:
This will be a virtual event on zoom. We will admit attendees from the waiting room at 6 pm!

(6:00 - 6:15) Welcome and Announcements

(6:15 - 6:45) Walkthrough of hierarchical clustering in R, presented by Kavana Rudresh.

(6:45 - 7:00) Trang Le will share an intro of her package, treeheatr (https://trang1618.github.io/treeheatr/), which creates interpretable decision tree visualizations with the data represented as a heatmap at the tree's leaf nodes.

(7:00 - 7:30) Decision trees vs random forests, presented by Karla Fettich

title: First R-Ladies Bangalore Virtual Meetup
description:
We are happy to announce that we will be kick starting R-Ladies Bangalore chapter on 12 September 2020 @ 3:30 pm IST. This event will involve talks and interactive session from the R-Ladies Bangalore organisers, mentors!

We believe in R-Ladies Global organisation's vision-

Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in working with R. We promote diversity. There is no cost to participate in any of the R-Ladies Meetup. Our goal is to exchange knowledge and experiences of R programming in a supportive environment. We also aim to produce more R speakers using this platform.

Please make sure you read and comply with our code of conduct ( https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct ) and community guidelines ( https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/blob/master/RLadiesRulesAndGuideLinesENES.md ).

We are happy to announce that we will be having the first R-Ladies Meetup along with the kick start! üéâ

Register yourself by filling up this form (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScb8cb5wTfMx_4GlELJzkaYtKIG-PvMzOL2twWwqFGOUVFBUQ/viewform).

About the meet-up: This Meetup will be focused for beginners in R. It will include: using basic R Commands and importing/exporting a dataset. It will also help in understanding data structures, manipulating the data and visualizing it. A follow up exercise is included.

About the instructor: Anupama got her PhD from the Indian Institute of Management Bangalore in March 2020. She is currently employed at Sabre Travel Technologies in Bangalore and makes market share predictions for airlines. Her interests lie in business forecasting and time series analysis. She uses R primarily for her work but is slowly making forays into PySpark and TensorFlow. She also happens to be one of the co-organiser of the R-Ladies Bangalore chapter.

üì£
Important instructions:

1. If you are a beginner and have never used R, we would recommend you to download the stable version of R for Windows (https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/old/) or for mac/Linux (https://mirror.niser.ac.in/cran/). It will be a hands-on session. If you do not have access to a system you can use the limited free cloud service provided by RStudio (https://rstudio.cloud/plans/free).

2. Also, for a smooth experience with R it is best to work with RStudio, an IDE which can be downloaded (https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/).
Here is a guide to install R and RStudio (https://courses.edx.org/courses/UTAustinX/UT.7.01x/3T2014/56c5437b88fa43cf828bff5371c6a924/).

3. If you are unable to install it in your system, you can join 15 minutes prior to the Meetup, the co-organisers can help you to set up.

4. We will share the link of the slides after the Meetup.

We are on twitter, find us at: R-Ladies BLR (https://twitter.com/RLadiesBLR) and keep a lookout here to get updates about upcoming events here.

You can find more information about R here (https://www.r-project.org/).
You can find more information about R - Ladies Global (https://rladies.org/).
Please feel free to reach out to us with your queries/suggestions and spread the word at bangalore@rladies.org. The zoom link will be shared to those who have registered for the event using the form above.
All events this year will be online.

Cheers,
R-Ladies Bangalore Team

title: DataJam 2020
description:
To confirm your participation, please sign up here (this post is just for promotion purposes): https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSft4I0fi-Mw6xR5DXY0HUAxqD-kJJf_METKDWxKhPGc45MUrg/viewform

Vancouver Datajam 2020 is a hackathon-like event where you can develop your coding skills and meet other members of the community. Participating groups include RLadies, PyLadies, Women in Machine Learning/Data Science, SFU Scientific Programming, and Women Techmakers. As of March 2020, the Datajam has transitioned to a fully virtual event! The event kicks off on September 11, 2020, with exciting workshops on R, Python, and virtual collaboration in GitHub. The main hackathon portion of the event will occur from 9am-5pm on September 12, 2020. That evening, we'll be featuring a Q&A panel composed of both industry professionals and academics. This year our theme is "hack for a plastic waste free future." Datajam participants will work to bring awareness to the plastics crisis with projects that aim to understand, visualize, and make predictions about plastic waste data.

Curious about how our virtual hackathon will operate?

Datajam Goes Virtual
Our event committee is working hard to set this event up for success in the virtual space. Here‚Äôs a few areas on which we are focusing:
Virtual networking: we‚Äôll be setting up opportunities for participants to meet one another in small group settings and will encourage teams to connect virtually.
Tutorials: Tutorials will continue as planned, but in a virtual setting. We‚Äôll still have volunteers available to help participants troubleshoot issues that come up.
Collaboration: Use of version control and meeting software will be essential for teams to connect and collaborate. We‚Äôll be sharing more details and guidelines for virtual collaboration soon.

We hope you are able to attend! If you have any questions please email us at:
vancouverdatajam@gmail.com

title: Tidy Friday: Practicing Data Visualization in R
description:
Practice your data wrangling and visualization skills with other members of R-Ladies! During this virtual event, participants will report on their experience working on a shared dataset.

The R for Data Science Online Learning Community hosts a weekly "Tidy Tuesday" project in which they release a curated dataset every Tuesday for R users to practice data skills. We are meeting on Friday so that you have time to work on the dataset on your own.

How it works:

1. Read about the dataset here: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2020/2020-09-08/readme.md

2. Import the data into R using the instructions in the website above (we suggest using the code in the section titled "# Or read in the data manually")

3. Try to make a graph in R using the data. For some inspiration, search Twitter for #TidyTuesday.

4. Meet on Zoom during the event time. Message an organizer if you didn't receive the meeting password.

5. During the meeting, share your code and graph with the other participants using the "Share Screen" feature in Zoom or talk about where you got stuck and we'll work through it together.

Everyone's contribution is valuable, even if you're new to R! There are so many different ways to do things in R that your approach may be new to experienced R users.

title: Gabriela de Queiroz on R-Ladies and Unbiased AI
description:
Join us on SEPT 10th is a collab between R-Ladies SF, AI Inclusive and R-Ladies Miami featuring the Founder of R-Ladies and AI Inclusive Gabriela de Queiroz. Gabriela is a Sr. Engineering and Data Science Manager at IBM.

Connect to hear about Gabriela's journey and her vision for a more balanced world with ethical practices in ML! Use this opportunity to join us on a Firechat to ask her any questions about Data Science and building communities.

Gabriela de Queiroz Bio:

Gabriela de Queiroz is a Sr. Engineering & Data Science Manager at IBM where she manages and leads a team of developers working on Data & AI Open Source projects.
Her team contributes to projects such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Apache Arrow, Apache Spark, and several other open source projects. She works to democratize AI by building tools and launching new open source projects. She is passionate about making data science available to everybody and is actively involved with several organizations to foster an inclusive community.
She is the founder of AI Inclusive (ai-inclusive.org), a global organization that is helping increase the representation and participation of gender minorities in Artificial Intelligence. She is also the founder of R-Ladies (rladies.org), a worldwide organization for promoting diversity in the R community with more than 180 chapters in 50+ countries.

title: Tour para principiantes por RStudio
description: En nuestro segundo Meetup virtual, la Biol Marisol Navarro nos invita a un tour por RStudio, para introducirnos a los conceptos b√°sicos de R. Te invitamos este viaje virtual, y te sugerimos "abordar" 15 minutos antes del despegue.

title: A conversation about Data Science Career, Communities and Trustworthy AI
description:
Fireside Chat with Gabriela de Queiroz: "A conversation about Data Science Career, Communities, and Trustworthy AI"
‚Äî

Bio: Gabriela de Queiroz is a Sr. Engineering & Data Science Manager at IBM where she manages and leads a team of developers working on Data & AI Open Source projects.
Her team contributes to projects such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Apache Arrow, Apache Spark, and several other open source projects. She works to democratize AI by building tools and launching new open source projects. She is passionate about making data science available to everybody and is actively involved with several organizations to foster an inclusive community.
She is the founder of AI Inclusive (ai-inclusive.org), a global organization that is helping increase the representation and participation of gender minorities in Artificial Intelligence. She is also the founder of R-Ladies (rladies.org), a worldwide organization for promoting diversity in the R community with more than 180 chapters in 50+ countries.

=======================================================
> This event is a collaboration between R-Ladies Miami,
R-Ladies SF, and AI Inclusive SF.
=======================================================

CODE OF CONDUCT
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly.

title: Why R? Webinar 015 - Sydeaka Watson - Data Science for Social Justice
description:
Our R-Ladies Dallas organizer, Sydeaka Watson, will be featured as a guest speaker in the Why R? webinar series.

In her talk "Data Science for Social Justice Activism", we will learn how our technical talents can be used to promote social justice in our communities.

In the next R-Ladies Dallas meetup, we will discuss whether the R-Ladies in our meetup could/should individually or collectively volunteer to work on any of these important initiatives while building our R skills.

This webinar promotes Why R? 2020 conference - http://2020.whyr.pl
that happens 24-27.09.2020

- donate http://whyr.pl/donate/

- join Why R? Slack http://whyr.pl/slack/

title: Virtual presentations - Getting Started with GitHub in R
description:
* What are we going to learn?
This talk will be an overview of GitHub and how it can be used to help streamline R workflows. Version control is a great tool for organizing your files and collaborative projects.

* Who is going to present?
Dr. Caitie Keumpel is a conservation scientist who is currently a joint post-doctoral fellowship with the University of Queensland and World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) in UQ's Coral Reef Ecosystems lab. Caitie recently finished a post-doctoral fellowship at the National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis at UC Santa Barbara quantifying, mapping and comparing the environmental impacts of major food systems across the land and sea. Her research interests include protected area design, food system sustainability, and managing impacts on coral reefs.

* When are we meeting?
We would like to invite everyone to meet at 5:00 pm for an informal virtual chat. An opportunity to say hi before starting the presentation at 5:30 pm.

************The presentation will start at 5:30 pm.************
* Where are we meeting?
We will meet virtually using Zoom, the link will be visible to people who RSVP.

* What else is needed?
This will be an interactive ~45 min presentation. If you would like to follow along in setting up git in RStudio please make sure you have installed the following before the session:

git - https://git-scm.com/downloads
GitHub account - https://github.com/
R - https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/
RStudio - https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/

We look forward to seeing you there!

R-Ladies Brisbane

*********************************************************************************
Photos, Films and all other media/recordings: Photographs and/or video/other media will be taken at events held by this community. By taking part in an R-Ladies Brisbane event you grant the community organisers full rights to use the images resulting from the photography/video filming/media, and any reproductions or adaptations of the images for publicity, fund-raising or other purposes to help achieve the community‚Äôs aims. This might include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, social media, press releases and funding applications. If you do not wish to be recorded in these media please inform a community organiser.

Code of Conduct: R-Ladies Brisbane is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.

Community Policies: Please note, cis men are welcome to join our meetups when they come as a guest of a woman participant or they bring a woman with them. We highly encourage speakers and teachers at R-Ladies Brisbane events to be of minority genders.

Find us on Twitter @rladiesbrisbane for more information on news, presentations and code!

title: R Ladies Boulder Meetup #10: Virtual Meet-n-Greet and Lightning Talks
description:

We're hosting a virtual meet-n-greet featuring three great lightning talks.
We will be meeting over Zoom (Meeting link visible when you RSVP). Join us to connect with other R users in the Boulder area and listen into some great informal short talks!

description:

A web browser, and an account on RStudio Cloud (https://rstudio.cloud/).

Dr. Dorris Scott

It will be an online meetup, and the link will be posted closer to the date.

title: [Virtual] Women in Data Science, WiDS Delhi
description:
Excited to share that we are going to have an amazing WiDS Delhi virtual conference in 2020 with the collaboration of R-ladies Delhi.

WiDS Delhi is an independent event organized by Anukriti Gupta and Riya Gupta to coincide with the annual Global Women in Data Science (WiDS) Conference held at Stanford University and an estimated 150+ locations worldwide.

All genders are invited to attend WiDS regional events, which features outstanding women doing outstanding work. This initiative aims to inspire and educate data scientists worldwide, regardless of gender, and to support women in the field.

10 min Break

Hand on session Web Scraping
Ankita Saraf - Volkswagen AG

Quantum Computing
Denise Ruffner- Chief Business Officer at CQC

title: Creating a webpage with blogdown
description:
You don't need to know HTML, CSS, or javascript to create your own webpage! (Although you will need to know _about_ it). We will create a personal webpage entirely within RStudio. Personalised webpages are a great way to share your research or entrepreneurial projects. Move over ResearchGate and LinkedIn, now you control how your information is presented using your own unique style!

This is based on the fantastic R package blogdown (https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/), which you would need to install, along with Hugo (as instructed here: https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/installation.html). To publish the webpage, you can use your github, bitbucket, or any other publishing service account.

NB: This is an online event, with the link visible to attendees.

title: TidyTuesday: social event to play with public data sets
description:
Hi there!! TidyTuesday is back! It's a weekly social event to play with public data sets and make some visualization using R.

The data set for this week can be found here https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2020/2020-09-01/readme.md

The event will be hosted online and you will receive a link if you RSVP. It is scheduled on Thursday to give people time to look at the data (but not required, you can just jump to the meeting without any preparation).

See you online

title: Reproducibilidad en R: Compartiendo entornos interactivos con Binder
description:
¬°Felices de invitarte a una nueva Charla con R este mi√©rcoles 2 de Septiembre a las 18:30hs!

¬øBasta con dejar disponible el c√≥digo y las bases de datos de tu trabajo para que otra persona (o tu yo del futuro) pueda volver a correrlo sin problemas?

Las herramientas y pr√°cticas que mejoran la reproducibilidad computacional no siempre se abordan en los cursos de programaci√≥n. Algunas forman parte de "eso que se olvidaron de ense√±arte de R" (como dir√≠a Jenny Bryan): control de versiones, sistemas de administraci√≥n de dependencias, programaci√≥n literaria, entre otras.

En este meetup de R-Ladies Buenos Aires brindaremos un panorama de por qu√© es interesante abordar el tema de la reproducibilidad, publiques o no art√≠culos cient√≠ficos. Adem√°s presentaremos la hackat√≥n de reproducibilidad cient√≠fica (reproHack) que tendr√° lugar como parte de la edici√≥n virtual de LatinR 2020 en octubre de este a√±o.

Finalmente, para que te lleves un ejemplo concreto de que estamos hablando te contaremos de Binder: una herramienta gratuita que puedes usar para compartir Shiny apps y proyectos interactivos con RStudio de una forma reproducible y sencilla de usar.

Ac√° dos ejemplos de lo que aprender√°s para usar en tus propios proyectos:
Shiny app https://mybinder.org/v2/gh/flor14/shiny_reproducibilidad_meetup/master?urlpath=shiny/elipse/
RStudio IDE
http://mybinder.org/v2/gh/flor14/shiny_reproducibilidad_meetup/master?urlpath=rstudio

¬°Te esperamos!

***PARA PARTICIPAR***
- Tener cuenta en GitHub o GitLab activa y saber usarla (No es excluyente)
- Utilizaremos Shiny apps, pero no es necesario saber desarrollarlas.

***IMPORTANTE***
Para participar pon√© "Asistir√©" en este evento y asegurate de tener tambi√©n instalado Zoom en tu computadora (https://zoom.us/download).

Por razones de seguridad no compartiremos el link para ingresar a Zoom de manera p√∫blica. El mismo mi√©rcoles a las 18:00 hs. vamos a mandar un mail a trav√©s de Meetup a todas las personas que confirmaron asistencia con el link para que puedas unirte a la videollamada.

title: Introduction to Eye Tracking Data
description: This is an introductory course to eye-tracking data. We will start from the very basics of -what is an eye-tracker, to what the data looks like, what you can do with it, and finish it off with some hands-on work in R. If you're curious about eye-tracking as a methodology, wondered how experiments in reading, cognitive science, psychology look like; or simply curious about how to go about looking at the visual world, this workshop is for you.

title: R Ladies Netherlands Book Club - Advanced R Chapter 12 and 13
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).
Join us for our next meeting, in which Ale Hern√°ndez Segura will present the key points of Chapter 12 and 13 on Object-oriented Programming. After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Also feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

ABOUT Ale
----------------------
Originally from Mexico, Ale now lives in the Netherlands where she studied Molecular Medicine in Groningen. She now works as a Bioinformatician for the RIVM (National Institute for Public Health
and the Environment), where she is in charge of doing automatization and reproducibility of analyses. She has been working through the chapters of Advanced R and now is ready to tell you all about the basics of Object-oriented programming and S3 objects in R.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Understanding basics of R objects. Preferably understanding concepts like environments and the basics of functions.

LINK TO THE MEETING
----------------------------
https://meet.jit.si/RladiesUtrecht-bookclub-advR-ch12-13-mainroom

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: An Antarctic Tour of the Tidyverse
description:
Learn how to explore and manipulate data in R with packages from the Tidyverse. We'll introduce the 8 core packages (https://www.tidyverse.org/packages/) that make up the Tidyverse and use at least one function from each package while exploring a dataset on the migration of penguins.

Information about the Speaker:

Dr. Silvia Canel√≥n is a postdoctoral research scientist in biomedical informatics at the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia. She uses data science in the public and population health fields and is particularly interested in leveraging electronic health record data to study reproductive health outcomes. Silvia is formally trained as a biomedical engineer and holds her bachelor‚Äôs degree from the University of Minnesota and her doctoral degree from Purdue University. She loves community organizing and is currently pursuing the RStudio Instructor Certification as a way to help build power in her communities. Website: https://silvia.rbind.io/

Location:
Zoom link will be emailed a day before the event.

*Prerequisites:
We ask that R-Ladies who are interested in this event please sign up for a free R Studio Cloud account. This will be the easiest route to follow along with the workshop.

- https://rstudio.cloud/

You can also follow along on your own computer as well. Note that help will be limited if you run into issues.

Install the following if you would rather follow along on your local computer.:

- R:
https://www.r-project.org/

- R Studio:
https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/

Skill Level:
None. All levels are welcomed.

6:30 - 7:35 -- Dr. Silvia Canel√≥n: An Antarctic Tour of the Tidyverse

Additionally, please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies, and by being respectful of the fact that this event is primarily for women/non-binary/female-identifying individuals.

title: Tidy Friday: Practicing Data Visualization in R
description:
Practice your data wrangling and visualization skills with other members of R-Ladies! During this virtual event, participants will report on their experience working on a shared dataset.

The R for Data Science Online Learning Community hosts a weekly "Tidy Tuesday" project in which they release a curated dataset every Tuesday for R users to practice data skills. We are meeting on Friday so that you have time to work on the dataset on your own.

How it works:

1. Read about the dataset here: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/master/data/2020/2020-08-25/readme.md

2. Import the data into R using
chopped <- readr::read_tsv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-08-25/chopped.tsv')

3. Try to make at least one graph in R using the data. For some inspiration, search Twitter for #TidyTuesday.

4. Meet on Zoom during the event time. Message an organizer if you didn't receive the meeting password.

5. During the meeting, share your code and graph with the other participants using the "Share Screen" feature in Zoom or talk about where you got stuck and we'll work through it together.

Everyone's contribution is valuable, even if you're new to R! There are so many different ways to do things in R that your approach may be new to experienced R users.

title: Tangible Steps Towards Algorithmic Accountability
description:
Tangible Steps Towards Algorithmic Accountability

Abstract:
This talk will walk the audience through technical and strategic tools to build more accountable algorithms. Algorithmic bias has become more pervasive, however, there are many methods and frameworks for engineers and researchers to implement during their model development lifecycle.

Bio:
Ayodele Odubela is a Data Scientist working on driver risk mitigation at SambaSafety in Denver, CO. She earned her Master's degree in Data Science after transitioning to tech from social media marketing. She's created algorithms that predict consumer segment movement, goals in hockey, and the location of firearms using radio frequency sensors. Ayodele is passionate about using tech to improve the lives of marginalized people.

title: Meetup virtual: Estad√≠stica descriptiva con R
description:
En este meetup descubriremos la forma en que se usa el lenguaje de programaci√≥n R para pasar de una lista de datos a las gr√°ficas, tablas y estad√≠sticas que nos revelan las caracter√≠sticas del conjunto de datos. Repasaremos brevemente varios principios de estad√≠stica descriptiva para despu√©s llevarlos a la pr√°ctica con ejercicios variados en R.

Tendremos como invitada especial a la M.C. Aurora Labastida Mart√≠nez. Aurora es especialista en an√°lisis de datos de secuenciaci√≥n masiva de ADN, donde utiliza t√©cnicas y trucos de R, Perl, Bash y AWK, adem√°s de t√©cnicas variadas de estad√≠stica. Actualmente dirige el servicio de an√°lisis de datos OMICs Analysis.

TEMARIO
Datos cualitativos y cuantitativos en el ambiente de R
Tablas de frecuencias y tablas de contingencias
C√°lculo de medidas de tendencia central (ej. promedio, mediana)
C√°lculo de medidas de dispersi√≥n (ej. desviaci√≥n est√°ndar)
C√°lculo de medidas de correlaci√≥n entre variables
Representaci√≥n de distintos tipos de datos datos con gr√°ficas

CONOCIMIENTOS PREVIOS REQUERIDOS:
Este meetup est√° dirigido a personas con conocimientos b√°sicos de R y de estad√≠stica descriptiva. Contesta este cuestionario para saber si cuentas con los conocimientos necesarios para aprovechar esta reuni√≥n y qu√© recomendaciones u opciones tenemos para ti:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdsHB_oJ7iVdOT0I3esx5EMttMxrTibSkRFaPD2VM2REqn7tg/viewform

REQUERIMIENTOS DE SOFTWARE
+ R >=4.0 y RStudio en su versi√≥n m√°s actual
+ Paquetes de R: ggplot2, pastecs, summarytools, psych, tidyverse, corrplot, Hmisc, correlation, dplyr

Para instalar los paquetes requeridos, puedes usar este comando en tu sesi√≥n de R:

install.packages(c("ggplot2", "pastecs", "psych", "tidyverse", "corrplot", "correlation", "dplyr", "Hmisc","summarytools"), dependencies = TRUE)

Nota: En MacOS el paquete summarytools requerir√° a Xcode para poder instalarse. Puedes descargar el instalador de Xcode en https://www.xquartz.org/. En caso de detectar alg√∫n error de instalaci√≥n de summarytools en Mac OS puedes ver el siguiente foro: https://github.com/dcomtois/summarytools/issues/67

Este evento se llevar√° a cabo mediante Zoom, el link para conectarse al evento ser√° enviado por correo electr√≥nico a los asistentes registrados 30 minutos antes de iniciar. Por seguridad de todos, no compartas el link con personas no registradas en el evento.

Les pedimos conectarse 15 minutos antes de la hora de inicio para corroborar su inscripci√≥n.

Recuerda leer y atender el c√≥digo de conducta disponible en https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

Si no te es posible asistir al evento, por favor cancela tu inscripci√≥n al menos 24 horas antes para darle oportunidad a las personas en lista de espera. En caso de mantener tu registro y no presentarte al evento, nos veremos en la necesidad de rechazar tu registro en el siguiente meetup.

title: Create and share reproducible code with R Markdown and workflowr (Repeat)
description:
Last month we hosted a tutorial as a part of useR!2020. We are running it again this month, for those who were unable to attend / did not get a ticket. The tutorial is valuable for everyone, but especially so for Masters and PhD students - if you know anyone who is busy with either of these, please encourage them to sign up on our group and RSVP :).

Description:
Have you ever struggled to re-run your own code or scripts you received from a collaborator? You‚Äôre not alone! Fortunately, there are simple practices that you can use to help you develop more reproducible R code. In this tutorial, you will 1) explore some of the common causes of non-reproducible code, 2) gain practical experience fixing reproducibility issues, and 3) use the R package workflowr (https://jdblischak.github.io/workflowr/) to facilitate creation of more reproducible and shareable code. The tutorial will be hands-on and interactive, with small-group exercises.

Prerequisites:
Participants should have some experience using R (e.g. importing data from a file, loading a package). The tutorial will involve running R code in R Markdown files from the RStudio IDE. If you are unfamiliar with R Markdown, we recommend reviewing these short guides before participating in the tutorial: [Introduction](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-1.html), [How It Works](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-2.html), [Code Chunks](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-3.html].

Requirements:
A web browser, an account on GitHub (https://github.com/), and an account on RStudio Cloud (https://rstudio.cloud/). We will email you the tutorial materials, please also check your Spam / Junk Folder as materials often end up there when sent via Meetup.

Instructors:
Dr. Inger Fabris-Rotelli (and Vebash Naidoo) on behalf of Dr. John Blischak & Dr. Peter Carbonetto.

It will be an online meetup, and the link will be posted closer to the date.

title: Of course I can do the stats for your paper - how to grab opportunities with R
description:
Anandi Bierman, Postdoctoral fellow at Stellenbosch University Department of Conservation Ecology and Entomology, will be sharing her tips and tricks with us on extending your R skillz:

"When a colleague asks you to perform the analysis of their metagenomic data and accompanying statistics with the opportunity to co-author a paper, you can't say no. Luckily R has your back and teaching yourself new skills is something you can achieve from the comfort of your couch. In this talk I will walk you through the steps I took to analyse Metagenomic data using R and the accompanying publication-worthy graphs I learned to draw up as well as some basic statistics done on the metadata.

I will also touch on three things that I found fundamental in the learning process:
(1) Know the good R websites,
(2) Phone a friend and
(3) Don't be shy to re-do a lot of stuff.

The purpose of this talk is to show that you can learn to do anything in R from scratch and produce really professional output and it won't cost you another PhD to do so!"

Join us online using the Google Meet link below - please mute when you join!

title: R at RT√â - Network Visualisation and Association Rules
description:
!!! You'll need to download zoom before the event !!!
Head over to zoom.us and scroll down to the bottom, you'll see Download in the footer. You want to install the Meetings Client.

Tune in for a talk on Network Visualisation and Association Rules.
This is our first virtual meetup which we're very excited about and we hope you will be too.

Grab a snack or a drink and join us on Thursday, 20th August, at 5:15PM (GMT+1)

5:15-5:20 Welcome
5:20-5:30 Introductions
5:30-6:00 Talk: R at RT√â - Network Visualisation and Association Rules, Ben Norland, Analytics Lead at RTE
6:00-6:15 Q&A

About Ben Norland
Ben Norland is Analytics Lead in the Insights team at RT√â Ireland's National Television and Radio Broadcaster.
Ben‚Äôs objective is developing data-driven solutions, which solve challenges for decision-makers across the organisation. R is his core analytics tool, and he has been using it for 6 years.

About the talk
A few months ago, Ben was confronted with the exciting challenge to use his data analytics knowledge to increase viewer engagement and retention on the RT√â Player platform.
The solution he and the Team provided had impressive outcomes in terms of both operational improvements and a shift to a data-led business approach.
The project has also secured a Finalist ticket for the next Analytics Institute Awards in the ‚ÄòAnalytics Innovation‚Äô category to RT√â.
During our meeting, Ben will introduce us to his innovative model, which is based on network graph visualisations highlighting key overlaps between programme titles available in the RT√â Player. He will also discuss the ongoing ‚Äòphase 2‚Äô of his project, which deploys Association Rules modelling.
Finally, Ben will run a demo to show how network maps are built, updated and how their results can be easily interpreted by non-technical users.

We'll be recording the event for future reference.

See you on the Internet :)
Jo, Paola and Sapna

title: ¬°Lanzamiento R-Ladies Talca! ¬°Con√≥cenos y participa!

title: [ONLINE] - Prototyping with R Packages: Case Study on E-Commerce Fraud Detection
description:
[ONLINE EVENT]
-----------------------
You all have been patiently waiting ... and the time has finally come!!!

After a couple of months hiatus, R-Ladies Amsterdam is back in full swing! On August 19th, 2020, we have a very exciting R Ladies presentation by Irene Steves and Yogev Herz, tuning in from Tel Aviv! (Yes, R-Ladies Amsterdam is globalizing =) !)

[TOPIC]
-----------
Irene and Yogev work in Tel Aviv for the eCommerce fraud protection company Riskified.

In their work, they often come across fraud patterns in eCommerce that their regular models cannot detect. While retraining models on newer data can solve some of these problems, some patterns require entirely new analyses.

In this talk, Irene and Yogev will discuss how they tackled fraudsters taking advantage of "Buy Online Pay in Store" policies, and how R packages helped gradually transition from analyses to production-ready code.

[ABOUT IRENE and YOGEV]
-------------------------------------

Irene holds an M.Sc. in Ecology and a B.A. in Integrative Biology, through which she first discovered R and data science. Her interest in data-led her to the Arctic Data Center at the University of California Santa Barbara, a summer internship at RStudio, and ultimately to the Research department at Riskified, where she now explores the fascinating patterns of fraud in e-commerce.

Yogev first encountered R when studying the social organization of bumblebees for his M.Sc. in evolutionary biology. He transitioned to full-time R user and programmer when he left the hot and humid beehive to the air-conditioned office space of the research department in Riskified. He enjoys learning new R tricks and packages to improve the department‚Äôs data science capabilities.

[PROGRAMME]
---------------------
18.30 - 18.35 Virtual Welcome
18.35 - 18.45 Intro to R-Ladies and today's presentation
18.45 - 19.20 Interactive presentation by Irene Steves and Yogev Herz
19.15- 19.30 Questions and Discussion

[ZOOM LINK]
-------------------
See on the right.

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, Meetup membership, or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

[OTHER LINKS]
---------------------

title: Data Visualization (Part 1!)
description:
Hi R-Ladies SB,

Please join us for an evening of data visualization creation! We‚Äôll be reviewing ggplot2 basics and exploring different ways to make customizing plots fun and easy. As a bonus, we‚Äôll be using the new palmerpenguins package (https://github.com/allisonhorst/palmerpenguins), curated by our very own R-Lady and chapter co-founder, Allison Horst!

This workshop is designed as Part 1 of 2 in our data visualization series, making it a great way to become familiarized with ggplot2 syntax and options. R-users of all experience levels are encouraged to join‚Äîthere will be opportunities to share your own tips and tricks along the way.

In addition, we are hoping to compile any visualizations that our fellow R-Ladies are proud of or excited to share with our community‚Äîif you are willing to share any of your creations and/or associated code for us to add to a slide deck and display on our chapter‚Äôs GitHub page (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_santabarbara), please fill out this GoogleForm (https://forms.gle/KhyEvpokVjxSdu6F6). We think this will be an awesome way to learn from one another and act as a resource for R-users of all experience levels.

Instructions for installing software and packages can be found below, and the Zoom link will become available upon RSVPing.

Looking forward to seeing many of you!

Cheers,
Sam, An, & Juliette

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
If you wish to code alongside us during breakout room sessions, please have R/RStudio installed as well as the following packages: palmerpenguins, tidyverse, patchwork, and hrbrthemes.

Install R here: https://www.r-project.org/
Install RStudio here: https://rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/

Copy and paste the following code into your console to install the necessary packages prior to our meetup:

install.packages(‚Äúpalmerpenguins‚Äù)
install.packages(‚Äútidyverse‚Äù)
install.packages("patchwork")
install.packages("hrbrthemes")
install.packages("ggtext")
install.packages("ggimage")
install.packages("rlang")

You can also download our code (and some cute penguin images that we'll be adding to our plots!) here:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/17mX2I990VXzM806dQtwuAyTEwnMEkUlO?usp=sharing

We suggest creating an R project to store all four files in for ease of use. If you are unsure how to do so, you can find detailed instructions here:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HAvvoKrX8Ehm_NCipkij0OqUQgWIAdCR/view?usp=sharing

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

title: Virtual presentations - R in Biology
description:
* What are we going to learn?
In this session we will have short examples of how R is used in Biology.
- Using R for data management in a wet-lab
- Examples of genomic data visualisation using R
- Visualisation of gene set enrichment analysis using the GOplot package

* Who is going to present?
Anna Vinkhuyzen
Valentine Murigneux
Anna Jaeschke

* When are we meeting?
We would like to invite everyone to meet at 5:30 pm for a little virtual chat. An opportunity to say hi before starting the presentation at 6:00 pm and going for 1.5 hours.

************The presentation will start at 6:00 pm.************
* Where are we meeting?
We will meet virtually using Zoom, the link will be visible to people who RSVP.

* What else is needed?
If you want to install the packages from this presentation you can install them on the R console:

# Copy this code if you want to try the packages
install.packages("qqman", "plyr", "platetools", "ggplot2", "viridis", "data.table", "janitor", "RDAVIDWebService", "GOplot","UpSetR","pheatmap","maftools", "GenVisR")

We look forward to seeing you there!

title: R Ladies Netherlands Book Club - Advanced R Chapter 11
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).

Join us for our next meeting, where Laurel Brehm leads discussion of the chapter on Function Operators. We'll hit the key points of the chapter and work on exercises together.

The link to the meeting is here: https://meet.jit.si/RLadiesNLAdvancedR

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Also feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

ABOUT Laurel
----------------------
Laurel is a research scientist at the MPI for Psycholinguistics. She studies how people successfully communicate even when they make mistakes, and teaches statistics to psychologists and linguists

title: Aprende a programar en R: Parte 4 - Estructuras de control y funciones
description:
Siguiendo con nuestra serie de webinars sobre programaci√≥n b√°sica en R, los invitamos a unirse a este evento que cubrir√° estructuras de control: for y while. Tambi√©n continuaremos con la construcci√≥n de funciones.

Igual que nuestros eventos anteriores, utilizaremos recursos libres y plataformas de colaboraci√≥n en l√≠nea gratuitas para que puedas seguir nuestra sesi√≥n en vivo.

Nos basaremos en el libro 'El arte de programar en R' por Santana y Farf√°n disponible de manera gratuita aqu√≠: https://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/Santana_El_arte_de_programar_en_R.pdf . Estaremos cubirnedo los cap√≠tulos 4 y 5. Otra referencia relevante es el cap√≠tulo 9 de 'R para principantes' de Juan Mendoza Vega, disponible de manera gratuita aqu√≠: https://bookdown.org/jboscomendoza/r-principiantes4/ .

Nuestros talleres est√°n abiertos a todos los miembros de la comunidad Galapague√±a y al p√∫blico en general, pero incentivamos en especial a mujeres, ni√±as y personas pertenecientes a minor√≠as que formen parte de nuestros eventos.

Debido a que el COVID-19 contin√∫a siendo una preocupaci√≥n en Ecuador, este evento ser√° llevado a cabo en l√≠nea a trav√©s de la plataforma Google Meet. Compartiremos el v√≠nculo de acceso una hora antes del evento. Les pedimos no compartirlo en l√≠nea por cuestiones de seguridad.
