title: Hands-on Machine Learning Workshop
description:
Researchers utilize high-dimensional biological data for questions ranging from identifying groups of interest to extracting biologically meaningful representations. This hands-on unsupervised machine learning workshop will introduce concepts such as cluster validation and stability, dimensionality reduction, and representation learning for transcriptomics.

About our speaker:

Jaclyn Taroni is a Principal Data Scientist at the Childhood Cancer Data Lab, an initiative of Alex's Lemonade Stand Foundation. She was a Postdoctoral Researcher in the Greene Lab at the University of Pennsylvania Perelman School of Medicine, where she worked on cross-platform normalization of gene expression data and unsupervised transfer learning for rare diseases. She conducted her thesis work in the Whitfield Lab at the Geisel School of Medicine at Dartmouth studying the rare autoimmune disease systemic sclerosis, where she developed novel frameworks for analyzing high-throughput molecular data from multiple tissues, clinical manifestations, and drug trials. (http://www.jaclyn-taroni.com/)

title: Open data and an interactive dashboard to monitor COVID-19 outbreak in Canada
description:
We are so excited to be back!

On August 12, Isha Berry will be talking about be talking about "Open access epidemiological data and an interactive dashboard to monitor the COVID-19 outbreak in Canada".

This meetup is, of course, online, and a link to the Zoom meeting will be shared the day of the event.

Approximate agenda:
7 - 7:10pm: Welcome and announcements
7:10 - 7:30pm: Isha's talk
7:30 - 7:45pm: Q&A and discussion
7:45 - 8:00pm: Wrap up

Talk description:
The COVID-19 Canada Open Data Working Group was founded in March 2020 in response to the need for accurate, up-to-date and accessible data on the COVID-19 epidemic in Canada. Unlike many datasets that provide only aggregate case counts, the working group dataset collects individual-level case data, which are particularly valuable during outbreaks but are seldom made available in real time. This dataset feeds into an interactive dashboard, which enables users to visualize the data and identify key health outcome trends.

The dataset and dashboard have become a reliable pan-Canadian source for COVID-19 information. Additionally, this has the potential for future linkages with diverse datasets, such as policy interventions, socio-behavioural changes, environmental factors, and other population-level factors. The open access aspect of this work encourages transparency and data sharing, which are crucial for supporting evidence-based control strategies and directing public health response efforts in Canada for the COVID-19 pandemic.

This talk will provide an overview of the key features associated with the COVID-19 Canada Open Data Working Group datasets and feature a demonstration of the tools available on the R Shiny dashboard. We will also discuss some of the key epidemiological insights that have been
observed from this data and dashboard to date.

About Isha Berry:
Isha Berry is a PhD Candidate in Epidemiology at the Dalla Lana School of Public Health and a Fellow in the Emerging Leaders in Biosecurity Initiative at the Johns Hopkins Centre for Health Security. She is a co-founder of the COVID-19 Canada Open Data Working Group, which leads digital surveillance of COVID-19 cases in Canada to curate a publicly available line list and public-facing data dashboard. Isha has expertise in infectious disease epidemiology, geo-spatial methods, and mathematical modelling. Her primary area of research is understanding the socio-behavioral drivers of global emerging infectious diseases. She has experience conducting infectious disease research in low-, middle-, and high-income settings. She holds an MSc in Epidemiology from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine and a BSc in Environmental Science from McGill University.

---

Please note that by attending you agree to abide by our code of conduct: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

title: Intro to Shiny!
description:
In this meetup we will do an introductory walkthrough of Shiny apps.

Shiny is a web development platform developed through R Studio that allows R users to make interactive interfaces for data manipulation and visualization. Some great examples of what can be done using Shiny can be found here https://shiny.rstudio.com/gallery/.

During the tutorial we will introduce Shiny and build a first Shiny App together. R-users of all levels are welcome, only basic experience with R and R-Studio is necessary.

Important!
The meetup will be hosted online via Zoom -- the link will be sent out via Meetup around 15 minutes before the start time.

title: Career Clarity Workshop with Arivee Vargas
description:
*** The ZOOM Link for this evening has been emailed to those who've RSVP'd. Please check your spam folder. Message Mena if you RSVP'd but didn't receive the link.***

***Looks like some of you didn't get the link. It is entered below.***

We're trying something new for August!

With everything that is going on in the world and all the uncertainty many of us are experiencing, we thought it would be a good time to pause and get some clarity. If you're not sure about your next step or want a change but don't know where to start, this one's for you. Join us for an evening of career and personal development with Life and High-Performance Coach, Arivee Vargas.

Arivee will lead us in a 1.5 hr interactive workshop aimed to help find clarity. The main goals are to:
1) Help you think through where you could create more clarity in your life and career. What are the opportunities for more clarity to help you move forward or take some action towards what you may really want?
2) Provide some practices and strategies you can immediately apply to help you develop clarity and get results

This will be a virtual event and the link will be provided the day of the event to individuals who RSVP. Please include your full name in the RSVP.

About Arivee Vargas
Arivee Vargas is the Founder of Humble Rising LLC, which aims to motivate and inspire women to pursue a life and career that brings them joy, meaning, and aligns with who they really are. She‚Äôs a certified life and high-performance coach to early- to mid-career women professionals in fast-paced environments. As a coach, she helps women gain clarity, overcome fears and self-doubt, break through limiting beliefs, and push through other roadblocks to have the life and career they really want and deserve. Arivee created the Four A‚Äôs framework (Activate, Align, Assess, Ask) to help women get unstuck and gain clarity. She frequently speaks on panels and delivers keynotes on topics related to personal growth and professional development.

Arivee is a trained litigator and spent most of her legal career at two large law firms, including Jones Day, the world‚Äôs largest law firm. She served as a law clerk to a federal appellate judge and federal district court judge in Massachusetts. She also taught an introduction to business law course for several years at Boston College‚Äôs Carroll School of Management.

Arivee is currently a Business Partner in the Office of Business Integrity and Ethics at Vertex Pharmaceuticals Incorporated. In that role, she advises business functions on a variety of matters. She also designed, implemented, and leads the Global Assurance and Global Anti-corruption/Anti-bribery programs including third party risk management initiatives. In addition, she leads the Empower initiative of the women‚Äôs employee resource network IWILL (Inspiring Women In Leadership and Learning), focused on the career growth and development of women at the company.

title: Aiutaci a raggiungere il nostro obiettivo con #DeveloperEconomics

Questo non √® un evento ma un invito ad aiutarci a raggiungere un obiettivo che ad RLadies Italy ci siamo prefissati con partner di #DeveloperEconomics

*Quali nuovi skills vorresti migliorare nel 2021? Quali strumenti o piattaforme di sviluppo diventeranno obsolete durante il prossimo anno?*

Abbiamo deciso di supportare il nuovo questionario Developer Economics survey Q2 2020 per avere delle risposte.
Il questionario √® molto chiaro e diretto al sodo. Condividi le tue opinioni su i pi√π popolari strumenti di sviluppo, piattaforme, tecnologie e framework. Cosa ti piace usare? Cosa hai provato ma poi subito abbandonato perch√© non abbastanza intuitivo, o cosa vorresti conoscere meglio?

Rispondi a queste domande per aiutarci a scoprire cosa manca sul mercato. Il questionario √® aperto solo a sviluppatori e data scientists, ma invita tutti a partecipare: studenti, professionisti, e coloro che si dilettano per hobby. I risultati saranno disponibili in autunno e pubblicati nel nuovo State of the Developer Nation (disponibile gratuitamente per tutti!). Qui avrai grafici e informazioni su trend globali che potrai utilizzare per avere un quadro pi√π amplio e aggiornato del mercato.

Coloro che si registrano e completano il questionario parteciperanno automaticamente all'estrazione di uno dei premi in palio. Il montepremi ammonta a +15 mila $, e sono inclusi premi tipo iPhone 11, Oculus Quest 64GB, JetBrains All Product Pack, Corsair Mechanical Gaming keyboard, Cloud Guru license, pi√π una serie di gadgets e accessori, e vouchers Amazon. Sei pronto per una sfida? Ci sono altri 1000 $ in cash come premio se spargi la voce e altri sviluppatori partecipano al questionario.

Un'altra cosa che √® veramente importante √® che per ogni questionario completato, doneremo $0.10 a Techfugees per supportare e aiutare gli sviluppatori di domani.

Il questionario √® aperto fino al 10 agosto, non perdere quest'occasione!
I risultati del sondaggio sono ci√≤ su cui si basa l'intero ecosistema per creare nuovi strumenti, piattaforme che saranno utilizzate in futuro da voi sviluppatori.

title: R-Ladies Nairobi launch
description:
Hello Everyone,

We are excited to finally launch R-Ladies Nairobi!

Your presence in the upcoming R-Ladies Nairobi launch scheduled for Saturday, 8th August, 11:00 a.m. - 1:15 p.m. EAT will be highly appreciated.
The sessions will involve talks and interactive sessions from the R-Ladies Nairobi organisers, mentors and so much more!

We will also host some R-Ladies chapters organisers as they share their journeys, milestones and lessons learnt.

Mark your calendars!!!!!

We look forward to e-meeting you!

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email with more details on the meeting.

Should you have any queries or comments, get in touch with us on;

#Email address: nairobi@rladies.org

#LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/r-ladies-nairobi-2572841b3/

#Meetup: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-nairobi/

#Twitter: https://twitter.com/RLadiesNairobi

Please, fill out the pre-launch survey: bit.ly/RLadiesNairobiPLS

Thank You and Kind Regards,
R-Ladies Nairobi organisers

title: Aprende a programar en R: Parte 3 - Subconjuntos de datos y funciones
description:
Siguiendo con nuestra serie de webinar sobre programaci√≥n b√°sica en R, los invitamos a unirse a este evento que cubrir√° como seleccionar subconjuntos de datos basados en condiciones que nosotros especifiquemos. Tambi√©n continuaremos con la construcci√≥n de funciones.

Igual que nuestros eventos anteriores, utilizaremos recursos libres y plataformas de colaboraci√≥n en l√≠nea gratuitas para que puedas seguir nuestra sesi√≥n en vivo.

Nos basaremos en el libro 'El arte de programar en R' por Santana y Farf√°n disponible de manera gratuita aqu√≠: https://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/Santana_El_arte_de_programar_en_R.pdf . Estaremos cubirnedo los cap√≠tulos 3, 4 y 5. Otra referencia relevante es 'R para principantes' de Juan Mendoza Vega, disponible de manera gratuita aqu√≠: https://bookdown.org/jboscomendoza/r-principiantes4/ .

Nuestros talleres est√°n abiertos a todos los miembros de la comunidad Galapague√±a y al p√∫blico en general, pero incentivamos en especial a mujeres, ni√±as y personas pertenecientes a minor√≠as que formen parte de nuestros eventos.

Debido a que el COVID-19 contin√∫a siendo una preocupaci√≥n en Ecuador, este evento ser√° llevado a cabo en l√≠nea a trav√©s de la plataforma Zoom. Compartiremos el v√≠nculo de acceso una hora antes del evento. Les pedimos no compartirlo en l√≠nea por cuestiones de seguridad.

Para mantener nuestros eventos como un ambiente seguro en el que todos los participantes puedan participar, te pedimos que leas y te adhieras a nuestro c√≥digo de conducta (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct), as√≠ como nuestras gu√≠as de comunidad (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/blob/master/RLadiesRulesAndGuideLinesENES.md).

title: We R Ladies - Dados p√∫blicos aplicados ao R
description:
Inscri√ß√µes em: https://www.sympla.com.br/we-r-ladies---dados-publicos-aplicados-ao-r__916335

Dados P√∫blicos aplicados ao R

Ci√™ncia de Dados e a Transforma√ß√£o no Governo com Luisa Souza Costa

A an√°lise de dados no setor p√∫blico √© uma atividade capaz de transformar a forma como pol√≠ticas p√∫blicas s√£o geradas. Nessa palestra voc√™ poder√° ver como foi poss√≠vel selecionar escolas p√∫blicas com maiores necessidades no Estado para que recebessem maior aten√ß√£o das pol√≠ticas do governo, a partir da An√°lise de clusters e da linguagem R. Ser√£o tamb√©m abordados cases reais sobre a utiliza√ß√£o de dados no governo, bem como os desafios e oportunidades para a ci√™ncia de dados no setor p√∫blico.

Participa√ß√£o feminina nas Elei√ß√µes 2018: o que voc√™ sabe? com Tha√≠s Almeida Nunes

As Elei√ß√µes 2018 foi o pleito com maior visibilidade que o Brasil j√° teve. H√° instrumentos jur√≠dicos que garantem uma cota m√≠nima de participa√ß√£o feminina dentre as candidatas de cada partido. Mas iremos analisar se as candidatas est√£o sendo financiadas na mesma propor√ß√£o que os candidatos do sexo masculino. Iremos analisar o quantitativo de votos de cada g√™nero/cargo, se os candidatos prestaram contas e v√°rias outras estat√≠sticas que s√£o facilmente extra√≠das do Reposit√≥rio de Dados Eleitorais.

Quem somos n√≥s? com Layla Comparin
O R-Ladies Belo Horizonte faz parte de uma organiza√ß√£o mundial para promover a diversidade de g√™nero na comunidade da linguagem computacional estat√≠stica (R). Nossa principal miss√£o √© apoiar os g√™neros minorit√°rios para alcan√ßar seu potencial de programa√ß√£o, construindo uma rede global colaborativa de l√≠deres, mentores, aprendizes e desenvolvedoras para facilitar o progresso individual e coletivo em todo o mundo. Tamb√©m tentamos promover nos nossos eventos, palestras referentes ao empreendedorismo feminino e diversidade para que as mulheres do ambiente sintam-se engajadas a correrem atr√°s do seu espa√ßo no mercado.

An√°lise de microdados da PNAD usando o R com J√∫lia Almeida Calazans

Nessa palestra iremos dar uma aula introdut√≥ria sobre a Pesquisa Nacional por Amostra de Domic√≠lios (PNAD) na qual iremos entender melhor como utilizar os dados da pesquisa em diversos tipos de an√°lises estat√≠sticas. Iremos abordar: A PNAD e sua evolu√ß√£o ao longo do tempo; Suplementos; Desenho amostral complexo; Vari√°veis e dicion√°rios; Extra√ß√£o dos microdados da PNAD; Dados domiciliares e dados individuais; Tabula√ß√µes e outras an√°lises descritivas b√°sicas utilizando o plano amostral.

Conhe√ßa as palestrantes:

Luisa Souza Costa - Diretora de Avalia√ß√£o da Aprendizagem na Secretaria de Estado de Educa√ß√£o de MG: https://www.linkedin.com/in/luisa-souza-56090082/
Graduada em Administra√ß√£o P√∫blica pela FJP, e cursando Especializa√ß√£o em Estat√≠stica pela UFMG. Atua como Especialista em Pol√≠ticas P√∫blicas na Secretaria de Educa√ß√£o de Minas Gerais na √°rea de Avalia√ß√£o Educacional, desenvolvendo projetos de dados para a melhoria de pol√≠ticas educacionais.

Tha√≠s Almeida Nunes - Servidora P√∫blica no Tribunal Superior Eleitoral: @almeidanthais (Instagram)
Graduada em estat√≠stica, servidora do TSE e eterna aprendiz em R.

J√∫lia Almeida Calazans - Doutoranda em Demografia na UFMG: https://www.linkedin.com/in/j%C3%BAlia-almeida-calazans-1b198487/?originalSubdomain=br
Bacharela em Ci√™ncias Econ√¥micas (UFMG), mestra e doutoranda em Demografia (CEDEPLAR/UFMG). Trabalha h√° 8 anos com an√°lise de dados demogr√°ficos, com foco em sa√∫de e mortalidade.

title: Machine learning con mlr3 - Tutorial en l√≠nea de useR!2020
description:
Las R-Ladies Ecuador te traemos el tutorial 'Machine learning con mlr3' que dictar√°n Bernd Bischl y Michel Lang, el cual es parte de useR! 2020.

En este tutorial con duraci√≥n de tres horas, aprender√°s sobre el paquete mlr3 de R para llevar a cabo procesos de aprendizaje autom√°tico (machine learning, ML) avanzados. El ecosistema mlr3 provee una soluci√≥n completa para todas tus necesidades de ML, incluyendo pre-procesamiento de datos, dise√±o y evaluaci√≥n de modelos de aprendizaje autom√°tico, conjuntos de modelos (ensembles), visualizaciones, y ajuste de hiperpar√°metros (a trav√©s de mlr3tuning). El proceso (pipeline) mlr3pipelines permite expresar flujos de trabajo complejos de manera sencilla, y probar nuevas ideas y aplicaciones. mlr3 puede ayudar a hacer tu flujo de trabajo m√°s f√°cil de leer y m√°s eficiente sin importar el tipo de problema o aplicaci√≥n que quieras resolver con ML.

Este tutorial est√° dirigido a usuarios con un conocimiento de conceptos b√°sicos de aprendizaje autom√°tico (machine learning), pero no necesariamente debes tener conocimiento previo del paquete mlr3. Los participantes tambi√©n deber√°n tener al menos un conocimiento intermedio de R y conocer los tipos de datos generales utilizados por R, as√≠ como habilidad para llevar a cabo operaciones b√°sicas. Es preferible que tengan experiencia con R6 y data.table, pero no es esencial.

Puedes acceder al material del curso a trav√©s del repositorio de GitHub: https://github.com/mlr-org/user2020 . Puedes descargar los material con antelaci√≥n para que puedas seguir el curso en vivo, o para practicar los ejercicios en cualquier otro momento. El tutorial ser√° en ingl√©s, pero tendremos subt√≠tulos disponibles en espa√±ol para que nos puedas seguir con facilidad.

Recuerda que al participar en nuestros eventos deber√°s aceptar el c√≥digo de conducta de R-Ladies ( https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct ), as√≠ como el de useR! 2020 ( https://user2020.r-project.org/codeofconduct/ ).

Nuestros eventos est√°n abiertos a todos los miembros de la comunidad de R, pero incentivamos particularmente a mujeres y miembros de grupos minoritarios a registrarse con nosotras.

**English**
R-Ladies Ecuador is bringing you the online tutorial: 'Machine learning con mlr3' taught by Bernd Bischl and Michel Lang, which is part of useR! 2020.

In this three hour tutorial you will be introduced to the mlr3 R package for modern, state-of-the-art machine learning (ML). The mlr3 ecosystem provides a one-stop solution for all ML needs, spanning preprocessing, model learning and evaluation, ensembles, visualization, and hyperparameter tuning (via mlr3tuning). Its pipeline system mlr3pipelines allows to easily express complex workflows, and to quickly prototype new ideas and applications. Whether you are applying ML to solve a practical prediction problem, implementing learning algorithms as a research software engineer or researching ML by empirical means, mlr3 can help make your workflow more readable and efficient.

We target to users with at least basic knowledge of ML concepts who are not yet familiar with mlr3. We require a working knowledge of R at medium level. One should know R's general type system and basic operations. Some experience with R6 and data.table definitely help, but is not essential.

You can access all course material through GitHub: https://github.com/mlr-org/user2020 . You can dowload all the material prior to the course so you can follow the instructions live, or you can also use the materials to practice exercises on your own time. The tutorial will be taught in English, but subtitles will be available.

When you participate in our events, remember that you are accepting the R-Ladies code of conduct ( https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct ) as well as that from useR! 2020 ( https://user2020.r-project.org/codeofconduct/ ).

Everyone is welcome, but we encourage women and people from minority groups to join our events.

description:
Event Description:

Join R-Ladies to upgrade your skills at resum√© writing and interviewing, and to ask former tech recruiter Ellen Greer anything you ever wanted to know about getting a new job. Senior data scientists and recent job hunters are invited to share their pro tips as well!

Facilitator Bio:

Ellen Greer works in Product at Vistaprint Digital and is a former tech recruiter. In the IT field, she has led talent acquisition programs and consulted on job hunts both on the employer‚Äôs side of the table and the candidate‚Äôs. Ellen is a volunteer leader with Femex, a 16-week class that builds community and empowerment with women, trans, and non-binary individuals in DC.

title: R-Ladies Seattle and Allyship
description:
**Note that we've moved this event from July 16th at 6:30pm to August 5th at noon.**

After a 3-month hiatus, we'll be returning with a virtual event focused on allyship in the R-Ladies Seattle community. We will discuss how, as a community of R users, we can make changes to our group so that R-Ladies members who are Black, Indigenous, and POC will feel supported, included, and enthusiastically welcomed and celebrated. We will also use this event as a forum to educate ourselves about how to be anti-racist data scientists, touching on places where allies can be most effective.

We will discuss meetup event best practices for diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) and changes we are working on for R-Ladies Seattle. We'll also lead a discussion about which projects/changes R-Ladies members would like to prioritize. Your input and participation in this event is welcomed and appreciated.

In the meantime, if you'd like get caught up on DEI initiatives and discussions in the broader R community, I recommend reading and viewing the following:

* Heather Turner's talk at CelebRation 2020 (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbpkKzz71EY)
* Introducing MiR: A Community of Underrepresented Minority Users of R (https://medium.com/@doritolay/introducing-mir-a-community-for-underrepresented-users-of-r-7560def7d861)
* Supporting diversity in the R community (upcoming useR talk to be live streamed on July 17th: https://user2020.r-project.org/program/agenda/)
* Discussion between Heather Turner and Jenny Bryan on how to increase diversity of R Core on the R-Ladies Global Slack (if you are on this slack, see discussions in #events_global, invite link to Slack here: https://rladies-community-slack.herokuapp.com/)

Please reach out to R-Ladies Seattle co-organizers if you have any questions, concerns, comments, or ideas about this event. You can send us a message on the R-Ladies Seattle Slack, message us on Twitter (@rladiesseattle) or send an email to seattle@rladies.org.

title: [ONLINE] Function Factories! R-Ladies NL book club Advanced R Chapter 10
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).
Join us for our next meeting, in which Sarah Stolle will present the key points of Chapter 10: ‚ÄúFunction Factories". After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Add questions and expectations in the collaborative HackMD:
https://hackmd.io/jwzoC61qRTOn8C3t3_X-kA?both

Also feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

ABOUT SARAH
----------------------
Sarah has a history in molecular life science and learned R during her PhD studies in the Biology of Ageing. After her academic studies she transitioned into a career in Data Science. She now works as a Data Scientist for Heineken in Amsterdam. Her main programming language at the moment is Python, but she keeps her love for R alive through R-Ladies and in personal projects.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Make sure to read the chapter (10) in advance!

LINK TO MEETUP
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
See on the right

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, Meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: Reproducible computation at scale with drake
description:
The techniques in this tutorial enhance the maintainability, hygiene, speed, scale, and reproducibility of complicated projects with long runtimes. The drake R package resolves the dependency structure of data analysis pipelines, skips tasks that are already up to date, and cleanly organizes the output. Workflows with drake are efficient to maintain, and they provide tangible evidence that the results are synchronized with the underlying code and data, which increases one‚Äôs ability to trust the conclusions of the research.

Learning objectives:
1. Function-oriented programming: participants will learn to express data analysis tasks as user-defined
functions, experience the advantages of functions relative to imperative scripts, and understand the role
of functions in drake-powered projects.
2. Declarative workflows: students will declare targets to represent data analysis artifacts, identify the
dependencies of those targets, and inspect the emergent dependency structures of entire workflows.
3. Project maintenance: students will experience drake‚Äôs responses to changing code and data, and they
will understand the conditions that allow drake to skip computation and save time.
4. Large plans: participants will practice declaring large collections of targets compactly using drake‚Äôs
domain-specific language.

Computing requirements:
Each participant must have a laptop with a web browser and the ability to connect to the internet. Students will spend most of their time
working through R notebooks and supporting Shiny applications.
‚Ä¢ notebooks: https://github.com/wlandau/learndrake/tree/master/inst/notebooks
‚Ä¢ learndrakeflow app: https://wlandau.shinyapps.io/learndrakeflow
‚Ä¢ learndrakeplans app: https://wlandau.shinyapps.io/learndrakeplans
‚Ä¢ drakeplanner app: https://wlandau.shinyapps.io/drakeplanner
Online RStudio Server instances will be provided so participants can interact with the notebooks without
needing to install anything locally.

The instructor:
Will Landau received his PhD in Statistics at Iowa State University in 2016. His dissertation research
introduced a novel fully Bayesian, hierarchical model-driven, GPU-accelerated approach to the analysis of heterosis gene expression data (Landau, Niemi, and Nettleton 2019). He currently works at Eli Lilly and
Company, where he develops capabilities for clinical statisticians.
Will is the creator and maintainer of rOpenSci‚Äôs drake R package. His most recent presentations on drake are the rOpenSci Community Call on September 24, 2019 (video recording at https://ropensci.org/commcalls/
2019-09-24) (Landau and Butland 2019) and a half-day workshop at R/Pharma 2019 (Landau 2019).

https://www.linkedin.com/in/wlandau/
https://wlandau.github.io
https://github.com/wlandau

title: Movie night: Star Wars Episode I ‚Äì The Phantom Menace
description:
Watch a movie on zoom with RLadiesDC.

Two Jedi escape a hostile blockade to find allies and come across a young boy who may bring balance to the Force, but the long dormant Sith resurface to claim their old glory.

title: Conversemos sobre violencia intrafamiliar
description:
Hola, r-ladies!

Nuestras compa√±eras de Barranquilla nos animaron a participar en este meetup con los datos de Espa√±a y no hemos querido dejar pasar esta ocasi√≥n de colaborar en un asunto tan importante. Sabemos que es un meetup un tanto inusual porque ser√° 1) en pleno verano 2) online 3) sobre m√°s un tema social y menos t√©cnico que de costumbre, pero creemos que puede ser muy interesante.

Se trata de una mesa redonda en la que analizaremos la situaci√≥n actual de Colombia, M√©xico y Espa√±a referente a los casos de violencia intrafamiliar durante la cuarentena debido al COVID-19. Presentaremos dashboards elaborados con RStudio donde se pueden visualizar todas las estad√≠sticas correspondientes a cada uno de los pa√≠ses, y mostraremos los resultados y las variaciones en los √≠ndices de violencia.

Contaremos con la presencia de profesionales, quienes nos ayudar√°n a analizar la situaci√≥n por medio de preguntas y comentarios del p√∫blico asistente para que desde la √≥ptica profesional tengamos un acercamiento de lo que pueden ser las causas o condiciones que ocasionan el posible incremento de la violencia en medio de la pandemia.

El meetup se realizar√° por la plataforma virtual ZOOM; el enlace se compartir√° minutos antes del evento.

title: Como crear presentaciones asombrosas con Xaringan
description:
La comunidad de R-Ladies Monterrey estrena su primer tutorial a distancia, y nos gustar√≠a que nos acompa√±aras para este evento.

Estamos muy emocionadas en darle la bienvenida a cDr. Semiramis Castro-Jaimes como nuestra invitada ponente de este tutorial.

Semiramis es una cient√≠fica de datos que programa principalmente en R y Python. Es egresada de la Universidad Nacional Aut√≥noma de M√©xico y durante su doctorado se enfoc√≥ en el an√°lisis de bacterias pat√≥genas y la resistencia a antibi√≥ticos. Las diapositivas de varias de sus charlas est√°n en https://speakerdeck.com/semiramiscj y si te dedicas a la bioinform√°tica, puedes encontrar algunos scripts que te pudieran ser √∫tiles en https://github.com/semiramisCJ/miscelaneous

El paquete xaringan es una extensi√≥n de R Markdown para generar presentaciones en formato HTML de diferentes estilos. Las presentaciones pueden incluir bloques de c√≥digo, im√°genes, emojis y tablas. El tutorial ser√° de nivel introductorio te llevaremos de la mano para que conozcas RMarkdown.

Con la finalidad de poder brindar la mejor atenci√≥n a los asistentes el tutorial ser√° de cupo limitado, por lo que te pedimos reserves tu lugar. Se enviar√°n los requerimientos de paqueter√≠a para su instalaci√≥n previa al tutorial a las confirmaciones.

Para tener un evento seguro, el link de acceso al evento lo recibir√°n quienes confirmen su asistencia via RSVP de meetup.com el d√≠a del evento.

title: C√≥mo preparar una propuesta de presentaci√≥n para una conferencia/meetup sobre R
description:
La realizaci√≥n de conferencias y meetups sobre R en modalidad virtual es una excelente oportunidad para que grupos menos representados en nuestra comunidad participen en estas instancias. Para muchas personas, la imposibilidad de viajar --sea por la raz√≥n que sea-- ha sido un impedimento para poder ser parte de estas actividades. Ahora tenemos una oportunidad que es importante que aprovochemos. Pero ¬øc√≥mo preparar una propuesta? ¬øQu√© debiese incluir el abstract? ¬øPara qu√© conferencia es m√°s apropiada la idea que tengo? ¬øQu√© deber√≠a tener en cuenta al pensar una propuesta de presentaci√≥n para un meetup? ¬øEs lo mismo escribir un abstract para una conferencia de R que para una conferencia en mi disciplina? ¬øQu√© tengo que incluir en la Bio? Para responder estas preguntas y compartir algunas recomendaciones para dise√±ar tu propuesta nos juntaremos el pr√≥ximo s√°bado 1 de agosto :)

- ¬øY si todav√≠a no tengo una idea para una presentaci√≥n?

- ¬øQu√© necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro c√≥digo de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con √©l: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish. Queremos que nuestros meetups sean un espacio seguro y amable en que todas las personas se sientan c√≥modas participando.

Lo segundo, es asegurarte de que puedes utilizar la aplicaci√≥n Zoom en tu computador. El d√≠a del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese d√≠a que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesi√≥n.

Esta es una actividad organizada por los cap√≠tulos de RLadies de Chile en conjunto con LatinR (https://latin-r.com/), la Conferencia Latinoamericana sobre Uso de R en Investigaci√≥n + Desarrollo. Queremos m√°s representaci√≥n de Latinoam√©rica en las conferencias de R alrededor del mundo y qu√© mejor que apoyarnos como comunidad para lograrlo.

title: Aprende a programar en R: Parte 2 - Tipos de objetos y funciones
description:
Siguiendo con nuestra serie de webinar sobre programaci√≥n b√°sica en R, los invitamos a unirse a este evento que cubrir√° los diferentes tipos de objetos (variables) utilizados en R, as√≠ como una peque√±a introducci√≥n a qu√© son las funciones y c√≥mo construirlas.

Igual que en nuestro evento anterior, seguiremos utilizando recursos libres y plataformas de colaboraci√≥n en l√≠nea gratuitas para que puedas seguir nuestra sesi√≥n en vivo.

Nos basaremos en el libro 'El arte de programar en R' por Santana y Farf√°n disponible de manera gratuita aqu√≠: https://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/Santana_El_arte_de_programar_en_R.pdf . En esta primera sesi√≥n nos enfocaremos en los cap√≠tulos 2 y 3 que hablan de los distintos tipos de objetos, as√≠ como una introducci√≥n a las funciones en R. Otra referencia relevante es 'R para principantes' de Juan Mendoza Vega, disponible de manera gratuita aqu√≠: https://bookdown.org/jboscomendoza/r-principiantes4/ .

Nuestros talleres est√°n abiertos a todos los miembros de la comunidad Galapague√±a y al p√∫blico en general, pero incentivamos en especial a mujeres, ni√±as y personas pertenecientes a minor√≠as que formen parte de nuestros eventos.

Debido a que el COVID-19 contin√∫a siendo una preocupaci√≥n en Ecuador, este evento ser√° llevado a cabo en l√≠nea a trav√©s de la plataforma Zoom. Compartiremos el v√≠nculo de acceso una hora antes del evento. Les pedimos no compartirlo en l√≠nea por cuestiones de seguridad.

Para mantener nuestros eventos como un ambiente seguro en el que todos los participantes puedan participar, te pedimos que leas y te adhieras a nuestro c√≥digo de conducta (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct), as√≠ como nuestras gu√≠as de comunidad (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/blob/master/RLadiesRulesAndGuideLinesENES.md).

title: (virtual) Getting the most of Git w/ UseR
description:
=====================================================
Topic: Getting the most of Git
Speakers: Colin Gillespie, Rhian Davies (Jumping Rivers)
Co-Hosted by: UseR, R-Ladies East Lansing and R-Ladies Chicago
Time: July 31, 2020 09:00 AM EST
Contact: eastlansing@rladies.org; chicago@rladies.org

**Must SIGN UP to register:
https://forms.gle/PRp26658f66BA3vW8
- Zoom meeting link will be provided to confirmed attendees

Log into Slack:
[RLEL] https://rladies-eastlansing.slack.com
[RLC] https://rladies-chicago.slack.com
(Shared Channel: #2020-gitmore)
=====================================================

For detailed onboarding: https://github.com/rladies-eastlansing/2020-gitmore/

####################
Assumed knowledge
####################
Participants should be familiar with
- writing basic R functions
- basic git, e.g push, pull, commit. The initial task will be to
- fork a repo
- Clone the repo onto your machine
- basic GitHub
- writing a simple R package

#################
Before the meetup
#################
Please create accounts on the following websites:
- https://travis-ci.org
- https://codecov.io/
- https://hub.docker.com/
- https://www.pushbullet.com/

Please remember that this is a hands-on co-work/Q&A session.
- Make sure you have updated/working versions of R/RStudio; Git/GitHub (optional: GitHub Desktop)
- Join via Zoom + Slack with your laptops
- Post your questions in the shared Slack channel #2020-gitmore (for R-Ladies East Lansing/Chicago)

##################
During the meetup
##################
Getting the most of Git
https://www.jumpingrivers.com/t/2019-user-git/#1 (2019 tutorial)

Part 1: Introduction to CI and Git
Part 2: Travis Part 1
Part 3: GitHub Pat
Part 4: Travis Part 2
Part 5: The pkgdown website

We will discuss widely applicable Q's via Zoom for everyone's benefit.
We will answer additional Q's via Slack.

###########
Resources
###########
GITHUB
- Getting Started: https://gist.github.com/csgillespie/447e4ebed711199a320c97a65f71da84
- Repo for this meetup w/ setup instructions, slides, and other useful preparatory material: https://github.com/rladies-eastlansing/2020-gitmore

ZOOM
- Zoom meeting link will be provided to confirmed attendees [Zoom desktop would be preferable]

Other Useful References
- Git Novice from Software Carpentry: https://swcarpentry.github.io/git-novice/
- Git Cheatsheets: https://github.com/jananiravi/cheatsheets/tree/master/git-md
- Happy Git with R: https://happygitwithr.com/
- How to create a package from Scratch: https://hilaryparker.com/2014/04/29/writing-an-r-package-from-scratch/

Questions? Having trouble with installation & set-up?
- Find us on Slack: rladies-eastlansing.slack.com OR rladies-chicago.slack.com (channel: #2020-gitmore)
- Email us: eastlansing@rladies.org OR chicago@rladies.org

Al√©m disso, √© feita uma an√°lise dos setores econ√¥micos que mais foram afetados por cada crise.

L√≠via Linhares - Analista de Pricing no Sicredi. Economista pela Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais, mestre em Administra√ß√£o/Finan√ßas e doutoranda em Administra√ß√£o/Pesquisa Operacional pela Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul. R addicted desde 2015 :)

Resumo: Pesquisadores do Instituto de Matem√°tica e Estat√≠stica (IME) da UFRGS desenvolveram um aplicativo em R Shiny que cont√©m um simulador de epidemias utilizando uma vers√£o alterada do tradicional modelo SIR. Com ele √© poss√≠vel simular cen√°rios para a epidemia considerando diferentes formas de interven√ß√£o para seu manejo e diferentes combina√ß√µes para os par√¢metros que regem sua evolu√ß√£o. title: Combined July Meetup! San Diego useR / Boston useR / South Coast MA useR
description:
Hey all!

Our fellow R enthusiasts from San Diego R Users Groups have invited us to join their upcoming meetup. I'm really excited to participate and get to know even more awesome R lovers!

I hope to see you all there,

Juliana

Posted from San Diego R Users Groups:

Coast to Coast for this summer meetup! July's meetup will feature 3 useR Groups!

Greater Boston useR: https://www.meetup.com/Boston-useR/
San Diego useR: https://www.meetup.com/sd-r-users/
South Coast MA useR: https://www.meetup.com/South-Coast-useR-Group

Talk #1: Andrew Bates, Databases With R:

Using databases directly within R can greatly streamline your workflow. In this talk we will learn how to query databases and return the results as an R data frame. We will show how packages like DBI and dbplyr allow us to use dplyr syntax to run queries against a database and return the results. This allows us to keep our workflow entirely within R, instead of switching contexts between SQL and R. After looking at a few examples, we will cover some tips for incorporating these ideas into our daily work as well as resources for moving beyond the basics.

Talk #2: Asmae Toumi, naniar package:

Asmae Toumi will give a very broad overview of how to leverage the {naniar} package to explore and visualize missing data, identify patterns of missing data, and impute missing data using the {MICE} package.

Talk #3: Amanda Hart, Tips & tricks for making your own R package:

From plotting to analysis, packages are foundational tools for R users. But what happens when there isn‚Äôt an existing package to meet your needs? In this talk, we will learn how to take your own code and turn it into a new R package. We will provide simple steps to get started and tips to add features as you become package-building experts.

Talk #4: Juliana Capitanio, Flexdashboards: Using interactive dashboards to create data visualizations

Juliana Capitanio will show us how to use R Markdown to quickly create a dashboard using the flexdashboards package. These dashboards can compile plots, tables, gauges, value boxes, text annotations and maps into various layouts. Dashboard components are responsive and quickly resize to fit mobile devices. Further, we can easily make dashboard elements interactive by using htmlwidgets for R and/or Shiny.

title: Sesi√≥n 6 - Club de lectura - Happy Git with R, de Jenny Bryan
description:
Este mi√©rcoles nos reuniremos para la sexta y √∫ltima sesi√≥n del club de lectura sobre el libro "Happy Git with R" de Jenny Bryan, actividad organizada de manera conjunta entre RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valpara√≠so y RLadies Concepci√≥n. "Happy Git with R" aborda el uso del sistema de control de versiones Git en conjunto con GitHub, R y RStudio. El libro est√° disponible de manera gratuita en: https://happygitwithr.com/

- ¬øQu√© haremos en esta √∫ltima sesi√≥n?

Durante la sesi√≥n pondremos en pr√°ctica algunos flujos de trabajo colaborativo. Veremos c√≥mo distintas personas pueden colaborar en un mismo repositorio, c√≥mo agregar cambios a un pull request abierto por ti o por otra persona, c√≥mo dejar disponible en GitHub archivos en html como presentaciones y libros en l√≠nea, etc. Si te interesa, tendr√°s la oportunidad de practicar todo esto durante la sesi√≥n. Revisa m√°s abajo qu√© paquetes tienes que tener instalados.

title: Exploring Weight Loss Maintenance Through Experiments
description:
Abstract:
I explore a theory of goal maintenance which states that individuals who achieve significant goals ‚Äì such as getting out of debt, becoming sober, or losing a substantial amount of weight ‚Äì are more likely to maintain the progress achieved if they frequently think about the person they were in the past, before meeting the goal, and make downward comparisons between their present self and their past, pre-goal self. In this talk, I will discuss two studies used to test this theory for weight loss maintenance, including an observational study using data from Reddit and a randomized controlled experiment using an Amazon Mechanical Turk population. I will also discuss R methods used to parse through semi-structured data, perform regression analyses and hypothesis tests, and visualize results.

Bio:
Elicia John is a Behavioral Data Scientist. Her research focuses on consumer well-being and decision making, and she works to uncover insights that will help consumers live healthier, happier, and more productive lives. Her work has been presented at national and international conferences ‚Äì including the Association for Consumer Research Conference, the Society for Consumer Psychology Conference, and the Race in the Marketplace Forum ‚Äì and published in the Policy Insights from the Behavioral and Brain Sciences journal. Prior to pursuing doctoral studies, Elicia worked as a data scientist and management consultant. She helped stakeholders and clients in public, private, and non-profit sector organizations improve business operations and develop effective policy and strategy. She currently holds Ph.D. and Master of Science degrees in Management (Consumer Behavior and Decision Making) from UCLA, a Master in Public Policy degree from Harvard University, and a Bachelor of Science degree from the University of Maryland, College Park in engineering.

title: Would you like to become a more Confident and Engaging Speaker?
description:
Would you like to become a more confident and engaging speaker?

If YES then be sure to attend July's R-Ladies Melbourne seminar! This month we are excited to welcome Jo Evans, a Public/Online Speaking and Presentation Coach and a TEDx Speaker Trainer.

To support our R-ladies community Jo will share tips on how to master the art of communicating whether it's online or face to face. In this very practical online session we'll look at:

a) How to calm those fears that may well be holding us back from speaking up
b) Explore some great techniques to help us become a more engaging speaker, especially in the online environment
c) In breakout rooms have a go at trying out some of the techniques for ourselves

BEFORE the session, please think of an area of your work or an interest or an idea that you have that you would love to present to a small audience. Think about why your audience will be interested to hear what you have to say. No need to plan a talk but please come prepared with your topic. AND be open to push through any fears, try out new ideas, support each other to become more confident and engaging speakers and have fun! Jo is looking forward to meeting all our members!

Jo's aim is to help people address their fears around speaking, develop confidence and skills in their ability to speak so they can share their message - whatever it is that matters to them.

She has a passion for helping people to become engaging and powerful speakers and to have fun along the way! She has been involved in Presenting at Conferences, Public Speaking and Coaching for over 10 years and is a Distinguished Toastmaster.

To learn more about Jo please have a look at her LinkedIn profile https://www.linkedin.com/in/jo-evans/.

This will be an online event, please be sure to connect a few minutes early for a prompt start at 5:30pm.

We look forward to seeing everyone on the 29th!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: useR2020 Tutorial: "Causal Inference in R" (Underrepresented groups signup)
description:
RLadies LA is teaming up with this year's virtual useR! 2020 conference to host a casual inference tutorial hosted by Dr. Lucy D'Agostino McGowan and Dr. Malcom Barrett! See bottom of post for important logistical details.

Description: In both data science and academic research, prediction modeling is often not enough; to answer many questions, we need to approach them causally. In this workshop, we‚Äôll teach the essential elements of answering causal questions in R through causal diagrams, and causal modeling techniques such as propensity scores and inverse probability weighting. We‚Äôll also show that by distinguishing predictive models from causal models, we can better take advantage of both tools. You‚Äôll be able to use the tools you already know--the tidyverse, regression models, and more--to answer the questions that are important to your work.

Audience: This tutorial will appeal to statisticians and data scientists interested in taking their inference to the next level, incorporating causal techniques.

Logistical notes:
* This is the sign-up page for anyone who is a member of an underrepresented group.
* We have a separate sign-up page (here: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-la/events/271909700/) for anyone who does not identify as part of an underrepresented group. Please RSVP on only one page. Thank you for helping us support diversity in #rstats!
* The tutorial will have live closed captioning available (you can turn it on from within Zoom)
* The Zoom room will have a password, which we will email to attendees before the event. Please check your email so that you can join us!

Questions? Leave a comment or send us a message!

See you on July 27!

Your RLadies LA hosts,
Amanda & Katie

title: Root cause analysis using frequent pattern discovery (Machine learning usecase)
description:
Hi everybody,
Before jumping to the summer's holiday, wanted to organize another meetup, and here we are!
In this meetup, we are hosting Golnaz, she is a data scientist working for Altran Italia. During this meet up she will:
- Discuss practical steps to start a career in data science and opportunities in Altran.
- Present a real use case on pattern mining. An approach used to developing a semi-supervised ML model for root cause analysis and finding correlations in data.
Wanna learn more? Join us at online meetup!
With RSVP Yes, you will receive the link for joining to us online.

title: Code-RLadies July Lightning Talk & Workshop - Virtual!
description:
Join us via Zoom: (link will show to all who RSVP)
Our Lighting Talk: Linda Langdon with RMarkdown with Microsoft Word.

Our Workshop Focus: Krista Galyen with intro to API calls for data collection.

======

What are Lightning talks? Lightning talks are quick, 5-minute mini-presentations that are showing the art of the possible. They increase awareness and excitement about possibilities. If you want to present a future Lightning Talk, contact us!

What are Workshops? Our workshops help Code-RLadies gather together, network, and learn from each other. Our workshops cover the bulk of the meeting. We believe in being hands-on! Are you interested in leading or participating in a workshop? Contact us!

title: GBV Prevalence in Kenya: Caroline Akoth (Women in GIS Kenya)
description:
Caroline Akoth is a spatial data scientist and the director of operations and advocacy at Women in GIS Kenya (@WiGISKe on Twitter/ https://wigis.co.ke/). In this talk, she will be sharing their work on mapping gender-based violence in Kenya.

"Gender based violence in Kenya is a health indicator that investigates sexual or physical abuse of persons based on their gender.
SDG 5 on Gender Equality targets to have 0 % prevalence of GBV cases globally. Locally the national policy on prevention and response to GBV hopes to achieve 25 % Prevalence in the next year.
This presentation will look at reporting GBV prevalence in Kenya while highlighting notable trends in counties.
The aim of this project is to further look at how far the country is at achieving 25% Prevalence goal set by the national policy." - Caroline Akoth

After witnessing her informative, moving and empowering talk at satRday2020 in Joburg, we are thrilled to have her back to share her work with our members. We hope that those of you interested in giving a voice to issues affecting South African womxn will be inspired, motivated and equipped to do so!

Please join via the Google Hangouts link. Please MUTE your microphone when you join!

Elvira Nassirova will give an overview of a data analyst's toolkit - which tools to use and why, and what kind of tasks a data analyst does. The second part of the talk will be about how to gather and analyze public data and stay objective.
Elvira Nassirova is from Kazakhstan and based in Tbilisi. She works as Data Analyst at Railsware and as mentor at Yandex.Praktikum. Elvira uses R for data processing, exploration, visualization, web scraping and automation. Elvira loves R for its beautiful structure, dataviz tools, and of course, for its lovely community!

https://github.com/bjolko/

Please register here to receive the event link: https://tinyurl.com/tbsreg.

title: Aprende a programar en R: Parte 1 - Tipos de datos
description:

title: [Online] useR2020! Tutorial: Predictive modeling with text- tidy data principles
description:
(Please note, we are not hosting this event, so to sign up you need to use any ONE of the links given towards the end of this post!)

This useR! 2020 online tutorial is being hosted by the R-Ladies chapters from Argentina!

----------------
Instructors:
----------------

Emil Hvitfeldt and Julia Silge

----------------------------------------------------------
About the Tutorial and expected learning:
----------------------------------------------------------

Have you ever encountered text data and suspected there was useful insight latent within it but felt frustrated about how to find that insight?

Are you familiar with the basics of predictive modeling, and ready to learn how unstructured text data can be used for prediction within the tidyverse and tidymodels ecosystems?

Do you need a flexible framework for handling text data that empowers you to build supervised predictive models?

Text data is increasingly important in many domains, and tidy modeling principles can be applied to natural language processing tasks. This presentation is designed to provide practical guidance and directly applicable knowledge for data scientists and analysts who want to integrate text into their modeling pipelines.

In this 90-minute tutorial, learn how to preprocess text data for modeling, train models, and evaluate model perform.

Slides and live coding during the tutorial will be used to walk through a realistic case study.

The tutorial will be streamed, recorded, and captioned, and there will be supporting materials and code on GitHub for you to work through afterward.

-------------------------------------------------------------
Expected level of audience‚Äôs R background:
-------------------------------------------------------------

Intermediate familiarity with R, RStudio, basics of regression and classification modeling, and tidyverse packages such as dplyr and ggplot2.

------------------------------------------------------
Sign up through any one of these links:
------------------------------------------------------

R-Ladies Buenos Aires: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-buenos-aires/events/271926360

R-Ladies Santa Rosa: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-santa-rosa/events/271927045/

R-Ladies C√≥rdoba: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-cordoba/events/271984839/

-------------------------
Code of Conduct:
-------------------------

As every R-Ladies event, all participants are required to agree to the Code of Conduct. In addition, we also adopt the useR! 2020 Code of Conduct.
1. R-Ladies Code of Conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct
2. useR! 2020 Code of Conduct: https://user2020.r-project.org/codeofconduct/

title: Books In Bars - Rodham
description:
Spend Friday night discussing Rodham (https://bookshop.org/books/rodham/9780399590917).

From the New York Times bestselling author of American Wife and Eligible, a novel that imagines a deeply compelling what-might-have-been: What if Hillary Rodham hadn't married Bill Clinton?

In 1971, Hillary Rodham is a young woman full of promise: Life magazine has covered her Wellesley commencement speech, she's attending Yale Law School, and she's on the forefront of student activism and the women's rights movement. And then she meets Bill Clinton. A handsome, charismatic southerner and fellow law student, Bill is already planning his political career. In each other, the two find a profound intellectual, emotional, and physical connection that neither has previously experienced.

In the real world, Hillary followed Bill back to Arkansas, and he proposed several times; although she said no more than once, as we all know, she eventually accepted and became Hillary Clinton.

But in Curtis Sittenfeld's powerfully imagined tour-de-force of fiction, Hillary takes a different road. Feeling doubt about the prospective marriage, she endures their devastating breakup and leaves Arkansas. Over the next four decades, she blazes her own trail--one that unfolds in public as well as in private, that involves crossing paths again (and again) with Bill Clinton, that raises questions about the tradeoffs all of us must make in building a life.

Brilliantly weaving a riveting fictional tale into actual historical events, Curtis Sittenfeld delivers an uncannily astute and witty story for our times. In exploring the loneliness, moral ambivalence, and iron determination that characterize the quest for political power, as well as both the exhilaration and painful compromises demanded of female ambition in a world still run mostly by men, Rodham is a singular and unforgettable novel.
PS Please contact the organizer if you need support finding the book.

title: Donne e data science: come trovare la tua strada
description:
Donne e data science: come trovare la tua strada. Round table con 6 data scientists con background e profili professionali diversi.

L'evento √® aperto a tutti e a tutti i livelli di esperienza. L'evento √® gratuito, in lingua italiana e prevede il seguente programma:
-45‚Äô di discussione in cui 6 donne nel mondo della data science racconteranno le loro esperienze. Quali professioni ci sono e come capire il ruolo pi√π adatto in un team di Data Science? Quali sono le differenze tra il mondo professionale e l‚Äôambiente accademico? Quali risorse utilizzare per imparare e su quali skills focalizzarsi? Rimanere in Italia o cercare un lavoro all‚Äôestero? Quali sono le principali applicazioni di data science nell'industria? E' necessario avere un profilo tecnico per avere una carriera nel data science?
- 30‚Äô di Q&A session (sessione di domande&risposte) in cui risponderemo alle vostre domande.

Speakers:

- Sara Iacozza: Dottorata in psicologia cognitiva e neuroscienze, lavora come data storyteller per /Data. Si occupa di ricerca di mercato e produce business insights utilizzando dati quantitativi e storytelling.
- Giovanna de Vincenzo: Data scientist specializzata in Data Visualization per il business, ha conseguito il master Big Data in Business per Data Scientist
- Parvaneh Shafiei: Senior data scientist con oltre 5 anni di esperienza nell'applicazione di Machine Learning, Intelligenza artificiale e analisi avanzata per problemi aziendali
- Oriana Angelucci: √® una Senior business translator. Ha lavorato nella ricerca di mercato e ora si √® concentrata sulla trasformazione basata sui dati di Customer Relationship Management attraverso l'applicazione di analisi avanza
- Cristina Muschitiello: Phd in Statistica Metodologica, R-Developer, Ricercatore e Data Scientist. Attualmente Data Scientist presso infocamere, collabora altres√¨ con il Consiglio per la ricerca in agricoltura e l'analisi dell'economia agraria (CREA) dove si occupa di statistiche per l'agricoltura
- Francesca Rosa: Associate Statistician @ UNODC

Vi aspettiamo!

title: UseR! 2020 tutorial: Easy Larger-than-RAM  data manipulation  with disk.frame
description:
Hey everyone,

As most of you know, UseR! 2020 is happening online this year. Further, this year the conference tutorials will be done in partnership with R-Ladies Global, MiR, and the AfricaR user group.

The AWESOME news is that our group, R-Ladies San Diego, has been chosen to host one of the UseR! tutorials this year! We are really excited to bring this opportunity to our members and to other R enthusiasts from all over the world!

The tutorial we are hosting will be presented by disk.frame creator Zhuo Jia Dai (ZJ). He'll tell us more about "Easy Larger-than-RAM data manipulation with disk.frame".

Here's ZJ's description: In this tutorial, we will present the {disk.frame} (diskframe.com) R package for handling datasets that are too large for RAM but still fits comfortably on your hard drive. We will go through how {disk.frame} works, how to manipulate ten's of gigabytes of data without using all your RAM, and how you can take advantage of the many CPU cores on your computer by parallelizing data manipulation task using {disk.frame}. Also, I will show you how to perform all the standard data manipulations by using just dplyr verbs! After the tutorial, you should be able to confidently tackle dataset up to ten's of gigabytes in size comfortably on your laptop.

I really hope you can all make it to our very first online event. This is such an amazing opportunity for all of us! Hopefully useR! 2020 will allow many that might not have been able to attend such a conference in person to join us in our exploration of the R universe.

We really look forward to (virtually) seeing everyone again soon!

Your R-Ladies SD organizers

title: useR! 2020: Create and share reproducible code with R Markdown and workflowr
description:
We are proud to host the tutorial as a part of useR!2020. We have limited slots for the tutorial (only 8 for our group), so please only register if you are going to attend. Further to this, we are giving preference to women and minority genders for our slots, so if you are a male member of our group please head over to eSwatini RUG meetup page (https://www.meetup.com/EswatiniUseR/) (https://www.meetup.com/EswatiniUseR/events/271981460/), or Botswana RUG meetup page (https://www.meetup.com/Botswana-R-Users/) (https://www.meetup.com/Botswana-R-Users/events/271985777/) as they will also be hosting with us.

Please note: We are opening up *15* spots and we will be choosing **8** from them who will attend the workshop. The others will be wait-listed in the event someone drops off the attendees list.

Description:
Have you ever struggled to re-run your own code or scripts you received from a collaborator? You‚Äôre not alone! Fortunately, there are simple practices that you can use to help you develop more reproducible R code. In this tutorial, you will 1) explore some of the common causes of non-reproducible code, 2) gain practical experience fixing reproducibility issues, and 3) use the R package workflowr (https://jdblischak.github.io/workflowr/) to facilitate creation of more reproducible and shareable code. The tutorial will be hands-on and interactive, with small-group exercises.

Prerequisites:
Participants should have some experience using R (e.g. importing data from a file, loading a package). The tutorial will involve running R code in R Markdown files from the RStudio IDE. If you are unfamiliar with R Markdown, we recommend reviewing these short guides before participating in the tutorial: [Introduction](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-1.html), [How It Works](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-2.html), [Code Chunks](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-3.html].

Requirements:
A web browser, an account on GitHub (https://github.com/), and an account on RStudio Cloud (https://rstudio.cloud/). We will email you the tutorial materials.

Instructors:
Dr. John Blischak received his PhD in Genetics from the University of Chicago. He is the author of the CRAN package workflowr, and has years of experience performing reproducible data analysis with R, R Markdown, and Git. He is a certified Software Carpentry Instructor, and has taught over 10 workshops for researchers covering topics such as Bash, Python, R, and Git.

Dr. Peter Carbonetto, a co-author of the workflowr R package, is a research staff scientist in the Human Genetics Department and the cross-disciplinary Research Computing Center at the University of Chicago. He has a background in computer science and machine learning, and currently does research at the interface of genetics, statistics, and computer science. He frequently gives R and bioinformatics skills workshops at the University of Chicago.

It will be an online meetup, and the link will be sent to successful attendees via email.

All Information: https://bit.ly/2WqAfNy

title: Analysis of COVID-19 DATA with R
description:
We are excited to invite you to our next meetup : Analysis of COVID-19 data with R.

‚óæÔ∏è Date/Time : Wednesday, the 22nd of July 2020 6:00PM -> 7:30PM (Tunisia time GMT+1)
‚óæÔ∏è Place : Zoom (https://zoom.us/download)

Throughout the webinar, Dr. Dhafer Mallouche will be presenting his new website http://covid19data.website for monitoring the COVID-19 situation in the whole world. The website contains the Dashboard of the situation in all the countries with more than 1000 cases, in all the continents, the geographical territories, the countries by economic level (according to BM classification) as well as the different states of the US.
Dr. Mallouche gives also an estimate of the R(t) (reproduction number) during the last 60 days.
Dr. Mallouche's dashboard classifies as well the countries according to the COVID-19 situation based on 6 criteria : the R (t), the growth rate of confirmed, active and death cases and the number of cases per million inhabitants.

About Dr. Dhafer Mallouche :

He is a Professor of Statistics and Applied Mathematics at The University of Carthage. He earned his Ph.D. in Statistics and Applied
Mathematics from Paul Sabatier University in Toulouse, France, in October 1997, and a Master‚Äôs Degree in Applied Mathematics from the same university in June 1994. He started his academic professional as Assistant Professor in Sousse in Tunisia. In September 2003, Dr. Dhafer moved to the Higher Engineering School of Statistics of the University of Carthage. He was successively promoted to Associate-Professor in 2011, later to Professor in 2018. He had taught there several statistical and data science courses. He had supervised five Ph.D. in Applied Statistics. Dr. Dhafer has authored and co-authored more than 50 research papers in many topics related to applied statistics and mathematics. Dr. Dhafer was a Fulbright scholar at Stanford University and the University of Michigan. On several times he was a visiting scholar at Yale University and in prestigious colleges in Canada and France.

title: [Online] useR!2020 Tutorial: A ggplot2 crash course
description:
(Please note, we are not hosting this event, so to register you need to follow the link towards the end of this post!)

The useR! 2020 conference has gone online this year! This has made the tutorials being conducted as a part of the conference to be accessible remotely.

Join this online tutorial to learn about creating beautiful data visualizations in R using ggplot2! Use the link at the bottom of this page to register. This tutorial is being jointly hosted by the useR! 2020 team, R-Ladies NYC and R-Ladies DC.

Users of any subject matter background who are interested in data visualization with R are welcome. New R users (less than 1 year of continual experience) will get the most out of this course. Some basic knowledge, such as understanding of different R data types & structures (character, data frame, etc.) and authoring simple functions & loops, is required. The course, however, is not just for beginners. More advanced R users who have little to no experience with ggplot2 and other packages in the tidyverse will learn many new tools for data visualization in R.

---------------------
Instructor bio:
---------------------

Dr. Sam Tyner has been using ggplot2 since version 0.9.2 (2012). She co-authored and maintains the ggplot2 extension package geomnet, and has taught ggplot2 to undergraduate students, graduate students, and professionals. Her material for undergraduate students can be found at csafe-isu.github.io/reu18/slides, and a list of all workshops taught is available in her CV. Dr. Tyner also has expertise in the theory of data visualization, acquired through her dissertation research and as a part of the statistical graphics working group at Iowa State University. She has written about her ggplot2 work in The R Journal and on her blog.

------------------------------------
Computing requirements:
------------------------------------

Having R + RStudio installed is recommended, but if this is not possible you may use the RStudio Cloud workspace. Those not using the RStudio Cloud should have the tidyverse suite of packages and the plotly package installed. Or, for the minimalist participant, ggplot2, dplyr, tidyr, and plotly will be sufficient for the bulk of the material.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Upon completion of this tutorial, participants will be able to:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Identify the appropriate plot types and corresponding ggplot2 geoms to consider when visualizing their data;
2. Implement the ggplot2 grammar of graphics by using ggplot() and building up plots with the + operator;
3. Iterate through multiple visualizations of their data by changing the aesthetic mappings, geometries, and other graph properties;
4. Incorporate custom elements (colors, fonts, etc.) into their visualizations by adjusting ggplot2 theme elements;
5. Investigate the world of ggplot2 independently to expand upon the skills learned in the course.

----------------------------
Link for registration:
----------------------------

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/creating-beautiful-data-visualizations-in-r-a-ggplot2-crash-course-tickets-112524126692

-------------------------
Code of Conduct:
-------------------------

As every R-Ladies event, all participants are required to agree to the Code of Conduct. In addition, we also adopt the useR! 2020 Code of Conduct.
1. R-Ladies Code of Conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct
2. useR! 2020 Code of Conduct: https://user2020.r-project.org/codeofconduct/

title: [Online event] Q&A with Authors of "Build a Career in Data Science"
description:
Authors of "Build a Career in Data Science" Emily Robinson and Jacqueline Nolis will read selections from their book and discuss why they were meaningful and what thinking went into making it. In this session you‚Äôll learn about some of the higher-level thinking that went into designing a book to help people excel in their data science careers, as well as hear stories from Emily and Jacqueline‚Äôs pasts that ended up shaping the narrative. After Emily and Jacqueline discuss their book, the floor will open so anyone can ask their data science career questions!

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page and sent to all attendees at noon on the day of the event. *Note: Please check your spam or "Promotions" tab (if a Gmail user) for this Meetup announcement email if it does not appear in your inbox. Email nyc@rladies.org prior to the event if you do not receive it.*

Agenda (times approximate):
7-7:05 pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:05-7:40: Emily & Jacqueline talk about their book
7:40-8:15: Audience Q&A
8:15-8:20: Wrap-up

--- Speaker Bios ---

Emily Robinson is a senior data scientist at Warby Parker, where she works on a centralized team tackling some of the company's projects. She previously worked at DataCamp, where she built and ran their experimentation analytics system, and at Etsy, where she worked with their search team.

Dr. Jacqueline Nolis is a principal data scientist at Brightloom where she creates models to help restaurants and retailers improve the customer experience. She has a PhD in Industrial Engineering, and has over a decade of experience with helping companies use data, ranking from DSW to Airbnb. For fun Jacqueline likes to use data science for humor‚Äîlike using deep learning to generate offensive license plates.

---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

title: Virtual Tidy Tuesday - Join and practice your R skills
description:
Do you want to practice your R-skills? Do you want to improve your abilities to clean, analyse and plot data?

Then this event is what you need! We will meet virtually and work with datasets provided by Tidy Tuesday, an initiative from R for Data Science which posts a new dataset weekly for practicing your R skills (https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday). Everyone can choose which dataset most interests them (the current one or past ones) and what they want to practice using it. We will do this together to have the opportunity to ask others and because coding together is fun!

At the end of the meetup, you'll have the chance to share what you've done with the group, post it to Twitter, and/or add it to your data science portfolio. In this way, we can all inspire each other with new methods, graphs, and data concepts, as well as each build our own skillset and data science portfolio.

R-enthusiasts of all levels are welcome, whether it's your first bar chart or you're basically a ggplot expert. Everyone will have the chance to work at their own level, ask/answer questions, and learn something new!

Feel free to take a look at the dataset(s) before we meet and bring ideas for yourself and others.

IMPORTANT:
Given the current situation the meetup will be hold virtually via Zoom, which you can download here: https://zoom.us/download
You will receive the link shortly before the meeting via e-mail. So check your inbox close to the start time. All meetings are monitored by two co-organizers to ensure a peaceful and secure meeting!

title: Me, Myself, and R
description:
Join us for a virtual meetup this July to hear from Charlotte Jones-Todd about her journey with R!

Overview from Charlotte: In this talk I will talk you through my journey with R. After my undergraduate degree in pure mathematics I used my laptop to answer the odd email and watch the buffering symbol cloud any TV show I attempted to watch. Now, as most of you, I spend my time digging around the guts of R. Here I'll share some of my experiences and show you how and what I use R for. I'll shamelessly admit to "heavily borrowing" (stealing) ideas and the many, many, rookie mistakes I make daily. All this whilst, hopefully, teaching others about the wonders of R and stats.

Charlotte's Bio: I've just had my 1 year anniversary as a lecturer in statistics at the University of Auckland. I spend my time teaching stats, coding‚Å†‚Äîthen fixing‚Å†‚Äîbugs, pandering to my pets, and making gin.

This meeting will be hosted on Zoom. The meeting link will be sent out to those attending closer to the meetup date.

If you have any questions or problems, don't hesitate to contact Izzy Johnson (main host) through meet-up!

As with all our meetups, please be aware of and read the Code of Conduct before attending.

title: A Conversation in Racial Algorithmic Bias with Dr. Safiya Umoja Noble
description:
* IN COLLABORATION WITH R-LADIES NEW ORLEANS*
We could not be more thrilled to present an opportunity to chat with best-selling author, Dr. Safiya Umjoa Noble on how algorithms, such as those used in Google searches, are racially biased and how they enable racial and gender subjugation.

Dr. Safiya Umoja Noble is an Associate Professor at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) in the Department of Information Studies where she serves as the Co-Director of the UCLA Center for Critical Internet Inquiry. She is the author of a best-selling book on racist and sexist algorithmic bias in commercial search engines, Algorithms of Oppression: How Search Engines Reinforce Racism (NYU Press).

title: How to Test & Roll
description:
Marketers often use A/B testing as a tool to compare marketing treatments in a test stage and then deploy the better-performing treatment to the remainder of the consumer population. These tests have traditionally been analyzed using hypothesis testing, which Elea covered in a previous R Ladies workshop. In this workshop, Elea and Ron will explain a new approach to A/B testing that they developed called "Test & Roll" that focuses on the profit earned during and after the test. It is based on a Bayesian decision theory and the (very technical) Test & Roll paper explains why marketers should use this approach. This workshop will focus on how to Test & Roll using hands-on examples in R. Elea and Ron will cover:

- When you should use "Test & Roll" versus traditional hypothesis test
- How to compute the Test & Roll sample size that maximizes profits
- How to estimate priors from your own data to help plan your Test & Roll
- How to analyze a Test & Roll experiment (It's easy!)

All you need to participate are basic R skills; we'll explain the rest. All code and data will be available via Github. Participants should install R, the rstan package and RStudio prior to the workshop.

Speakers:
- Elea McDonnell Feit is an Assistant Professor of Marketing at the LeBow College of Business at Drexel University. She develops data analysis methods to inform marketing decisions including designing new products as well as planning advertising campaigns.

- Ron Berman is an Assistant Professor of Marketing at the Wharton School at University of Pennsylvania. He focuses his research on online marketing, marketing analytics and the marketing actions of startup firms.

Getting there:
This event will be virtual and accessed via Zoom.

title: Webinar: Finding hidden topics in documents and other text analyses in R
description:
Roc√≠o Joo (University of Florida) will present a procedure to identify topics in a set of documents using an example of scientific articles in a field of science, movement ecology. To tell the whole story behind this case study, she will briefly explain how she addressed the identification of the papers of interest, show some code for downloading articles, extracting the text and finally perform data analysis. The latter will mainly consist of fitting Latent Dirichlet Allocation models to identify the latent or hidden topics.
If there will be time, she will also talk about other types of text analysis.

Roc√≠o is an ecological statistician, currently working as a postdoctoral research associate at University of Florida, investigating animal movement models, and other quantitative methods and R tools to analyze movement. She recently published a scientific article examining R packages for movement (https://arxiv.org/abs/1901.05935) and maintains a CRAN Task View of those packages (https://cran.r-project.org/web/views/Tracking.html) . She is part of R-ladies and participates in the Latin American R community.
https://rociojoo.github.io/

Please register here to receive the event link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/11bZ_ASK7VlAst7Rwxyt_H9ZYWHediDKgzGynP8bek1g .
