title: R Ladies Boulder Meetup #8: Virtual Happy Hour
description:
Hi Boulder UseRs! We want to reconnect with all of you! Join us for this month's **Virtual** R Ladies Happy Hour and join our new local Slack workspace!

We're hosting a virtual happy hour and meet-n-greet over Zoom (meeting ID 920 9713 0620). We are also starting a local R Ladies Boulder Slack workspace! These formats provide a unique opportunity to connect with other R users in the Boulder area through virtual introductions, breakout rooms, messaging, and group activities.

During the Zoom happy hour, we're planning to do both re-introductions and new introductions for those of you who have not attended an R Ladies Boulder in-person meetup. We are also planning a fun game and time for one on one and small group conversations in breakout rooms.

We hope you'll join us on Zoom and on Slack! To get access to the Slack workspace, please fill out this short Google form: https://forms.gle/j36YGxuNwN6zZ8nW7

title: useR! 2020 Tutorial: Seamless R and C++ Integration with Rcpp
description:
The RLadies chapters and the R User Group from Chile are very happy to announce that we will be hosting one of the useR! 2020 online tutorials (https://user2020.r-project.org/program/tutorials/). We will have the honor of having Dirk Eddelbuettel in our meetup, who will be running the tutorial: "Seamless R and C++ Integration with Rcpp" on July 14th, 15:00 UTC.

- Background

R has risen to become the lingua franca of statistical research and applications. At the same time, user demands on computing resources and performance have also increased. This is driven chiefly by the ever-growing size of datasets, and may sometimes be coupled with increases in their complexity. The quest for computing with larger datasets, as well as the ever-present desire to also compute "faster" make complementing the interpreted language-processing at the core of R with native code extensions a natural next step. The Rcpp package has become the principal venue for extending R with compiled code. It makes it easy to extend R with C or C++ spanning the range from simple one-liners to larger routines and bindings of entire external libraries.

- Workshop contents

We will motivate and introduce Rcpp as a natural extension to R that provides an easy-to-use and powerful interface. Helper functions and tools including RStudio will be used to easy creation of R extensions. Several examples will introduce basic use cases including writing code with RcppArmadillo which is the most widely-used package on top of Rcpp.

- Target Audience

R users wanting to go beyond R. Prior experience with compiled languages like C and C++ is helpful but not required.

- About the instructor

Dr Dirk Eddelbuettel has been a (co-)author and maintainer for the Rcpp project since its inception. He works as a senior "quant" in industry combining C++ and R for high-frequency data analysis and predictive models in finance, and teaches a class on Data Science Programming Methods as a Clinical Professor at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. He is author, co-author, or maintainer of sixty CRAN packages, an elected board member of the R Foundation, and a 25+ year contributor to Debian looking after 150+ packages including R.

- Attending the workshop

Please, read carefully the useR! 2020 Code of Conduct: https://user2020.r-project.org/codeofconduct/. All participants are required to agree to it.

The tutorial will start at 15:OO UTC and has a duration of two hours (+ a 10 minutes break). Check your timezone here: https://arewemeetingyet.com/UTC/2020-07-14/15:00/Seamless%20R%20and%20C%2B%2B%20integration%20with%20Rcpp

[UPDATED SECTION]

We'll be hosting the tutorial on Zoom. The link will be shared in the comments of this event half an hour in advanced. The meeting has a waiting room. We'll let everyone in at 15:00 UTC.

For the tutorial you'll need to install Rcpp from CRAN. You will also need a compiler. Please read sections 1.2 and 1.3 on the second page of the Rcpp FAQ to check specific recommendations for Windows/OSX/Linux users: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/Rcpp/vignettes/Rcpp-FAQ.pdf.

We'll be using RStudio. Is not a bad idea to have an rstudio.cloud account as back-up.

title: Functions Workshop!
description:
Hello R-Ladies

Are you an R beginner wanting to learn more about how to write functions? We got you covered!

Yuka Takemon will be running an online workshop on how to build functions. The workshop is geared towards beginners and we will try to keep it as interactive as possible.

Yuka is a PhD student in Genome sciences and technology at UBC and a certified Software Carpentry and RStudio instructor.

Workshop details:

Day and time: July 10th, 2020 at 6pm

Webinar link: RSVP to view

******
About the workshop & instructions:

-Please expect a hands-on session in a friendly and laid-back atmosphere where we all encouraged to learn together.
- All levels are welcome, but be prepared that we created this with beginners in mind. You should be familiar with R and RStudio.
- Install R: https://mirror.its.sfu.ca/mirror/CRAN/
- Install RStudio (choose the Desktop version): https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download

**********************IMPORTANT************************

1. Have your computer and a steady internet connection ready

2. If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

3. Who is this allowed to attend the workshop?
Everyone is welcome to join us at our events and to be a part of our mission to empower gender minorities with the skills and knowledge to code in one of the top programming language in data science, which is R.

To fulfill this mission we do ask participants to respect a focus on the encouragement and support for women and non-binary people during our events.

See you there!

Raissa, Lucia, Jasmine, & Lisa

title: R-Ladies Baltimore **virtual** ice-cream meetup!
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

Due to COVID-19 and social distancing, we will host a virtual meetup on Friday July 10, 2020 from 4-5:30pm where we will eat ice cream together and reflect back on the last year of R-Ladies Baltimore meetup events. There won't be any presentations, only fun networking and discussions and BYO ice cream!

Details on the location:
Zoom link will be sent to those who RSVP.

FAQ:
Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:
- If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:
email: bmore@rladies.org
twitter: @RLadiesBmore
website: https://rladies-baltimore.github.io
facebook: https://www.facebook.com/RLadiesBmore/
meetup: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-baltimore/

title: Supervised Machine Learning: Classification and Regression in R
description:
HannahÂ∞Ü‰ΩøÁî®‰∏§‰∏™Êï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÔºå‰∏ÄÁªÑËÇøÁò§‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰π≥ËÖ∫ÁôåÊ£ÄÊµãÂíåÂè¶‰∏ÄÁªÑÂ≠ïÂ¶áÁöÑÁ≥ñÂ∞øÁóÖËØäÊñ≠ÔºåÊù•Ëß£ÈáäÂ¶Ç‰Ωï‰ΩøÁî®ÂõõÁßçÁ±ªÂûãÁöÑÊú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†Ê®°ÂûãÔºöK-ËøëÈÇªÁÆóÊ≥ïÔºåÈÄªËæëÂõûÂΩíÔºåÂÜ≥Á≠ñÊ†ëÂíåÈöèÊú∫Ê£ÆÊûó„ÄÇ
Using two datasets, one for breast cancer detection in tumors and another for diabetes diagnosis in pregnant women, Hannah will explain how to use four types of machine learning models: K-Nearest Neighbors, Logistic Regression, Decision Trees and Random Forests.

Ëøô‰∫õÊ®°ÂûãÁöÑÂ§öÂäüËÉΩÊÄßÂíåÁÅµÊ¥ªÊÄß‰ΩøÂÖ∂Êàê‰∏∫ÂäüËÉΩÂº∫Â§ßÁöÑÈ¢ÑÊµãÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÁÆÄÂçïÈÄÇÂ∫îÊÇ®ÁöÑ‰∏ì‰∏öÊàñÂ≠¶ÊúØÁéØÂ¢É„ÄÇËÄåÊàë‰ª¨ÈÅáÂà∞ÁöÑËÆ∏Â§öÈóÆÈ¢òÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•ÊèèËø∞‰∏∫ÂàÜÁ±ª‰ªªÂä°ÔºåÊú¨ÊïôÁ®ãÂ∞ÜÂ∏ÆÂä©ÊÇ®Âà©Áî®Êú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†ÁöÑÂäõÈáèÊù•ÁêÜËß£ÊÇ®ÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÂπ∂Ê¥ûÊÇâÊâãÂ§¥ÁöÑ‰ªªÂä°„ÄÇ
The versatility, flexibility and surprising simplicity of these approaches make powerful predictive tools which you can adapt to your own professional or academic environment. Many problems can be described as classification tasks where an outcome either happens or it doesn‚Äôt. This tutorial will help you harness the power of machine learning to understand your data and get insight on the task at hand.

Êú¨ÊïôÁ®ãÂ∞ÜÂåÖÂê´ÁõëÁù£ÂºèÊú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†ÂèäÂÖ∂ÊñπÊ≥ïÁöÑÊèèËø∞ÊÄßÊ¶ÇËø∞Ôºå‰ª•ÂèäÂ∞ÜËøô‰∫õÊäÄÊúØ‰ªòËØ∏ÂÆûË∑µÁöÑÂä®ÊâãÁºñÁ®ãÁ§∫‰æã„ÄÇ
The tutorial will contain a descriptive overview of supervised machine learning and its methods, alongside hands-on coding examples for putting these techniques into practice.

ËØ•Ê¥ªÂä®Èù¢ÂêëÊâÄÊúâÁ∫ßÂà´ÁöÑRÁî®Êà∑„ÄÇÂàùÂ≠¶ËÄÖÂ∞ÜÂØπÁõëÁù£ÂºèÂ≠¶‰π†ÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúÂéüÁêÜÊúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÖ•Èó®ÊÄßÁöÑ‰∫ÜËß£ÔºåËÄåÊõ¥È´òÁ∫ßÁöÑÁºñÁ†Å‰∫∫ÂëòÂ∞ÜÂèóÁõä‰∫éÂÖ®Èù¢ÁöÑÂÆûÁî®Êï∞ÊçÆÂàÜÊûêÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÂåÖ„ÄÇ
Any level experience of R is welcome. Complete beginners will gain an introductory understanding to how supervised machine learning works and more advanced coders will benefit from a comprehensive practical toolkit for data analytics.

Êó†ËÆ∫ÊÇ®ÊòØÊú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†È¢ÜÂüüÁöÑÊñ∞ÊâãÔºåËøòÊòØÊÉ≥ÊèêÈ´òËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÁü•ËØÜÊ∞¥Âπ≥ÔºåÈÉΩ‰∏çË¶ÅÈîôËøáËøôÊ¨°Êú∫‰ºöÔºÅ
Whether you‚Äôre new to the machine learning field or looking to advance your knowledge, this is your moment!

title: Sesi√≥n 5 - Club de lectura - Happy Git with R, de Jenny Bryan
description:
Este mi√©rcoles nos reuniremos para la quinta sesi√≥n del club de lectura sobre el libro "Happy Git with R" de Jenny Bryan, actividad organizada de manera conjunta entre RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valpara√≠so y RLadies Concepci√≥n. "Happy Git with R" aborda el uso del sistema de control de versiones Git en conjunto con GitHub, R y RStudio. El libro est√° disponible de manera gratuita en: https://happygitwithr.com/

- ¬øC√≥mo funciona el club de lectura?
Divideremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. Cada sesi√≥n la liderar√° una relatora de nuestra comunidad.

Esta quinta sesi√≥n estar√° a cargo de Gabriela Sandoval (https://twitter.com/GabySandovalM) y Camila Molina (https://twitter.com/calmolinafe), Ingeniera Estad√≠stica de la Universidad del B√≠o-B√≠o. Abordaremos la secci√≥n VI del libro ("Daily Workflows"), en la que se muestran algunos flujos habituales de trabajo usando Git.

- ¬øQu√© necesito para participar?
Lo primero, es leer nuestro c√≥digo de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con √©l: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish

Lo segundo, es haber instalado ya Git en tu computador (https://git-scm.com/) y tener una cuenta en GitHub (https://github.com/). Es importante que est√©s segura que puedes utilizar Git desde RStudio. Si te resultaron las actividades de la sesi√≥n 3, entonces tienes todo lo necesario :)

Lo tercero, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicaci√≥n Zoom en tu computador. El d√≠a del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese d√≠a que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesi√≥n.

- ¬øQu√© pasa si no leo en ingl√©s?
¬°Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesi√≥n har√° una s√≠ntesis de los puntos m√°s importantes, as√≠ que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podr√°s aprender sobre este tema :)

- Estoy reci√©n aprendiendo sobre R, ¬øpuedo participar?
S√≠. Si bien el foco de estas sesiones no es programar en R, s√≠ es importante estar familiarizada con RStudio como entorno de trabajo. Si quieres, puedes revisar los v√≠deos de nuestro taller introductorio: https://github.com/rladieschile/taller-introductorio-mayo.

title: R-Ladies Ottawa - Summer Event (Zoom Edition)
description:
Come join R-Ladies Ottawa for a fun, interactive mini-coding session! For this event, we will be using data from the National Electronic Injury Surveillance System (https://www.cpsc.gov/Research--Statistics/NEISS-Injury-Data/). A cleaned-up version of the data can be found here (https://github.com/hadley/neiss) under data.

The goal of this exercise is to find meaningful relationships in the data. We can use these data to analyse all sorts of questions such as: Do forks cause more injuries than spoons? Which room in a house is more dangerous? And any other injury-related questions you can come up with...

Who is this for?
New and experienced R users alike! Let's learn together! All are welcome, including R-Ladies Ottawa members and R-Ladies from around the world.

What do I need?
You'll need a computer with videoconferencing capabilities and R.

Where will it take place?
**Please join us online via Zoom.** A link to join will be provided when you RSVP.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend *as guests* and must be accompanied by the R-Lady who invited them. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Mastering conditions! R Ladies NL Book Club - Advanced R Chapter 8
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).
Join us for our next meeting, in which Semiramis Castro will present the key points of Chapter 8: "Conditions". After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

And sign up to discuss one of the chapters at https://bit.ly/2QBYGEG!

ABOUT Semiramis
----------------------
Semiramis is a software developer/data scientist who codes mainly in R and Python. She's a recent PhD graduate from the National Autonomous University of Mexico with a focus on genomics of pathogenic bacteria and antibiotic resistance. Among the bacteria she studied are the emerging pathogen Acinetobacter haemolyticus and the deadly Acinetobacter baumannii.

ABOUT the chapter
----------------------
‚ÄúConditions‚Äù is the umbrella term used to describe errors, warnings, and messages. You‚Äôve certainly encountered these before, so in this chapter you learn how to signal them appropriately in your own functions, and how to handle them when signalled elsewhere.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Make sure to read the chapter in advance!
Note that Jitsi works best with chrome

LINK TO MEETUP
----------------------
https://meet.jit.si/rladiesnl_bookclub_chp8

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: Data Analysis with R - Class Project Selection
description:
I'm excited about our plan to enhance our programming skills through an online learning experience. As a group, we decided that we will focus on the "Data Analysis with R" course taught by Facebook instructors on the Udacity learning platform. This will ensure that we are all on the same page when we're ready to kick off our R-Ladies Dallas group project. The course is available for free at the following link: https://www.udacity.com/course/data-analysis-with-r--ud651

In this meetup, we will discuss any remaining questions that you may have about the course material. We will discuss options for our the class project.

*** CLASS PROJECT ***

To help us all get a firmer understanding of the concepts learned in the course, we have decided to work on a class project. Members have already started to post suggestions in the Slack channel.

To prepare for the event, please come with suggestions as to a specific dataset and use case that you think would be a good fit for our meetup project. An ideal project would allow us to grow our skills in most of these areas.

* Data loading
* Data manipulation
* Data visualization
* Single variable analysis
* Bivariate analysis

*************************

Please join the #learning channel in our R-Ladies Dallas Slack community so that we can discuss the course and ask/answer questions you may have about the material. Slack sign-up info provided below.

Agenda
------------------------------
Part 1: Lessons 1 - 4
Part 2: Lessons 5 - 8
Part 3: Lessons 9 - 10
Class Project < -------- this meetup event

Also, please take time to watch the videos and work through the exercises.

You are encouraged to click the link below to keep up with the webinar series and to join the Slack community. Slack is a messaging platform where we will share open job opportunities, free or low-cost online training materials, and R-Ladies group projects that will help you practice your R programming skills and develop a portfolio that could be used to showcase your skills to hiring managers.

Webinar + Slack sign-up: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdJhvSg-YrNYOrmju1yrXvYhFM7xMey1WpDq1NSGIp6x41VaA/viewform

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

About R-Ladies Dallas

R-Ladies Dallas welcomes members of all R proficiency levels, whether you're a new or aspiring R user, or an experienced R programmer interested in mentoring, networking & expert upskilling. Our non-profit, civil society community is designed to develop our members' R skills & knowledge through social, collaborative learning & sharing. Supporting minority identity access to STEM skills & careers, the Free Software Movement, and contributing to the global R community!

A local chapter of R-Ladies Global, R-Ladies Dallas exists to promote gender diversity in the R community worldwide. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R. As a founding principle, there is no cost or charge to participate in any of our R-Ladies communities around the world.

Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies, and by being respectful of the fact that this event is primarily for women/non-binary/female-identifying individuals.

We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community code of conduct. Please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct.

title: Show and Tell your R Code
description:
Have you been working on code you are particularly proud of? Or do you have some code that is driving you crazy?

Bring it along to this online event and share your triumph and/or frustration. Last time we learned about some hidden gems of dplyr, the magic of facet_wrap in ggplot and some super cool mapping using leaflet. Who knows what this session will bring!

This event will be via Zoom. Those who RSVP will receive the meeting link via email.

Check out some of the cool things we shared last month at our blog:

https://rladiessydney.org/post/2020-06-02-show-and-tell-june-2020/

title: Workshop about R Shiny
description:
R-Ladies Tunis in collaboration with ATIS are inviting you to their next meetup. Our online meetup will be about creating an #R #Shiny application.

title: Webinar: Working with text in R
description:
R-Ladies Tbilisi is pleased to host Ella Kaye.
Ella is a PhD student in Statistics at the University of Warwick. She followed her undergraduate degree in Mathematics and Philosophy with Masters degrees in History and Philosophy of Science and then Mathematics Education. Her interest in statistics was first piqued as a secondary school maths teacher when thinking about how to make the subject interesting for teenagers. An MSc in Applied Statistics followed (via a couple of years in working in market research), which lead to the PhD. Ella is an R enthusiast and package author, and the co-organiser of the Oxford R User Group.

R provides excellent tools for working with text. This tidyverse-based talk will provide an overview of some of the fantastic packages available for this, including (but not limited to) `stringr`, `RVerbalExpressions`, `tidytext` and `wordcloud`.

Please register here to receive the event link: https://tinyurl.com/tbsreg

title: Sesi√≥n 4 - Club de lectura - Happy Git with R, de Jenny Bryan
description:
Este s√°bado nos reuniremos para la cuarta sesi√≥n del club de lectura sobre el libro "Happy Git with R" de Jenny Bryan, actividad organizada de manera conjunta entre RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valpara√≠so y RLadies Concepci√≥n. "Happy Git with R" aborda el uso del sistema de control de versiones Git en conjunto con GitHub, R y RStudio. El libro est√° disponible de manera gratuita en: https://happygitwithr.com/
- ¬øC√≥mo funciona el club de lectura?
Divideremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. Cada sesi√≥n la liderar√° una relatora de nuestra comunidad.
Esta cuarta sesi√≥n estar√° a cargo de Riva Quiroga (https://twitter.com/rivaquiroga). Abordaremos las secciones IV y V del libro ("Git Fundamentals" y "Remote setups"). En ellas se abordan algunos conceptos clave (como qu√© es un commit, una rama y un repositorio remoto) y se explica c√≥mo configurar todo para poder colaborar en repositorios de otras personas sin problemas.
- ¬øQu√© necesito para participar?
Lo primero, es leer nuestro c√≥digo de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con √©l: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
Lo segundo, es haber instalado ya Git en tu computador (https://git-scm.com/) y tener una cuenta en GitHub (https://github.com/). Es importante que est√©s segura que puedes utilizar Git desde RStudio. Si te resultaron las actividades de la sesi√≥n 3, entonces tienes todo lo necesario :)
Lo tercero, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicaci√≥n Zoom en tu computador. El d√≠a del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese d√≠a que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesi√≥n.
- ¬øQu√© pasa si no leo en ingl√©s?
¬°Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesi√≥n har√° una s√≠ntesis de los puntos m√°s importantes, as√≠ que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podr√°s aprender sobre este tema :)
- Estoy reci√©n aprendiendo sobre R, ¬øpuedo participar?
S√≠. Si bien el foco de estas sesiones no es programar en R, s√≠ es importante estar familiarizada con RStudio como entorno de trabajo. Si quieres, puedes revisar los v√≠deos de nuestro taller introductorio: https://github.com/rladieschile/taller-introductorio-mayo
¬°Te esperamos!

title: Text Analysis with R
description:
In this meetup, you will learn all the fundamental steps of preparing and working with text data, such as full copies of famous literary works, song lyrics, or written/transcribed language. Using the examples of fairy tales, like the Grimm brothers collection and Alice in Wonderland, we will prepare and tokenize text data, extract the most frequent words, and display these results graphically. Then, we will explore methods for comparing more than one text source, finding words that are especially characteristic of a particular author/speaker/genre/chapter and comparing these to similar texts. After this meetup, you'll know how to compute word frequencies, identify unique word choices, calculate text-level measures such as lexical density, and create exciting visualizations of text statistics in R.

R-users of all levels can get something out of this Meetup, as we will walk you through every step from reading in data to tuning the graphical parameters. The only requirement is to have R and R Studio up and running on your computer. Main packages include: tidyverse, tidytext, gutenbergr, scales. Primary source: Text Mining with R by Julia Silge.

The meetup will be hosted online via Zoom -- the link will be sent out via Meetup shortly before the start time.

title: Virtual presentations - Spatial data analysis with R
description:
* What are we going to learn?
In this session I will talk about how I use R as a GIS for spatial data analysis. Reka will focus on data about crime, policing, and people's perceptions of place, her main areas of research. She will cover descriptive analysis, making thematic and point maps, and some spatial statistics. I'll be making use of packages such as sf, tmap, leaflet, spatstat and probably some more...!

* Who is going to present?
We have a special international guest!
Dr Reka Solymosi who is a Lecturer in Quantitative Methods at the University of Manchester at the Department of Criminology.
She is a member of the Software Sustainability Institute and an Honorary Lecturer at University College London. Her research focuses on making use of new forms of data to gain insight into people's behaviour and subjective experiences, particularly focusing on crime, victimisation, transport, and spatial research. She is also dedicated to promoting data literacy in social science study and practice.
For more info look at her beautiful R website https://rekadata.net/

* When are we meeting?
We would like to invite everyone to meet at 5:30 pm for a little virtual chat. An opportunity to say hi before starting the presentation at 6:00 pm.

************The presentation will start at 6:00 pm.************
* Where are we meeting?
We will meet virtually using Zoom, the link will be visible to people who RSVP.

* What else is needed?
This is a short presentation, so get your questions ready! we will aim to get those answered during the session.
If you want to install the packages from this presentation you can install them on the R console:

# Copy this code
install.packages('sf','tmap','leaflet','spatstat')

We look forward to seeing you there!

This might include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, social media, press releases and funding applications. If you do not wish to be recorded in these media please inform a community organiser.

Code of Conduct: R-Ladies Brisbane is dedicated to providing a welcoming and harassment-free event experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, or religion (or lack thereof). We do not tolerate harassment of event participants in any form, for any event venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.

Community Policies: Please note, cis men are welcome to join our meetups when they come as a guest of a woman participant or they bring a woman with them. We highly encourage speakers and teachers at R-Ladies Brisbane events to be of minority genders.

Find us on Twitter @rladiesbrisbane for more information on news, presentations and code!

Acum cƒÉ ajungem la a 10a √Ænt√¢lnire, vƒÉ √Æncurajez sƒÉ continua»õi cƒÉlƒÉtoria cu R »ôi sƒÉ √Æncepe»õi sƒÉ scrie»õi un blog cu R Blogdown! »òi pentru cƒÉ acest √Ændemn sƒÉ nu rƒÉm√¢nƒÉ doar vorbe, am invitat-o pe Rebecca sƒÉ vinƒÉ speaker, sƒÉ ne povesteascƒÉ »ôi sƒÉ ne inspire »ôi pe noi √Æn aceastƒÉ cƒÉlƒÉtorie.

Rebecca este data scientist »ôi educator de Data Science la UC Berkeley. Cercetarea ei este orientatƒÉ cƒÉtre sƒÉnƒÉtate. A scris un pachet R superheat »ôi este instructor certificat RStudio. »òi, desigur, scrie un blog grozav despre R »ôi Data Science:Data meets Narrative (www.rebeccabarter.com).

VƒÉ a»ôtept mar»õi, 30 Iunie la 7PM CET+1 pentru a descoperi mai multe despre R, Blogdown »ôi Rebecca Barter. √énregistrarea este gratuitƒÉ, dar obligatorie prin meetup.
Evenimentul va fi in limba engleza, vom folosi zoom, link-ul va fi actualizat √Æn ziua evenimentului. Evenimentul va fi √Ænregistrat, prin urmare, prin acceptarea √ÆnregistrƒÉrii la acest eveniment, sunte»õi de acord »ôi cu acest aspect.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
One blog I read at some point was saying: If you are an aspiring data scientist, write a blog (David Robinson). Then I started to read more data scientist blogs and discovered Rebecca Barter‚Äôs blog:Data meets Narrative!
Now that we are getting to our 10th meetup, I continue to encourage you to discover R and start writing a blog with R Blogdown! For this I invited Rebecca as featured speaker to share her experience and inspire us!
Rebecca is a data scientist and data science educator at UC Berkeley. Her research is focused on data science in healthcare. She wrote the superheat R package and is also an official RStudio instructor. And, of course, she writes a great blog about R and Data science: Data meets Narrative.

Join our meetup from 30th June, 7PM CET+1 to discover more about R, Blogdown and Rebecca Barter. Registration is free, but mandatory via meetup.
We shall meet on zoom, link will be updated in the day of the event. Your participation in this event, should include your approval for participation in this event that will be recorded.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CODE OF CONDUCT
Te rog, cite»ôte codul nostru de conduitƒÉ. RespectƒÉm »ôi ne dorim sƒÉ construim un mediu deschis »ôi inclusiv. De aceea, te rog cite»ôte codul nostru de conduitƒÉ √Ænainte de prima √Ænt√¢lnire: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

title: Beyond Beamer: Modern and Dynamic Presentations with R Markdown
description:
Emi Tanaka is an applied statistician whose primary interest is to develop impactful methods and tools that can be readily used by practitioners. Her research interests include mixed models and experimental designs, motivated primarily by the problems in bioinformatics and agricultural sciences. She recently joined as a lecturer at the Department of Econometrics and Business Statistics, Monash University. She is currently the Vice President of the Statistical Society of Australia Victoria Branch.

In this presentation, Emi takes us "Beyond Beamer: Modern and Dynamic Presentations with R Markdown". In many fields, scientific communications and publications are unimaginable without LaTeX. LaTeX, built on the TeX typesetting program, allows writing scientific documents with a markup language for structure and styling; capabilities for mathematical typesetting; ability to add cross-references and citations (though BibTeX or otherwise); and customisation through document classes, packages and macros. A particular LaTeX document class widely used for making presentation slides is Beamer. Beamer offers much of the same features as the original LaTeX in addition to special macros handy for presentation purposes and is used often by academics presenting mathematical content. Why then would we want another tool for presentation?

In this tutorial talk, Emi will talk about the capabilities and benefits of using R Markdown to make presentation slides based on the `xaringan` R-package. If you have two monitors or an extra laptop/desktop computer, then you are encouraged to try some coding yourself as you follow along with the talk.

Coding requirements: you will need to be familiar with R, have R and the xaringan & tidyverse R packages installed. It is preferable that you use RStudio IDE although not required.

title: Beyond Beamer: Modern and Dynamic Presentations with R Markdown
description:
What a treat!

An event with our beloved xaringan ninja- Dr Emi Tanaka! This event is co-organised with R-Ladies Canberra, SSA Canberra & SSA NSW and promises to be full of tips and tricks for how to make impressive RMarkdown-based presentations using xaringan.

Abstract: In many fields, scientific communications and publications are unimaginable without LaTeX. LaTeX, built on the TeX typesetting program, allows writing scientific documents with a markup language for structure and styling; capabilities for mathematical typesetting; ability to add cross-references and citations (though BibTeX or otherwise); and customisation through document classes, packages and macros. A particular LaTeX document class widely used for making presentation slides is Beamer. Beamer offers much of the same features as the original LaTeX in addition to special macros handy for presentation purposes and is used often by academics presenting mathematical content. Why then would we want another tool for presentation?

In this tutorial talk, I will talk about the capabilities and benefits of using R Markdown to make presentation slides based on the `xaringan` R-package. If you have two monitors or an extra laptop/desktop computer, then you are encouraged to try some coding yourself as you follow along with the talk.

Coding requirements: you will need to be familiar with R, have R and the xaringan & tidyverse R packages installed. It is preferable that you use RStudio IDE although not required.

Biography: Emi is an applied statistician whose primary interest is to develop impactful methods and tools that can be readily used by practitioners. Her research interests include mixed models and experimental designs, motivated primarily by the problems in bioinformatics and agricultural sciences. She recently joined as a lecturer at the Department of Econometrics and Business Statistics, Monash University. She is currently the Vice President of the Statistical Society of Australia Victoria Branch.

https://anu.zoom.us/meeting/register/tJYqcu6pqj0vG9I4fvMeFOo0OuA0URBAsSdY

title: Data Visualization - A Lesser Known Intro
description:
Hello RLadies!

We're back for our June virtual meetup!

Our speaker will be Amy Tzu-Yu Chen, Organizer of LA R Users Group.
***
Abstract: This is a practical introduction to data visualization. We will start with a brief history of data visualization. Then, I will share some of my strategy, process, and toolbox for data visualization. I will be using ggplot2, but the visualization skills you learn from this talk will be transferrable to other visualization packages.
***
Have a question about data visualization that you'd like Amy to cover? Post a comment on the event page!

The Zoom link is available once you RSVP.

As always we welcome people regardless of gender, but our group is intended for those who identify with a gender minority (trans women, cis women, trans men, non-binary, other). We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct.

See you there!
Amanda & Katie
@aktilot, @katie_leap

PS: We're always looking for presenters! If you're interested, please reach out to Amanda (amanda.k.tilot@gmail.com) or Katie (kleap@ucla.edu).

title: Social: movie night
description:
Watch a movie on zoom with RLadiesDC.

A young computer whiz kid accidentally connects into a top secret super-computer which has complete control over the U.S. nuclear arsenal. It challenges him to a game between America and Russia, and he innocently starts the countdown to World War 3. Can he convince the computer he wanted to play a game and not the real thing ?

The trailer is here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hbqMuvnx5MU

title: REMOTE: R Lightening Talks by R-Ladies
description:
!! Be mindful that only those participants that registered via Eventbrite (https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/remote-r-lightening-talks-by-r-ladies-tickets-106819837008) will receive the meetup Zoom link and will be able to join the event. Feel free to RVSP in the Meetup event page but also make sure you register on Eventbrite !!

Welcome to our first remote R-ladies London Meetup this year! After having to cancel our off-line event, now we're back with the same brilliant speakers and the new energy!

Join us in our remote meetup to learn tips and new skills in R with these easily digestible 15-minute long lightning talks! Also, we're not going to give up on the tradition of after-talks socialising, which will take place in the breakout Zoom rooms. So make sure you have some snacks, drinks and some cool webcam background on (behind) you!

Meetup ProgRam
19:30 - welcome to Rladies remote lightning talks!
19:40 - Megan Stodel: "Alternatives to iris"
20:00 - Jyoti Bhogal: "Exploring R Package: janitor"
20:20 - Fiona Tweedie: "Flexdashboards for understanding communities"
20:40-21:30 - Remote Socialising!

ABSTRACTS

Megan Stodel, "Alternatives to iris"
The commonly used iris dataset was first published by eugenicist R A Fisher. Let's use datasets that aren't connected with racists. This talk will offer alternatives, as well as highlighting lots of places to search when you need data for your projects, training and exploration.

Jyoti Bhogal, "Exploring R Package: janitor"
Most data projects usually begin with cleaning the data. It can take a lot of efforts, which can otherwise be useful while the acutual analysis. 'janitor' does exactly that when combined with 'here' and 'lintr'.
Let's explore this further!

Fiona Tweedie: "Flexdashboards for understanding communities"
This talk would introduce the use of Rmarkdown and flexdashboards to make official statistics such as Census or Deprivation data accessible to communities in a visual way. Particularly relevant with Census 2021 in the UK, and other countries, as well as Deprivation statistics just having been released in UK nations.

title: June meetup: Web Scraping using R
description:
We're in for a treat! Riva Quiroga, who is the organiser from RLadies Santiago & RLadies Valpara√≠so, has kindly agreed to join us for a session. She will be helping us understand how to do webscraping using R. I hope you will join us!

It's going to be an interactive session so please install the `tidyverse` and `janitor`. Please also try to setup an RStudio Cloud account, as Riva will share her code that way (https://rstudio.cloud/).

** Additional: Please also install the following packages - robotstxt and polite.
install.packages(c("robotstxt", "polite")).

It will be an online meetup, and I will post the link closer to the time.

Housekeeping:
Our code of conduct remains in place despite the online nature, and any contravention will be dealt with accordingly (https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/).

title: Sesi√≥n 3 - Club de lectura - Happy Git with R, de Jenny Bryan
description:
Este mi√©rcoles nos reuniremos para la tercera sesi√≥n del club de lectura sobre el libro "Happy Git with R" de Jenny Bryan, actividad organizada de manera conjunta entre RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valpara√≠so y RLadies Concepci√≥n. "Happy Git with R" aborda el uso del sistema de control de versiones Git en conjunto con GitHub, R y RStudio. Est√° disponible de manera gratuita en: https://happygitwithr.com/

¬øC√≥mo funciona el club de lectura?

Divideremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. En cada una de ellas abordaremos una de las secciones del libro. Cada sesi√≥n la liderar√° una relatora de nuestra comunidad.
Esta tercera sesi√≥n estar√° a cargo de Natalia Riquelme (@NatyRiquelmeS). Natalia es egresada de Administraci√≥n P√∫blica y Ciencia Pol√≠tica y actualmente trabaja como Colaboradora de Investigaci√≥n Cuantitativa en el proyecto IdeClab de la Universidad de Concepci√≥n. Durante la sesi√≥n abordaremos la secci√≥n III del libro, "Early Github Wins".

- ¬øQu√© necesito para participar?

Lo primero, es leer nuestro nuestro c√≥digo de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con √©l: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
Lo segundo, es haber instalado ya Git en tu computador (https://git-scm.com/) y tener una cuenta en GitHub (https://github.com/). En la sesi√≥n anterior abordamos c√≥mo hacer esto. Si no participaste, puedes revisar la primera parte del libro ("Installation") o la primera parte del video de la sesi√≥n pasada (https://github.com/rladieschile/club-de-lectura-happy-git).
Lo tercero, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicaci√≥n Zoom en tu computador. El d√≠a del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese d√≠a que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam). Usualmente compartimos el enlace 30 minutos antes de la sesi√≥n.

- ¬øQu√© pasa si no leo en ingl√©s?

¬°Puedes participar igual! La persona encargada de cada sesi√≥n har√° una s√≠ntesis de los puntos m√°s importantes, as√≠ que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podr√°s aprender sobre este tema :)

- Estoy reci√©n aprendiendo sobre R, ¬øpuedo participar?

S√≠. Te sugerimos, eso s√≠, revisar los v√≠deos de nuestro taller introductorio: https://github.com/rladieschile/taller-introductorio-mayo. Si bien el foco de estas sesiones no es programar en R, s√≠ es importante estar familiarizada con RStudio como entorno de trabajo.

¬°Te esperamos!

title: [Online event] Leading R Trainings & Prototyping with flexdashboards
description:
Our very own R-Ladies NYC board members Erin Grand and Kaelen Medeiros will give two short talks this month on leading R trainings for coworkers and flexdashboard!

This event will be hosted over Zoom, and the link will be available on this Meetup page and sent to all attendees at noon on the day of the event. *Note: Please check your spam or "Promotions" tab (if a Gmail user) for this Meetup announcement email if it does not appear in your inbox. Email nyc@rladies.org prior to the event if you do not receive it.*

Agenda (times approximate):
7-7:05 pm: R-Ladies NYC Announcements
7:05-7:30: "Leading R Trainings for Coworkers" by Erin Grand
7:30-7:55: "flexdashboard for Prototyping and Profit" by Kaelen Medeiros
7:55-8:15: Questions and wrap-up

--- Talk Abstracts ---

"Leading R Trainings for Coworkers"
Speaker: Erin Grand

Abstract: Erin has lead a set of 6+ R trainings for her coworkers ranging from "Introduction to Tidyverse" to "Using SQL and R Together." Leading such trainings, while using many of the same teaching skills, offer different challenges from teaching in a workshop or classroom setting. Erin will discuss the Why's, How's, and Best Practices she's learned over the past few years of leading trainings.

Bio: Erin works as a Data Scientist at Uncommon Schools where she trains coworkers in R as well as maintaining two R packages. Prior to Uncommon, she worked as a Data Scientist at Crisis Text Line, and a software programmer at NASA while completing her Data Science Masters at Columbia University. Before data science, Erin researched star formation and taught introductory courses in astronomy and physics at the University of Maryland.

"flexdashboard for Prototyping and Profit"
Speaker: Kaelen Medeiros

Abstract: The flexdashboard package allows you to build Shiny dashboards quickly using a RMarkdown document. This is advantageous in situations where you need to prototype a data product (often a dashboard or interactive report) and need to sell stakeholders on the value of the product built. Kaelen will talk about the basics of using flexdashboard and then give tips on utilizing it to build data product MVPs (minimum viable products) to communicate vision to stakeholders, plus discuss flexdashboard extensions and how to go about converting your flexdash to a Shiny dashboard (if you're ready or even need to!)

Bio: Kaelen is a data scientist at Medidata Solutions where they work as an R programmer on the microservices team. They've also worked at Spring Health, DataCamp, HERE Technologies, and have done a fair amount of R and Shiny consulting on the side. Kaelen was at various times a film theorist, preschool teacher, test prep tutor, videographer, and nanny before getting a MS in biostatistics from LSU Health Sciences Center in 2016 and starting to work as a statistician and data scientist. They have a cat named Scully and enjoy talking about podcats, aliens, data, and would love to see a photo of your pet if you're sharing.

---

R-Ladies is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Please take a moment to review the R-Ladies Global code of conduct (particularly if this is your first time attending!): https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct

title: R Ladies Netherlands Book Club - Advanced R Chapter 7
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).
Join us for our next meeting, in which Ale Hern√°ndez Segura will present the key points of Chapter 7: "Environments". After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Also feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

ABOUT Ale
----------------------
Originally from Mexico, Ale now lives in the Netherlands where she studied Molecular Medicine in Groningen. She now works as a Bioinformatician for the RIVM (National Institute for Public Health
and the Environment), where she does a lot of data engineering work. She has been working through the chapters of Advanced R and now is ready to tell you all about Environments in R.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Make sure to read the chapter in advance!

LINK TO MEETUP
----------------------
https://videobelpilot.surf.nl/rladieschapter7

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. Please read the Code of Conduct here: https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

title: Recent work in cluster trials and the representation of women in statistics
description:
Hi everyone,

Our June event will feature a seminar from the vice-president of the Statistical Society of Australia.

Jessica will discuss two topics that she has been interested in over the past couple of years. The first topic is the development of theory and tools for the design and analysis of longitudinal cluster randomised trials, and the second topic is how to make the statistics community more welcoming and inclusive.

Although individually randomised trials are the gold standard for assessing the impact of new treatments on patient outcomes, cluster randomised trials are necessary when testing the effect of healthcare provider-level changes on patient outcomes, for example the effect of a hospital-wide cleaning program on the rates of hospital-acquired infections. Longitudinal cluster randomised trials follow clusters over time, and clusters may switch between treatment groups during these trials. Cross-overs, stepped wedges and staircases are all variants of these types of cluster randomised trials, and they are being conducted with increasing frequency. However, many of the underlying statistical aspects of these designs remain under-explored. I‚Äôll discuss some of the work my group has been doing to increase our understanding of these trials and develop less burdensome trial designs, including our development of apps using the R shiny package.

In the second part of the talk, I‚Äôll discuss the work that is being done by the Statistical Society of Australia to prevent and respond to sexual and other forms of harassment within our community, and how we can increase the representation of women in statistics.

Looking forward to seeing you all!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Introdu√ß√£o ao R: passo a passo para iniciantes.
R Basic: Graphs (Part 2)
description:
These online events will cover the very basics of R and making graphs, which will be ideal for newcomers into the language.

This is a ‚Äúcode walk-through‚Äù; this means we have a code we follow and learn from directly. All the code and data used for this exercise will be provided after the session ends. This also means there is no need for you to run the code or write it down in your Rstudio script as we go along.

As you will learn fast, a lot of the code you will use in R is already written somewhere in the internet. The task for the user is to understand what is happening and learn how to consult the reference guides or how to ‚Äúgoogle‚Äù for answers.

In this session, we will focus on learning a couple of ggplot2 important concepts and making things pretty without so much effort.

Part II - Other types of graphs
Making things pretty: ggthemes, Rcolorbewer and patchwork

Requirements for part II:
Being able to create a scatterplot in R on your own using basic and ggplot2

Contact us here if you have any questions or comments before or after the event!

Find the event here: https://meet.jit.si/IntroToR

title: R-Ladies Baltimore -- Tidying data in R using the tidyr R package (Virtual)
description:
R-Ladies Baltimore (Bmore) is the local Baltimore chapter for the larger R-Ladies global organization (rladies.org) to promote gender diversity in the R community.

Before proceeding to data analysis and visualization the data must be in a manageable format that permits downstream processing. Datasets are often messy, but R fortunately provides packages and functions that ease up this fundamental tidying process.

The next event is Wednesday June 17, 2020 from 3-4:30pm (virtual meetup on Zoom). We will have an exciting presentation from McKinzie Garrison (https://bcmb.bs.jhmi.edu/people/students/mckinzie-garrison) on tidy data and the use of the tidyverse (https://www.tidyverse.org) to reshape datasets for analysis. We will discuss this in the context of the R for Data Science text and the tidyr (https://tidyr.tidyverse.org) package.

WHO is this for?
- If you are new to R & are short-budgeted on time!
- If you work with data in R that have characters or strings!
- If you want to work with data that have characters or strings, but not sure what to do with it!

*If any/all of this is true, this event might be for you!*

AGENDA
3:00‚Äì3:15pm Who we are | Announcements | What's next
3:15‚Äì4pm Presentation: Tidying messy data in R with the tidyr package
4‚Äì4:30pm Networking -- Any more Qs?

Details on the location:
The Zoom information will be sent to those who RSVP.

FAQ:
Q: Are men welcome to attend R-Ladies events?
A: Yes, men are welcome at this event. Our mission is to encourage more women and non-binary individuals to get involved in the R community. However, we ask that cis men come as guests of women and gender minorities to our events to promote a sense support and encouragement for women and gender minorities in the R community. Please help us by spreading the word about R-Ladies. Please also take the time to review our code of conduct before you attend: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

The term "women and gender minorities" is inclusive of individuals who identify as female (trans and cis), trans-men, non-binary, genderqueer, genderfluid, agender, intersex, and all minority genders).

Important to know:
- If this is your first R-Ladies event, please take a moment to review our R-Ladies Global code of conduct: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Finally, for more information:

facebook: https://www.facebook.com/RLadiesBmore/
meetup: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-baltimore/

title: Presenting like a Kunoichi with Xaringan
description:
All,

We are thrilled to have Earo Wang speak in June.

**Overview**

Kunoichi is a female ninja, and xaringan is a presentation ninja. In this talk, I'll share some lessons and thoughts on how to give a technical talk like a kunoichi. I'll introduce you to the xaringan package and friends to generate stylish and engaging html slides in R Markdown (i.e. reproducible).

**Bio**

Earo Wang is a lecturer in statistics at the University of Auckland. She's interested in statistical computing and graphics, exploratory data analysis, reproducible research, and R. She moved to Auckland this year from Melbourne, where she earned her PhD degree at Monash University. She has been awarded the John M. Chambers Statistical Software Award in 2019 for the R package tsibble.

**Online event**

This meeting will be hosted on Zoom. The meeting link will be sent out to those attending closer to the meetup date.

If you have any questions or problems, don't hesitate to contact Kim Fitter (main host) through meet-up!

As with all our meetups, please be aware of and read the Code of Conduct before attending.
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

title: Virtual Tidy Tuesday - Join and practice your R skills
description:
Do you want to practice your R-skills? Do you want to improve your abilities to clean, analyse and plot data?

Then this event is what you need! We will meet virtually and work with datasets provided by Tidy Tuesday, an initiative from R for Data Science which posts a new dataset weekly for practicing your R skills (https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday). Everyone can choose which dataset most interests them (the current one or past ones) and what they want to practice using it. We will do this together to have the opportunity to ask others and because coding together is fun!

At the end of the meetup, you'll have the chance to share what you've done with the group, post it to Twitter, and/or add it to your data science portfolio. In this way, we can all inspire each other with new methods, graphs, and data concepts, as well as each build our own skillset and data science portfolio.

R-enthusiasts of all levels are welcome, whether it's your first bar chart or you're basically a ggplot expert. Everyone will have the chance to work at their own level, ask/answer questions, and learn something new!

Feel free to take a look at the dataset(s) before we meet and bring ideas for yourself and others.

IMPORTANT:
Given the current situation the meetup will be hold virtually via Zoom, which you can download here: https://zoom.us/download
You will receive the link shortly before the meeting via e-mail. So check your inbox close to the start time. All meetings are monitored by two co-organizers to ensure a peaceful and secure meeting!

title: Building dashboards with flexdashboard and Shiny
description:
Dashboards are a great, user-friendly way for communicating insights and sharing results. They offer more flexibility than standard reports, and with R and Shiny they can be interactive and deliver complex results.

But where do you start? For many, grokking a Shiny app is no easy feat. This is where flexdashboard is incredibly valuable - all it needs is a little R code, mixed with some R Markdown, and voila! Flexdashboard also integrates with Shiny, so it's a great on ramp to learning more about reactivity.

This hands-on virtual workshop will give an overview of building dashboards, starting with RMarkdown and flexdashboard, and will end with some more advanced topics such as Shiny and HTML widgets.

All are welcome, and no Shiny experience is needed.

Dashboard: https://connect.rstudioservices.com/penguins/

Slides: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/16JtzkVJc2iLoFB_RmtgPhfJwpP0jh0iPOj9Ch4f48vE/edit?usp=sharing

RStudio Cloud Project: https://rstudio.cloud/project/1389836

Github repo: https://github.com/SamanthaToet/intro-to-flexdashboard

title: [MeetUp Online] Word2vec: um gostinho de um algoritmo para PLN
description:
Palestrante: Larissa Sayuri Futino Castro dos Santos
https://www.linkedin.com/in/larissa-sayuri-santos/

Mini bio: sou Bacharel em Estat√≠stica, mestre e Doutora em Estat√≠stica. J√° trabalhei com dados de fraudes no SUS e fiz parte de um grupo de estudos de alunos da UFMG com participa√ß√£o volunt√°ria (Stats4Good) em que nos dedicamos a compreender e quantificar a sub-notifica√ß√£o dos crimes de estupro em mulheres no Brasil, chamado GESEM. Hoje eu sou Cientista de Dados na maior plataforma de eventos do Brasil -a Sympla. Desde outubro sou colunista do radar Social Good Brasil. Eu adoro comunicar meus aprendizados (e dores, n√©?), desmistificando IA e me encantando no meio desse processo.

A primeira vez que eu ouvi falar de word2vec fiquei encantada! Era uma mistura de Matem√°tica com Lingu√≠stica que parecia uma forma intuitiva de modelar palavras e os seus significados. A ideia √© criar um embedding para uma palavra. Ou seja, represent√°-la como um vetor cuja dimens√£o √© definida pelo usu√°rio. O algoritmo concebe esse vetor aprendendo com os termos que est√£o em uma janela K de cada termo em an√°lise para que a representa√ß√£o vetorial traduza essa concep√ß√£o de contexto. E isso tudo √© feito com uma rede neural simples! Os algoritmos word2vec foram um divisor de √°guas da literatura porque permitiram mapear rela√ß√µes sint√°ticas e sem√¢nticas entre palavras. Al√©m da apresenta√ß√£o te√≥rica, vou falar sobre como avaliar a qualidade das embeddings obtidas al√©m de mostrar como faz√™-lo - facilmente- no R. Eu tenho certeza que estudar as word embeddings √© um jeito muito legal de come√ßar a estudar Processamento de Linguagem Natural!

description:

We will watch a great video by Jenny Bryan (https://jennybryan.org/ https://rstudio.com/resources/webinars/help-me-help-you-creating-reproducible-examples/), discuss it and learn how to tackle the mysterious error messages appearing on our screens.

description:

The title of the talk is: "Predicting heart attacks with electronic health records using supervised ensemble machine learning". The main packages involved are SuperLearner, ggplot2, h2o, iml, dbarts, ranger, mlr, and ck37r (GitHub).

The talk will start at 19.00 Tbilisi time - please register here https://bit.ly/3dJAgT9 to receive the meetup link. It will be distributed on the day of the meetup. The talk will be held in English.

title: Make your code more readable through best coding practices
description:
Have you ever looked at a script you wrote two years ago and been totally clueless? Or do you hesitate to share your code with others out of fear that it's too cryptic? Come and join our best coding practices workshop and learn how to make your code more readable!

Our speaker for this event is Arushi Garg. She is currently doing a PhD at the Donders Institute. In her past life, she worked in the software industry as a developer for three years, where she was required to follow rigorous coding standards. In this talk, she draws from her experience and will show us how we can employ such practices in science and make reproducibility and sharing a breeze.

PREPARATION
In order to get the most out of the meeting, we encourage you to upload a piece of your own code here before June 6th: https://www.dropbox.com/request/2v4Ragmq16eLIsx9AXwP
Arushi can then tailor her examples to your needs.

PROGRAMME
The event will start at 6pm. Join us on Zoom here: https://zoom.us/j/6903340773?pwd=b0M1c2wwVWNWenpjd0JhckJYWUhidz09

We're looking forward to seeing many of you virtually ;-)

CODE OF CONDUCT
Please take a minute to read our code of conduct -- we are committed to creating a safe and harassment-free environment
https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

R-Ladies events are always free and open to anyone who wants to participate as long as they follow the code of conduct. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities. Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R.

title: Shiny Enterprise Applications
description:
This month we are thrilled to have Dr. Connie Brett!

She will be talking about Shiny Enterprise Applications - considerations for success and tools to get it done right.

This will be a virtual meetup, so please scroll down to see the details about how to join the call!

Connie will present in detail the challenges of designing and developing shiny applications for larger scaling and sharing (for example in an enterprise setting). She will talk in detail about scoping, planning, and tools for meeting these needs. The periscope R package will be introduced and used in a demonstration to show you how to start a shiny application that makes meeting these challenges easier so you can focus on the content of your application.

Connie is the CEO, Founder, and Principal Data Scientist of Aggregate Genius Inc. located in British Columbia, Canada. She is responsible for analytics oversight as well as delivering on the corporate vision backing the "Know what you KNOW" philosophy of the company. She delivers demonstrations, concept proofs, statistical models, feasibility studies, and productionalized architectures centered around big-data and analytics products.

Before founding Aggragate Genius, she received her B.A from Knox College followed by an M.S. and Ph.D. from The Ohio State University in computational chemistry. So even though she's now settled in Canada, she has some roots in Columbus, OH! After 20 years focusing on producing solid analytical models, software and visualization tools, as well as custom IT solutions architecture, she also became an entrepreneur with Aggragate Genius. We asked her to also talk a little bit about her career path as well and will provide some time for career related questions from the audience.

title: Data Science by R-Ladies and Prometeia[Webinar]
description:
We are back again! In this particular situation, like other meetups groups we are moving our events to online version. This time we proudly are hosting an event with Prometeia with super interesting topics:

Please register in the event by this link:
https://register.gotowebinar.com/register/5263059103792573710
(The webinar link will be shared after registration).

Agenda of event:

5:00PM - 5:15PM: Opening and Data Science team introduction by Oriana Angelucci (Senior Analyst)
5:15PM - 5:45PM: Focus 1 - Business Translator: your ally to avoid Mexican standoffs in business contexts by Marilena Di Bari (Senior Analyst)
5:45PM - 6:15PM: Focus 2 - The riddle of the Sphinx in the era of AI: answering the ‚Äúwhys‚Äù of your results through SHAP by Martina Dossi (Junior Analyst), Giulia Gavazzi (Junior Analyst)
6:15PM - 6:30PM: Q&A session
6:30PM - 6:45PM: Closing remarks by Maddalena Amoruso (Partner)

ABSTRACT - FOCUS 1

Business translators have a huge impact on the success of business projects. Their job is to follow a data science project from the early design until the end: to identify its business requirements, translate them into analytical problems and support all the parties involved in arriving towards a satisfactory solution... and on time. In this talk, we will go through the nitty-gritty of business translation and we will show how some of the tricks could benefit all of us working in data science, regardless of our role.

ABSTRACT - FOCUS 2

In the last decade, the complexity of predictive models has increased. This trend has favored accuracy and prediction rates at the expense of interpretability. However, the ability to correctly interpret the output is extremely important to justify future actions. Many methods have been proposed to deal with the need for understanding black boxes. SHAP is a powerful framework based on game theory that allows interpreting any machine learning model. In this talk we will first define the basic concepts of model interpretability and explainability and discuss the importance of explainable machine learning models, then we will introduce SHAP through a practical case study.

Speakers:
*Oriana Angelucci is a senior business translator. She worked in market research and now focused on data-driven transformation of Customer Relationship Management processes through the application of advanced analytics.

*Marilena Di Bari, Ph.D. is a senior business translator. She previously worked in the fields of computational linguistics and translation, and is now involved in data-driven projects of Customer Relationship Management and Bancassurance.

*Martina Dossi is a statistician and junior data scientist. She worked in the area of risk management and is now involved in text analytics-based solutions within the credit risk area.

*Giulia Gavazzi is a statistician and junior data scientist. She is mainly involved in machine learning solutions within the areas of operational and credit risk and prepayment risk modelling for ALM.

*Maddalena Amoruso is a partner in Prometeia. She manages the Data Science division, which aims to foster and support customers' digital transformation needs.

Looking forward to e-meet you all!

title: Sesi√≥n 1 - Club de lectura - Happy Git with R, de Jenny Bryan
description:
El mi√©rcoles 10 de junio damos inicio a nuestro primer club de lectura, organizado de manera conjunta entre entre RLadies Santiago, RLadies Valpara√≠so y RLadies Concepci√≥n. Este formato tiene por objetivo revisar en forma detallada libros de inter√©s para la comunidad de R que permitan adquirir habilidades intermedias o avanzadas en temas de an√°lisis y comunicaci√≥n con datos. Este primer club de lectura estar√° centrado en el libro "Happy Git with R" de Jenny Bryan (https://twitter.com/jennybryan). El libro aborda el uso del sistema de control de versiones Git en conjunto con R y RStudio. Est√° disponible de manera gratuita en: https://happygitwithr.com/

¬øC√≥mo funciona el club de lectura?
Divideremos la lectura del libro en seis sesiones. En cada una de ellas abordaremos una de las secciones del libro. Cada sesi√≥n la liderar√° una relatora de nuestra comunidad.

Esta primera sesi√≥n estar√° a cargo de Macarena Valenzuela Beltr√°n, candidata a Doctora en Ciencia Pol√≠tica de la Universidad Diego Portales. En ella abordaremos la secci√≥n I del libro: "Installation". Aprenderemos de manera introductoria c√≥mo funciona un sistema de control de versiones, c√≥mo instalar Git, c√≥mo crearse una cuenta en Github y c√≥mo usar un cliente de Git como GitKraken.

¬øQu√© necesito para participar?
Lo primero, es leer nuestro nuestro c√≥digo de conducta. Es requisito para asistir estar de acuerdo con √©l: https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct#spanish
Lo segundo, es asegurarte que puedes utilizar la aplicaci√≥n Zoom en tu computador. El d√≠a del taller te enviaremos el enlace para unirte (chequea ese d√≠a que el mensaje no se haya ido a la carpeta de spam).
Lo tercero, es crearte una cuenta en RStudio Cloud (https://rstudio.cloud/). A trav√©s de esa v√≠a compartiremos el c√≥digo que se escribir√° en algunas de las sesiones de esta serie.

¬øQu√© pasa si no puedo leer en ingl√©s?
Puedes participar igual. La persona encargada de cada sesi√≥n har√° una s√≠ntesis de los puntos m√°s importantes, as√≠ que incluso si no puedes revisar el libro, podr√°s aprender sobre este tema.

Estoy reci√©n aprendiendo sobre R, ¬øpuedo participar?
S√≠. Te sugerimos, eso s√≠, revisar los v√≠deos de nuestro taller introductorio: https://github.com/rladieschile/taller-introductorio-mayo.

¬°Te esperamos!

title: R Ladies Netherlands Book Club - Advanced R Chapter 6
description:
Hi everyone,

The R Ladies chapters of the Netherlands are partnering up and are hosting an online book club. As a first book, we chose to read and discuss Hadley Wickham's Advanced R book (https://adv-r.hadley.nz/).
Join us for our next meeting, in which Josephine Daub will present the key points of Chapter 6: "Functions". After that, we'll try some exercises together and help each other clear up any doubts and get over any hurdles :)

The link to the meeting is here: https://meet.jit.si/RLadiesNLAdvancedR

You can find the full schedule and more information here: https://github.com/rladiesnl/book_club

Also feel free to sign up to discuss one of the chapters there!

ABOUT Josephine
----------------------
Josephine is a computational biologist with special interest in evolutionary and cancer genomics. She is currently working as a postdoc at the Princess M√°xima Center for Pediatric Oncology where she studies genetic interactions in childhood tumors. Josephine has programmed in many languages but the last years mainly in R. She knows that there is a lot to learn and working through the first chapters of the Advanced R book has already answered many questions she had about R's peculiarities.

REQUIREMENTS
----------------------
Make sure to read the chapter in advance!

CODE OF CONDUCT
----------------------------
We expect all attendees to abide by our Code of Conduct. Anyone who violates this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition. We are emphatically queer and trans-friendly. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn.

title: June Virtual Event - Intro to R & Data Science Lighting talk
description:
R-Ladies Philly is pleased to host a virtual data science event to help you get started using R! This workshop will introduce the fundamentals and help you get started.
Before the workshop, please install R and RStudio. Tess has provided detailed instructions here: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_philadelphia/blob/master/2020_06/R%20Studio%20Download%20Tutorial%202020.pdf

Agenda:
6:00: Welcome
6:05-6:20: "6 R Packages to Add to Your Workflow" by Jinyi Kuang
6:20-8:00: Intro to R workshop by Tess Cherlin

About our speakers:
Jinyi Kuang is a research specialist at the Center for Social Norms and Behavioral Dynamics (CSNBD) and a Ph.D. student in Psychology at the University of Pennsylvania. She received a B.S. from the University of Maryland, College Park in 2016. Her research focuses on how people's social beliefs and expectations impact behaviors. Specifically, she is interested in how people perceive what is typical or desirable in a social group, how people make inferences of social information, and how individual differences in these inferences impact judgments and decision makings. She hopes these findings could inform intervention design to nudge people do good. Jinyi is currently working with CSNBD to assess social determinants of sanitation behaviors in India. She will present her recent research and how she uses R for her research workflow.

Tess Cherlin is a PhD student at Thomas Jefferson University in the Genetics, Genomics, and Cancer Biology program and does her research in the Computational Medicine Center. She uses computational and wet lab methods to study small noncoding RNA profiles in health and disease contexts. Tess had no experience with R (or coding) when she began her PhD but has found R to be very learnable and incredibly useful for her data analysis. She looks forward to guiding R-Ladies beginners through a hands-on Intro to R workshop!

Code of conduct:
https://rladies.org/code-of-conduct/

Learn more about R-Ladies Philly:
https://www.rladiesphilly.org

title: SatRday Concepci√≥n, Chile
description:
SatRday es una conferencia de bajo costo que se enfoca en R y el evento principal se lleva a cabo un s√°bado. La naturaleza de bajo costo y de fin de semana del evento significa que es accesible para una amplia gama de personas que de otra manera no podr√≠an asistir.
La idea es que el aprendizaje sobre R sea accesible y local, nuestro enfoque est√° en llevar R a las personas en lugar de hacer que las personas vayan a R. Esto ayuda a construir una comunidad local diversa y creciente de usuarios de R.

FECHA Y LUGAR POR CONFIRMAR. PRONTO M√ÅS INFORMACI√ìN.

title: Ciencia de Datos aplicada al desarrollo de AgTech
description:
Ciencia de Datos aplicada al desarrollo de AgTech

El sector agropecuario y agroindustrial tiene el gran desaf√≠o de satisfacer las demandas de un mundo con mayor necesidad de alimentos que se produzcan cuidando la salud, el ambiente y los recursos naturales. Este objetivo de producir m√°s y mejor, con los mismos o menos recursos, se puede abordar desde dos √≥pticas: por un lado, el desarrollo y masificaci√≥n de m√°quinas precisas y por el otro, el aumento en el uso y explotaci√≥n de datos e informaci√≥n que ya se generan (o generar√°n en el futuro cercano) para mejorar la toma de decisiones en el manejo agropecuario. Enmarcada en esta segunda l√≠nea, la ciencia de datos tiene mucho que aportar y en esta charla se presentar√°n una serie de aplicaciones que llevo adelante con mi grupo de trabajo y las herramientas que usamos para desarrollarlas.

Sobre la expositora:

"Soy investigadora en INTA (Instituto Nacional de Tecnolog√≠a Agr√≠cola) y me dedico a aplicar la ciencia de datos al sector agropecuario. Trabajo en una Estaci√≥n Experimental Agropecuaria, por lo que mis desarrollos y soluciones est√°n relacionados con la realidad productiva de la provincia de La Pampa, donde vivo con mi esposo y mis dos hermosos hijos.
Disfruto mucho ense√±ando, as√≠ que paso parte de mi tiempo impartiendo cursos y escribiendo material de ense√±anza sobre mis temas de investigaci√≥n. Soy cofundadora de MetaDocencia, una organizaci√≥n educativa abierta, gratuita, dirigida por voluntarios y sin fines de lucro. Desde 2019 soy RStudio Certified Trainer.
Adem√°s, soy muy activa en la Comunidad R: formo parte del Equipo Global de R-Ladies y soy fundadora y organizadora del Cap√≠tulo de R-Ladies Santa Rosa. Soy cofundadora y presidenta de LatinR y form√© parte del equipo que tradujo diversos materiales de R al espa√±ol (ej: R para Ciencia de Datos, RStudio Cheat Sheets).
Relaciono mi trabajo en INTA con mi trabajo en la Comunidad R buscando hacer que mi ciencia sea lo m√°s reproducible y abierta posible utilizando software libre. Soy presidenta, desde 2016, del Congreso Argentino de Agroinform√°tica (CAI) y presidenta general en 2020 de las Jornadas Argentinas de Inform√°tica e Investigaci√≥n Operativa (JAIIO)"

No puedes perderte esta charla !
Te esperamos ! :)

title: Virtual presentations - Data Manipulation with dplyr
description:
* What are we going to learn?
"dplyr" is a powerful R-package to manipulate, clean and summarise unstructured data. In short, it makes data exploration and data manipulation easy and fast in R. In this talk, you will see basic uses of "dplyr" and how you can use it in your data exploratory tasks.

* Who is going to present?
Let's welcome Ruth Chirinos our guest presenter. She is a System Engineer and Manager of Information Systems with a strong knowledge in software development for the government and telecommunication enterprises. She is an active member of diverse communities: Java Users Group La Paz, Ocean Protocol, City.AI and Google Developer Group (GDG), R-Ladies La Paz and Women in Data Science (WiDS).

* When are we meeting?
We would like to invite everyone to meet at 8:30 am to share your morning coffee or tea cuppa with us virtually. An opportunity to say hi and chat before starting the presentation at 9:00 am.

************The presentation will start at 9:00 am.************

* Where are we meeting?
We will meet virtually using Zoom, the link will be visible to people who RSVP.

* What else is needed?
This is a short presentation, so get your questions ready! we will aim to get those answered during the session.
If you want to use the dplyr package from this presentation you can install it on the R console:

# The easiest way to get dplyr is to install the whole tidyverse:
install.packages("tidyverse")

# Alternatively, install just dplyr:
install.packages("dplyr")

# or install the developer version
install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("tidyverse/dplyr")

we look forward to seeing you, if you have any questions please get in touch.
R-Ladies Brisbane
